LUb53R4GZBhcrheeSp-fhA.review_text: AWESOME!! 130am stop, great food, 5star service, go eat there... nuff said.

KfJJUPwrVjE1wmiZ6apbEQ.review_text: Been eating here for 2 years now.  I've withstood every price increase, portion size decrease, and paid every stupid SF food tax to eat here late nights after my munchies have been activated.  The food is good, yes. The cheesesteak simplistically tasty, and the garlic chili cheese fries being a shoryuken in my mouth.  But sometimes, enough is enough.  I pay SOOOO much to eat here and then I come home to find a garlic chili cheese fries that only fills half the Chinese to-go container? And an inch of cheese on top to mask the kids' meal-esque size portion of the hot potato?  Criminal. Straight Michael Jackson Criminal. Moonwalk over my face after taking my money criminal. Criminale.  Food's good, but the money feels moreso taken away from me ala Tony Soprano.  I'm just emotional right now.

WCiGrGn89yBrVbqXRkejwg.review_text: The best cheesesteaks I've ever had in San Francisco and some of the best overall, it's much better than Jake's Steaks and I love how they have a number of different cheeses to choose from, the cheese and garlic fries are great, their pizza is good too but I've had much better pizza elsewhere though and I come here for the cheesesteaks and fries anyway. I always get the large cheesesteak with cheese, onions and mushrooms and cheese or garlic fries and a coke. If you love cheesesteaks and you are in the city, come here!!.

YwaKGmRNnSa3R3N4Hf9jLw.review_text: At first, I thought the cheese steak was pretty ordinary.  Then I hit a juicy section of meat and I was immediately converted.  I'm not from Philly, but that is one of the tastiest cheese steaks I've ever had.  Mind you, I had the "California Cheese Steak" which adds lettuce and tomato to the mix.  Overall, this place is a great choice after a late night out.

Y-wK2g0RBQzDnE9-dENJ7g.review_text: Buster's has great cheesesteaks, quick service + is relatively cheap for a very satisfying meal.  Would definitely recommend the jalapeno cheesesteak if you like something with a little zing. The chicken cheesesteak is a little disappointing (I'm from near Philly, though) so wouldn't recommend that.   Beware, you'll probably need to find a place to eat outside of the restaurant - there's only seating for ~10 people inside and are a few tables outside.

1HcDo4W60_vWGI0Hj1sEag.review_text: As far as anything open past 12 or 2am, this place really is as good as it gets. Who doesn't want a bad ass Bacon Burger after hours...it's almost 3am and I'm considering getting dressed just to go fetch a cheese steak RIGHT NOW.

4IjzfbO7XKFNWWVufHNhww.review_text: Maybe I love this place because of its garlic fries, maybe not. I love the fact that they sometimes play Family Guy on this big television behind the counter that you can watch while you wait. They also let you load up with condiments to go and they have a variety. It isn't the cheapest place but the portions are big so you can split.... I suggest the Philly with provolone, onions and cherry peppers!

3ICbnRiCa_0nlMUhGzbSwQ.review_text: Please select below on how to comment:  1. If you like, give it a thumbs up.   2. If you don't like, give it a thumbs up anyway.   3. If you're not sure, give it two thumbs up.   4. And if you feel you're in control, post a comment on how you real like BUSTER'S.   Last but not less ENJOY!!!

pQqM6aKaHf6AstBRzP7oRg.review_text: Sober or drunk, this place serves up some delicious sandwiches.  I mean, steak, cheese, onions, add some sweet cherry peppers, and some quality bread.  If you're really bad you'll get some jalapeno up in the mix.

mfw2o3TA7RSEaH2sj4uWZw.review_text: This is the only cheese steak shop that my husband likes. :) He refuses to get any other cheese steak shop's food. If we go to SF, this is the spot we gotta stop at to eat. BEST cheese steak I've ever had. A few things to note: parking is ridiculously hard to find near it. Unless you're lucky, you might have to park farther away and walk to it. Secondly, I believe its CASH ONLY. There's an ATM there is the shop I think but they definitely do NOT take card.

iaO3j9wqrZNbp-8orcILJQ.review_text: This is a great place to satisfy those late night hunger pangs.  I was content to head home after a night of light drinking, but one enlightened person in the group suggested we swing by this place for a late night bite.  The place was a zoo so to speak, but our friend braved the crowds to place an order for the group.  After what seemed like an eternity, he emerged from the restaurant, food in hand.  We set the bags down on one of the outside tables and tore into them like a pack of hyenas.  The cheesesteaks were delicious.  The fries weren't too bad either.  Just what the doctor ordered ... that and a 5 mile run the next day.  Next time, I will have to try one with Cheez Wiz.  It looked so good.

UwEglXndKZmv-maqxk49zQ.review_text: It's as close to a real cheesesteak as SF has yet to offer.  Nothing fancy, tiny corner place with a good sandwich.

0xFhOntmgtgpukANn6UMvA.review_text: Wow came back and the girl with hardly any eyebrows tried pocketing $15 of mine. Nice one.

eazbdyhPIF5wYnDKFJh0rA.review_text: Being from the East Coast, a Cheesesteak sandwich is very important. Buster's delivers. It felt very good.

jrL3HiHtQ12OwplHUQG3cQ.review_text: i love this place!!!!!!!!! it is mighty delicious, i had philly cheesestalk, with grilled onions,provolone cheese and light mayo on it. and side of cheese fries (cheat day)  Liv & Love

fqcCjDdBSzW8QxsbeN8YCw.review_text: Great spot to get a cheesesteak at anytime of the day. When your drunk it's especially good!!! I have most of the cheesesteaks on the menu, and the hoagie is probably my favorite. If you like chili, the chiladelphia is a must. Get garlic fries on the side, and ask for extra garlic, and your breath will be stinky for days, but its all worth it.

exygIMUwWiMg8HU4L_lNIw.review_text: Ordered for takeout, 1 x large classic Philly Cheesesteak, no extras, and a garlic fries.  The Cheesteak sandwich was great. Very rich taste (I got cheez whiz), quality steak meat, and a good bun.  Unfortunately the garlic fries were incredibly soggy and untasty...too bad.

PnviFbcnJ8t8NBL1jaN8Vw.review_text: This is not a philly.  When I drink, I think everything I eat is mindblowing and I'd rate it 5 stars,  but this place... this place was terrible.  I wouldn't come back here even after a night of drinking, and that's saying a lot because I'll eat anything after a few drinks.

pPe_Hsm44QOar_dYYFKy1A.review_text: Pros: Mushroom swiss cheesesteak, garlic fries Cons: None that I can think of  After a night of drinking, it was time for a late night snack. Good thing Buster's was down the street. I ended up getting the mushroom swiss cheesesteak and an order of garlic fries. Both were really good. The bread on the cheesesteak was amazing. Nice and soft. The mushrooms and the beef was great too. I was also a big fan of the garlic fries. If you like garlic, you'll love these fries.  Great place for late night eats.

qe7abxUrWB6_yjpE3BlczQ.review_text: Just had my first Philly Cheesesteak from Buster's. Very good. Mine had the Provolone cheese and there was just the right mixure of cheese, meat and onion (although I would not have minded more onion).  The boss paid for this one which made it even better but would drop my own cash for one also!

nQYU6HNWGm1sz0rCjvxRxQ.review_text: I'm not going to come all the way up here to SF for this, but if I'm ever in the area and want a quick, yet satisfying bite, this might be where I'd end up. No table space and minimal counter space - you're definitely not meant to sit here and chat for hours with your buds. It's a "get in, order food, bolt food, get out" type of place.   I shared a large philly cheese steak this evening with cheese wiz as the cheese of choice. Pretty delicious, though I think I still prefer the "traditional" Swiss cheese that I'm used to on my cheesesteaks. The meat was sliced thin and super tender though, so I was a happy camper.  Would love to try some of the other variations next time!

Zk0RGkhWxcSlbsRzpu3DmA.review_text: The best cheesesteak in San Francisco.  And probably better than Pat's or Gino's in Philly, though it's been a while since I've been there.  The small cheesesteak is enough for one and a large can be split two ways if you get some fries to go with it.  You can't go wrong with dinner for one at $6.50 and dinner for two for a few dollars more.

ILz8ApVEgTqbv5LnC6PyuA.review_text: It definitely doesn't compare to Pat's in Philly. BUT, it is pretty damned good. The fact that its also a couple blocks from my place makes it very tempting every day when I pass by. The Cheesesteak is a little overpriced. Haven't tried the pizza, not sure why I would though when Golden Boy is just a block away.

1aIeLV989fcYInK6tPA8_A.review_text: I don't remember every going to this place before but see it every other day since I live in North Beach. I decided to try it out. my wife did bring home a Philly-cheese steak once and it was very good. I like hamburgers so I ordered one and it was delicious and a good size for under$5.00. if your near Broadway and Columbus this is a nice place to stop and grab a burger. they do have seating but few and lunch time it gets busy.

wJYFi-F9XGnOEjokwLE3Zg.review_text: We were working crazy hours opening the Mercato (yelp.com/biz/buyers-best…) up the street, and Buster's was a welcome surprise-- the mushroom cheesesteak was overflowing and the garlic fries were buried.  I brought back a pair of sandwiches for the team, we cut them up and devoured.  It was awesome.

ar7M5QPvtF8Is2VcK8e6OA.review_text: Go to Buster's if you want a *real* burger. Between a hearty bun, I found real steak meat, a lot of onion & tomato, lettuce, plenty of pickles, and cheese. They have some good sauces. I doused my burger with some BBQ. Garlic fries were a little mushy, but were strongly flavored.  Definetely want to go back to try a cheesesteak.

a6cza8qMp48gKrSUw40GMw.review_text: Incredibly satisfying cheesesteak, especially since you're likely to be eating late night and after a few beers.

piVFaYVJKrYPlJj2F0I1Xg.review_text: get yours with the cheese whiz!!!  if you do get the garlic cheese fries, make sure you have a drink, they are salty cheesey goodness.   perfect for a 2AM need to get sober meal :)

u0RODdot28dirEIS1k3iMQ.review_text: I think this is as close as you can get to Philly's Pat's & Geno's in San Francisco. Gotta get the cheesesteak wit. So good. I'm salivating now.

OW5dJo-E6j-WaVwyFdwHJA.review_text: Wow, came here for the 4th of July before staking out a spot at Pier 39. What can I say, definitely the best cheeseteak I've had. The sandwiches are big, delicious, and get all over the place! Their fries have a nice crisp to them too, whether you order plain or garlic.  Different styles of sandwich with different ingredients in each one make for interesting tastes. Don't worry though, you can still get the classic cheesesteak you know and love.

E5vMbJUjOxjr4AZ8y66trw.review_text: This is the place to go if you are looking to blow out an artery after a night of wandering the neighborhood's establishments of drink.  the burgers and the cheesesteaks are exceptional.  Buster's french fries are good, even better when drenched with chili and cheese.  no frills counter seating, limited bottled beer selection, and a prime view of a kitchen that looks as if its equipment were dropped by a child from above like toy playing blocks adds up to the dive bar equivalent of a mom and pop sandwich shop.  The best way to experience buster's is to get a seat at the bar in the corner order your food and a beer and then sit back and watch the show in front of the flat top as the cook goes into overdrive.  on a busy night it's poetry in motion.  Buster's i know thee well.

l7V5w_vf9xv74As3abZukA.review_text: I was sitting outside of Buster's one afternoon before going into work- smoking, waiting for my large, steak, no onion, provolone, mushroom & jalapeno sandwich when a gentleman approached me and asked, "is it true?" pointing at Buster's sign claiming to be the Best Cheesesteak. I replied, "I can't attest to their being the *Best*, but I will tell you, I work in North Beach at least 4 times a week, and when I'm in the neighborhood, I always grab a cheesesteak from Buster's." They use deliciously seasoned steak meat that they chop up on the grill just enough-without turning it into "ground beef"-like consistency like other shops. And if you're there earlier in the day, the bread is soft and fresh. Another plus, the cheesy techno music videos they play on a precariously positioned big screen TV over the grill.

IyzrYa2OcliXaJYkUZxOdw.review_text: awwww Midnight Philly Cheesesteaks are mmmmmmm mmmm good!  I crave this delicious delight that you create your own or choose one of the specialties on the menu.  This place is open really really late or until early in the morning.   Come here after a great show at Bimbos or one of the cool bars here in North Beach, or if you insist the strip clubs too :) .  They play fun music in here and the staff is fun!

R2p221627ZK5IhFBVI0OzQ.review_text: I fell in love with the cheese fries here. This is the perfect place for an after drinking snack, though sometimes there's drunk obnoxious people in here (be careful because it might be yourself if you think about it too long..). I love the hot dogs here too. I've yet to try a burger or cheesesteak here so I'll still have to go back for those.

4BxI8ZBIpJiSbLhQfHtkng.review_text: Pretty much a heart attack sitting in a basket but it is definately worth it. Probably one of the best places to visit for a late night snack after roaming the streets of north beach. I actually prefer the hot dog with bacon, jalapenos and cheese over the philly cheese sandwich.  They also have all the great sauces availabe for you to pick and choose such as the garlic hot sauce and spicy bbq sauce.   Very cheap and affordable prices for the huge portions you get in return.  One of the best hole in the wall places you will find in the city.  Whether drunk or sober you will enjoy this place!

j35QKwdu32oTbhdGPVIiGg.review_text: After having this place on my Yelp bookmarks for over half a year I finally a chance to stop by for dinner after completing some business downtown. I first found out about the place on one of those bay area shows on KPIX or KTVU and it sparked my interest as I see myself as somewhat of a cheesesteak connoisseur. Well unlike a lot of the other reviewers here I was sober when I came in at about 6 in the evening starving from skipping lunch. I ordered the large cheesesteak with cheese whiz and made it a combo. The total came out to be about $13 which I thought was a bit much compared to other cheesesteak joints I frequent. The guys behind the counter were friendly and I liked the service. I never rate based on décor since I'm not snooby - as long as there's no bugs or rates crawling around I'm good. Anyways back to the food, since I was the only guy in the restaurant the food came out fast. Well long story short the cheesesteak was disappointing. It wasn't very large, didn't taste all that great (tasted a bit like the greatsteak chain), it was just meh. The fries were skinny cut fries but they were fried pretty well. However I usually expect steak fries at a cheesesteak join. That was another disappointment. All in all I was glad I finally experienced this joint but probably won't return unless I'm fending for cheesesteak at 2 in the morning.

aqWXHhcR_CdmKmxggFOlEA.review_text: Wow.  I wish I had read these reviews before I went to Buster's but I hadn't...and I had the burger (not entirely sure I would've remembered what to order anyway...).  My friend and I got cheeseburgers and fries, and they were definitely tasty.  Luckily, we got in just before 1 a.m. and beat the late night crowd and managed to get a counter seat...  I probably should've paid attention more and had the cheesesteak, but the cheeseburger definitely did the job.  The fries were less than satisfying - I'm not a calorie counter, but you should definitely save the space in your stomach for the meat.  This is a great option other than the standard pizza and burrito places in North Beach...  I'm definitely going back for the cheesesteak.

k15wN8AmB8mgPJSQyl4MWw.review_text: What is the hype about this place?! Really voted BEST CHEESE STEAK?! Uhhh why?! The only reason I'm giving it 2 stars is because of the AMOUNT of food that was given to me, & b/c the lady that worked there was suppper nice! :)  LOCATION: sucks.....it's in the midst of CHINA TOWN!! No disrespect to chinese ppl but geeze such a bad location!  It's small....not very spacious whatsoever!   It doesn't accept credit cards (I should have read the details on it a little bit better!) but come on it's 2012 who doesn't take take credit cards?!  B/c it was so little we decided to order our food to go! I ordered a philly cheesesteak with cheddar & provolone cheese...my bf had a veggie burger! & we ordered a LARGE fries....I was skeptical b/cI like to have my own fries when I questioned the lady will it feed two ppl she said yes!  We get back to the house and when I opened my wrapper ALL of my cheese was stuck meaning I had a philly steak NOT a philly CHEESE steak!! FIRST DISAPPOINTMENT...  Secondly when my bf pulled the fries out the bag my jaw dropped!! They were greasy, burnt, & soggy!!!! UGGGH!!!!   I ate my "philly steak" the bread was tough, the meat was extra chewy, it was cool & again I had NO FREAKING CHEESE!!!  My bf ate his veggie burger and was disappointed!! His words, "this is a garden patty with rice in it!!! Wtf!?" (LOL)   We asked the question "WHAT'S THE HYPE ABOUT THIS PLACE?!   Sorry to everyone that gave this place 5 stars :/ I'm such a picky eater plus my dad is from PHILADELPHIA so I know GOOD philly CHEESE steaks when I have one!!!

XQ7Yo4nqC4EI6cpPXu5WpA.review_text: Yum, this place usually hits the spot after a night out in the city.  I really like the Philly Cheesesteaks here.  I've tried Geno's and Pat's in Philly and they've got nothing on Buster's. I also like the chili cheese fries here.  It took me awhile to remember what this place is called and I just had to double check with my bf because I am always a little inebriated when we go here and never bother to pay attention to the sign, lol!  The first time I ate here during the day (and sober :p) I was relieved to find that the line wasn't out the door and that the philly cheesesteaks tasted just as good :)

3S53VaMDPy8Lywk2TuPb4A.review_text: What's to like? 1.  It's cheesesteak and sometimes you just need some cheesesteak. 2.  Smack dab in tourist central of North Beach but mostly frequented by locals. 3.  Pretty darn fast. 4.  No yuppies or whatever they are called now. 5.  Now that's a big sandwich.  What's not to like? 1.  While it's cheesesteak, its not world class cheesesteak.  Even some SF pizza joints have cheesesteak that is just as good.

eDGtkFsgG2dkr-JkDiNjgQ.review_text: Drunk or sober, this is the best Philly you can get in SF, maybe even California. Been here more than enough times on the way back to my apartment after a night at Kells or C-Bus Cafe. I wouldn't bother trying anything else on the menu except the regular steak sandwich with either Whiz or provolone. Both are good, but be warned, Whiz comes with A LOT of Whiz, so if you don't like a lot of cheese, go with provolone.

c14mdc_XMbDF-70UJIh7uA.review_text: This place is fantastic for so many reasons....including but not limited to the following:   1. Great cheese steak sandwiches 2. Right down the street from where I live 3. Open late 4. Cheap 5. They always have Red Sox games on and if there's something I like more than eating a cheese steak, it's eating a cheese steak while watching a Red Sox game.   Eating cheese steaks will most likely put us all in an early grave, but this place makes death seem delicious.

roAf0K77aY43ZkdRo02Eug.review_text: This place has the most AMAZING cheese steak I've ever had! Great portions of food and everything is made to order. Hands down, my favorite place to eat in the city.

kPNoZa6HUM4d6_dupVBoUw.review_text: Not a bad place at all. Cheese steak was good, but not great. They do in fact have some things that are frozen. The server was quiet and didn't talk much, but the cook was a nice guy. Apparently my friend has a crush on the Australian girl lol :P I'm still sticking to my usual spot Cafe Cola in Azusa, CA that are moving the restaurant to a bigger spot.

yW5ajGtDmMAujfld63J-eQ.review_text: My pal Natalie G. lives right next to this place otherwise I would've never thought about stepping foot into here.  They have a good selection of hotdogs which I love!  I had the hotdog with the cheesewiz.  Sick sounding I know but it was real tasty going down.  I felt pretty bad about it afterwards and had some withdrawl but hey it was worth it for the one time.  The fries were the best part and the portions were huge so I shared with the girls.  Normally I woudlnt, haha.  This isnt the healthiest of places so I wouldnt go back unless I was in the neighborhood strip joint and got hungry =).

QHU8rbi7CFobEurpzzcdbA.review_text: I've been to Philly. I've had a real Philly Cheese Steak. And to me, the real thing is Whiz, with onions and mushrooms. These guys do it. And it's so gooooooooood. I used to live in North Beach and probably went to this place atleast once a week. Juicy hamburgers too, so if you don't want the whiz with onions and shrooms, get a hamburger. This place is also open until 2 or 3 on the weekends! So after a night in North Beach, this is a great place to end it, if you are patient enough to handle the line.

CfXp5S3c2w4E6o-INvaG0Q.review_text: Why can't there be one of these near where I live... might be for the better cause I'd end up gaining some major weight..   Buster's is a no-nonsense kind of establishment and makes you feel like this is the kind of environment that is worthy of a philly cheesesteak. Their garlic fries beats gordon biersch's easily. I got to see them make the garlic dressing before my eyes and talk about fresh! My breath smelled pungent for the rest of the night. What more can you ask for?

ypm9IB9iZkwY71FKkYeLkg.review_text: A great little hole in the wall for Philly Cheesesteak.  Everything's customizable and made to order - meaning it's Fresh Fresh Fresh!   You can add a variety of toppings in your cheesesteak such as sauerkraut, onions, olives, dill pickles, sweet pickles, jalapenos, and more.  Shared a large philly cheesesteak with provolone and a side of garlic fries and that was plenty for both of us!    The bread was perfect - semi-hard on the outside but perfectly soft in the inside, so that the cheesesteak won't soak through and make the thing fall apart in your hands.  My main gripe (and the primary reason for the 3 stars) is that the meat was overcooked and they definitely could've added more of it in the sub - I felt like I was eating a lot of bread and not enough filling.  The garlic fries are thin and super crispy - they use real chopped garlic too, so your breath will be a-kickin' afterwards.  It's well worth it.  I'd definitely give this place a 2nd chance - it's a really great concept and obviously super popular!

r-8eQ28RhnQPJdZXHcTXrw.review_text: I ate this when I was drunk.  It was an awesome fourth meal after a night out.  In my drunkenness I kept calling this chilly pheesesteak... show of hands for anyone else without dyslexia experiencing this phenomenon?  No?  I had a cheesesteak and garlic fries.  The garlic fries are tasty but really garlicky.  I would probably avoid those next time.

KofmcukQnRz9mjKOS0u66g.review_text: The previous reviews say it all.   AMAZING food - best cheese steak in the area. We have tried many things on the menu- all great.   Service is not good. Check your order before you leave (if you do take out) since about 50% of the time, it will be wrong. But- it is well worth it when they do get your order right!

3UtTalOKNJ2Iz5CHoLdA0Q.review_text: Tiny tiny place!  Our goal was to go to 15 Romolo right around the corner, but since we had some time to kill, we stopped by Buster's for food. I wasn't too hungry so I split a cheesesteak with white American cheese with my boyfriend. Decent sized, decent price. The cheese blended well with the steak. I think the steak was a bit bland compared to another joint and it was slightly on the dry side. I did looove the bread with the cheese melted on it.   I do planning on returning and giving this place a second opinion in the future, so we'll see!

5YPjHBvjpDTZRgzpDyHJeQ.review_text: I LOVE finding hidden gems in the city! thumbs up to buster's!

xa9wLlbp5U_jXK7xcu_HGg.review_text: delicious.  i came here with someone who wanted a cheese steak.  i've had cheese steaks from the pennsylvania/philadelphia area, so i really didn't want one from a place from san francisco. plus, i wasn't really that hungry.  but when i saw one cooking fresh, with the cheese melting perfectly and steaming hot on top on the hoagie roll, i really wanted to order one. so i did, and i was extremely surprised to find it was probably the best cheese steak i have ever had. it was everything that you look for in one - steamy warm bun with a slightly crispy exterior, tasty meat with melty cheese.  of course, there are a number of different cheeses and toppings to choose from. and a few different bottled beers. extra thumbs up.   we sat at the bar which included a nice view of the cooking area plus a tv. if i make it back to san francisco, i will be coming back here, especially for a late night grab of food.

t9MtHB_hwKfwkW0Ie1yEoQ.review_text: This is the perfect place to go when: You're hungry. It's late. On a weeknight. You want something affordable. And a space to sit in. With nice people to help you. In a small, local, Yelp favorite.  Melty juicy goodness and hot crispy yum will all be in your belly soon.  Suffice to say, the Philly Cheeseteak sandwich w/Cheese Whiz, fries, and drink satisfied all of my needs that hour.   Friendly, fast, delicious. Enjoy.

S5e6VBXRHpShI8Tv9tc8-A.review_text: Okay, I don't know if it's fair to give Buster's two stars because I was Eating Under the Influence while I came here one night. I do remembering having half of the Philly Cheese Steak sandwich and adding some of the many hot sauces they have available.   I didn't even remember checking into this place on Yelp until I checked my phone the next day, that's when I had vague images of my sandwich. :)   Buster's is a tiny diner, and super packed with DRUNKIES! HOORAY!! haha, but I doubt I'll be back for more.

2yATlqRKPwa4zN3LmGNfNg.review_text: holy mother of chicken.  a friend of a friend recently acquired this "hot dog stand" and has converted it to the place with an addictive philly chicken sandwich and i crave nightly (say it in a scottish accent, if you please).  Mehdi (the owner) is passionate about making the absolute best phily sandwich.  everytime i go - he's either introdued a new bread, or the chicken is cooked differently.  i don't know what he's doing - but it is FREAKIN GOOD.

gfyW0vuJls8ARoHmogfcmw.review_text: Greasy food open until 3am in North Beach!  I'm there!  It's a small open kitchen, so you look right at the griddle and deep fryer.  There's limited seating, with basically bar seating around half the room - it can definitely get cramped.  Not only do they have traditional cheesesteaks, which they chop up fresh on the griddle, they also have chicken breast, which is non-traditional but a little healthier.  Definitely get it with sauteed onions and mushrooms, and they automatically grill your bun.  Cheese comes with it, and they have whiz!!  If you don't like the conventional orange goo, they also have pepper jack and some other cheeses that melt perfectly over your bread.  There are also other fancier toppings for more money, like guacamole, peppers, etc.  There are also lots of bottles of different bbq sauce, mustards, hot sauce, etc on the counter that you can help yourself to.  And surprisingly, they serve beer??  They also have chili cheese garlic fries??  Or you can add regular fries and a can of soda for $3.75.  I don't know what it is about this place... maybe a combination of post-drinking binging and the novelty of cheese steaks in SF?

GjsGSm_0dgETN9aEjcVjCg.review_text: Busters gets a five star review on so many levels, A: has a ton of hot sauces to choose from. B: is always serves hot food. C: smiling friendly service::)

A6-tpXToVbhCKk7BxLMZNQ.review_text: This place is good late at night! The cheesesteaks are cooked to order and I get mine with garlic, mushrooms, and provolone! The location is small and gets really packed but service is fast.

TS1743yx60gkKZKumGgCsg.review_text: So my friend and I stumbled in here at 2:30 am and...just kidding!  In actuality, we came in on a Sunday afternoon, 100% sober, and we both agreed that the philly cheesesteak sandwiches were very yummy! :) I got the North Beach cheesesteak (grilled onions, spinach, zucchini, bell pepper) with swiss cheese and my friend got the phili cheesesteak! You can add additional toppings for a extra charge or make it a combo (fries + a drink)!  Hmmm North Beach was GOOD! When I pulled it apart, it was just cheesy, artery-clogging goodness! :) I liked the ratio of meat: veggies! I LOVE vegetables, so it was nice to have a sandwich that wasn't all meat and skimpy on the veggies like other places.  I'm not a condiment person, but they had A LOT of stuff to choose from! Ketchup, mustard, SPICY mustard, buffalo sauce, some kinda scary sounding stuff called A-1...   Buster's is definitely very small and intimate, so I can see why some people have had to wait a long time. If you can, it's really fun to sit at the counter facing the stove to watch the meat cook and sizzle :)

JGPiK82TbUbBlaMetIFASA.review_text: Best drunk food ever!  I wouldn't say I would ever go here sober but it is perfect for what it is.  Open late, cheap and greasy. Cheesesteak and fries all the way.

ogR1F1kH7lTfWQyBd3IubA.review_text: I got an original philly cheesesteak with provolone (7 in) and it was realllly good. The combo comes with an enormous basket of fries that no one will ever finish. Next time I will split the 12 inch and fries with my bf, which makes it really affordable. It sucks that they only take cash :( I also wish they had a soda fountain rather than cans, I like refills :)

9hQvIXgZU1eq7B-0jWfkkw.review_text: Buster's is one of those places that makes you feel amazingly good while anticipating and then eating their food, and then amazingly bad when you realize you just wolfed down a foot-long piece of bread wrapped around a hunk of meat and cheese. So -1 star for that last part, but that doesn't matter, because the "amazingly good" part is so good.  I admit to having done a few faceplants into Buster's sandwiches after a night out on town and it's always been very satisfying. I usually get a California-style cheesesteak which a few condiments to the original. I also brought here a friend from Philly, and he admitted that the sandwiches were pretty damn close to what he grew up on. Hey, I'll take his word for it.

JV05pdccJ2-a5cWngc2gzg.review_text: Best Phily Cheese stakes in the city! I love taking all my friends here! :) Its always really fresh and they have the best garlic fries!

oy9yuMqpN_E3C-9ThIYg3A.review_text: this is not a philly cheesesteak.  it is a cheesesteak trying to act like it's from philly.  the whiz was salty.  i can see why people come here (late and drunk and think this is what a cheesesteak should taste like).  not a fan.

PESSmH_erpVVKmrtpEHKBA.review_text: One of the few corners grub spots in close proximity to bars that deserves the accolades it gets. Its legit. Pretty good Philly too. You can even get a 'Whizz With' which is the straight old school way (see photo). I go 'Provo With' but that's because I'm a California loser. Whatever. I'll still beat your ass, especially if you get lettuce on yours. Lettuce? Why do Californians put lettuce on a Cheesesteak? once you start adding things like lettuce or tomatoes you are eating a bastardized Hero or hot Hoagie or something. Don't try to 'healthify' your Cheesesteak. That's like trying to smoke healthy cigarrettes. You just look like a retard.

XOrMnYsmiSj54ivFrAsK3A.review_text: Vegetarian burger is pretty good. Served with avocado, a ton of lettuce, and the usual. The size of the burger is what's awesome.

OCcHlcwqFtHcKFo5t4UBYA.review_text: Good to go to while drunk or sober... but it's good to have some cheesesteaks while sober. I love getting the philly cheesesteak with mushroom... so good! But I also just love having a regular one because they never skimp on the meat. I also like their clever names like the Philapeno Cheesesteak (it has jalapenos), and also that they offer cheese wiz as a cheese option.   Note to self and everyone else: they can run out of stuff. One night they actually ran out of cheesesteaks! But luckily for all of us, they have other things available like wings, burgers and fries. Beers are also 2-3 dollars, so if you don't feel like going to a bar, you can just drink here and have some good food. It also gets pretty crowded when the bars start to let out, so prepare to be neck in neck with some hungry (and sometimes angry) people. Service is pretty cool, especially during the day... but be prepared to wait at night because there's just two people and only so many of us.

JnGtgOPpkjyWOvWM0SYEXg.review_text: it can get pricey with extra toppings...the bread is a bit  doughy tasting....too soft and chewy....the sandwich seem a bit bland when getting plain philly cheesesteak...feel like it's missing something....large burgers enormous...double thick fat greasy patties....inch of lettuce, tomatoe, pickles, etc....fatty burger barely able to hold.....sandwiches just a thick...mound of steak 'n' melting cheese stuffed in split bread......meaty style sandwiches 'n' burger...

MjCIBCRp7p4B_ITMWDpKzQ.review_text: This is the best Philly Cheesesteak I've had... ever.  Okay, so I've never actually been to Philadelphia, but I've tried quite a few cheesesteaks in my time, and I have to admit this is hand down the best one I've had.  I came here with a friend, looking for a quick bite to eat for dinner before Santacon. We decided to split a large North Beach style cheesesteak (which comes with peppers, and other veggies) and fries. It was just the right amount of food for the both of us girls. I'm assuming some really hungry men might eat an entire large themselves, but for us it was perfect. Everything tasted amazing, like melt in your mouth good. Even the fries were above average.  The only complaint that I'd have for this place is the time it took for us to actually get our food. We got there at a decently busy time, but those people all cleared out soon after. I think it probably took about 15 minutes for us to get our food, even though there was no one else really waiting for theirs. Either way, we weren't in a huge hurry, and we enjoyed some good conversation with other drunk santas on the street.  An enjoyable meal paired nicely with an enjoyable night!

HXOfPXPMvdXNpQ_l0RRjKw.review_text: Late night. Hungry. Traveling. Hotel. Yelp app. Searching. Open now. Cheesesteak? Cheesesteak! Elevator. Bellman. Good evening. Uber. Animated car. Get here. Where are you? Got here. Traffic. "This is just a side gig." Chinatown. Corner. Lights. Uphill. Jump out. Honking. Hold your horses, pal.   The smell. Cheesesteak! Old menu. Aluminum foil-wrapped appliances. Yes, really. So. Many. Cheesesteaks. Classic? Mmmm, classic. Fries? Don't mind if I do. Garlic. Whiz? Sure. Oh my whiz. So much whiz! Yes, whiz!  Tiny dining area. C'mon food! Chopping. Sizzling. Takeout goes out. Chinese containers. So much cheese! Grilling. Cheese slices. Bread. Topped. Basket-ed. C'mon you! Hello, love! One bite. Hot. Greasy. Cheesy. Thank you Yelp app! Thank you side gig Uber driver. One more bite. All the bites. Silence. Breathing. Tasting. All the fries. Shift change. Go home, tired cashier. Bring on the late late crew.   Basking. Magic. Divey. Drunk diners. Sober diners. Brothers in cheesesteak and grease. The brotherhood of the greasy chins. Branches on the family cheese. No longer hungry. Satisfied. Full. Filled. Perfection. Terribly perfect. Perfectly terrible.  Doors open. Back to Earth. San Francisco. Late night. Discovery. This is Buster's.

veg-Qwhl0zDl0dxx6uvkpQ.review_text: I admit the first time I tried Buster's was at 2am when I wasn't in the most clear state of mind.  But I disagree with everyone saying this is only great as a meal after a night at the bars.  I've been here many times since that first night at normal eating hours, completely sober and it has always hit the spot.  I always get a large California cheesesteak with provolone and a side of a variation of the garlic fries, with/without chili, with/without cheese.  (Not sure why I've never gotten the cheesesteak with cheese whiz... blasphemous, I know.)  The bread is toasted, soft and warm.  Packed with sauteed thin slices of meat & onions.  Layer of cheese.  Topped with a heaping of shredded iceberg lettuce, thick slices of tomatoes and pickles.  Moving on to the garlic fries.  Crispy and hot.  Tossed in what seems like a whole head of garlic.  Topped with cheese and chili.  When I come here, I eat in silence.  Respect the cheesesteak.  I've only had one "ok" experience here and it was when they used mixed greens instead of shredded iceberg and diced tomatoes rather than tomato slices.  You would think it wouldn't make that big of a difference but it did.  I forgive you for that one time but never do that again, Buster's.

x6ye79nLPU3rPO2mlFJrPA.review_text: after 2 shots of patron and a budlight, i was feeling hungry. so per request of a friend who gave me the "i must try busters" i walked on over to find this place and to my surprise, it was empty on a sat night. nice! i hate over crowded places. the place is small, so having said that i was glad i was able to get in, sit and order my food and eat without the disturbance of a crowded hungry stampede. i got to try the philli and northbeach cheese steaks which were ok, now the garlic cheese fries, i really enjoyed! i will def be coming back for garlic fries and maybe try their burgers to substitute the average cheesesteaks

yxlc-ENNVIJxO26oAbTscg.review_text: Great food, great service, overall great experience.

G6tRy4Aszosx6RIunAIjuw.review_text: Look at menu first. Dont ask stupid questions like "whats the difference bewteen small and large" If the soda machine says cans only - figure it out.  Order large or small FIRST Then say what type you kinda you want, Pay and step to left and get out of way  or get out of the way for others to order until you figure these steps out.  Everything is excellent there but if you want that extra heart attack, order anything with the cheesewhiz!  As for the crowd - everyone in north beach has their story, but its for entertainment purposes only, just remember that! Eat and move on.

GOWd31mIFS59fm3-TmSf2w.review_text: OMG OMG, I am not a huge fan of meat other than chicken but I wanted to push myself out of my comfort zone and had the traditional cheese steak over a month ago and I cant stop thinking about it!   The place is small but sit at the counter and be prepared to enjoy goodness! Can't wait to go again.

2JeI_lY2OyPM-kfa4yZufw.review_text: After taking my lunch break a couple of hours later than I normally do, I was on the hunt for something spectacular... I rounded streets of NB a couple of times and couldn't decide what to eat and where to eat that I've never tried before.   Originally, I walked past this joint after looking at their menu which wasn't enticing. But the smell of grilling meat hit me like a freight train and I walked inside to investigate a little more.  Right off the back, I noticed that their menu is pretty simple which isn't a bad thing...So, I narrowed it down to the North Beach Cheese stake and the Chilipehia Cheese stake, which is a Phili... but add chili...  I went with a small Chili and a side of garlic fries... not knowing how much food I ordered.... but might I remind you I was starvin like Marvin!!  But before I could get my hands on this tasty morsel, I was reminded I had to pay CASH ONLY... just like almost every other place in NB... figures... so I walked a couple of blocks to BOA and got my cash and got back...  Long story short, I brought back my order to the office and dug in... sleeves rolled up.... hat turned backwards... so to speak...  Thoughts:  -Bread is chewy -Cheese wiz + chili wasn't too appealing together -Garlic fries was below average.. did you guys buy the fries at Costco?  End Results:  Maybe give it another try.. but the second exp. would have to be stellar for me to remotely think about giving it more than 2 - stars...  P.S. I am currently fighting my food coma as I write this review..

jDf6OY3clAwJ2ZI7qVlKaQ.review_text: Try The Garlic Cheese Fries... You'll stink for days !!!!  YUM!

KvteUYPXCQV60E7i8FpTIQ.review_text: My dinner on my last night in SF was Buster's and I have no regrets. This is some mighty fine cheesesteak. I ordered the California cheesesteak with provolone. The steak was well-seasoned and not that greasy at all.  Decor is minimal, perhaps even 'dirty' to some people. Window seating is fun, but there is not much room to sit in the entire establishment so you may not get a chance.

flEY0QBpSMjhzRyWu6fcMg.review_text: I remember when this place used to accept credit cards, had great cheesesteaks, and no huge flat panel TV.  Now, this place has definitely changed.  The boisterous owner (who always seems like he's drunk/high or a combination of the both) can be entertaining.    Unfortunately, my recent experiences at Busters have been far far lower than the quality that I used to receive and expect.    The cheesesteaks USED to be very flavorful with whatever mystery seasoning they use on their beef.  The fries were always cooked to order, and the garlic fries were great.  The burgers were also great!  That was until.. they stopped accepting credit cards, and I saw cockroaches running around on the walls!  Not only this, but coincidentally at the same time, the quality of the meat, fries and service had gone WAY downhill.  I cannot comment on the pizza (as I've never had a slice), however from what I can tell, they're made upstairs and brought down into the warmer for the duration of the day.  I only wish this place could clean up a bit and start offering the delicious cheesyness that once was the epitome of the greatest cheesesteak on the west coast.  I've yet to find anything that comes close to what these folks USED to provide.

09T1oyi6c-9lvyt7gQCD2w.review_text: Dang it was a deal for N.Beach: two import beers for $3, or two domestic beers for $2 (just come here for the beer specials if anything). For us, three beers each, a basket of freshly-cooked fries and a Philadelphia cheeseteak equal a full belly and a good night's rest. I had a cough and it subsided the next day, not by much but it was worth it. Only two workers were present most of the time. A register girl who was friendly and had a nice smile (yelp.com/biz_photos/Iq01…). She also makes their fries and buffalo wings. The main cook was this middle-age dude who was very dedicated to his work. In between cooking cheesesteaks, chopping onions, separating cheese slices and constantly keeping the grill clean (prepping for the late night, post-club/bar rush), he had time to stop by and chat with us. This is a stop-in-and-eat-quick kind of place, and many people got their orders to-go. Stools and counters are all you'll get. No tables and chairs. Kind of divy when compared to the other places in the area, but variety is good. Located on busy Columbus Ave, and next to many cafes for afterward desserts and coffees. Milestone: the 4,000th "Cool" vote's review! :D

3cnIyELXdZa9C9nFH5NXtg.review_text: Out of all my years in SF and I only discovered this place last summer.  That's an atrocity, but then again I rarely party in North Beach.  Since my discovery, I've been here at least twice a month.   I don't think it gets any better than this for greasy late night eats. The cheesesteak is made when you order and comes out piping hot. You have to get it with the Wiz to have the gooey perfection of dripping cheese and meat. The rolls are lightly toasted and make for the perfect cradle for all the goodness inside.  I usually get the Phillapeno (a Philly Cheesesteak with Jalapenos, not the group of Pacific Islanders, haha).      Staff is friendly as long as you aren't a drunken idiot, which then they have little tolerance for.  There will be a lot of drunken people coming in the later hours.

Wt0DakLeHsrxtmgHbzUzIA.review_text: YES.  Perfect drunchies right hurrrr (open til 4 AM!), or even when you're sober. Came here twice in a week, it was thaaaat good. Although it is a little pricey (a small cheese steak and garlic fries is about $12), I believe it is worth it.  I get the mushroom cheese steak with cheese whiz no onions and garlic fries. Toooooo good. I put some buffalo sauce on my cheese steak, just cause I've been going through a buffalo sauce craze lately. And I get suuuuupa full off a small cheese steak and fries, so it's definitely worth the price! A must when bar hopping in North Beach!

fYjuPBTqTtv7JOegA0GzYA.review_text: i've only been here twice, and both times after some late night drinkage. i usually get the california cheesesteak.  they come in two sizes, small & large. the service is pretty quick, and the ingredients are fresh.  definitely will come again.

NTWdNiSgAhJqcf7JgZgLxQ.review_text: by far the best philly cheesesteak on the west!

bWxxfPP08zWJuM5wKG0LvQ.review_text: I had a burger here and half of my boyfriend's cheesesteak. Both were soooooooooo good. I highly reccomend this place for a quick, down and dirty, greasy bite. Be sure to get your cheesesteak "with Whiz." Yes as in Cheese Whiz. There is no greater comfort food than processed cheese.

Qq4R-RKUWzJ31d8H3h7CnQ.review_text: The only place that was open late by the hostel I was staying at.  Good cheesesteaks.

pIo73J0a7bxCK7q9BHdkzg.review_text: The North Beach Cheesesteak is the tastiest cheesesteak in San Francisco. Add some Buffalo Sauce to it, and you'll be thanking me. The service is quick. A small cheesesteak is like 6 bucks, and VERY filling. I have never tried the pizza here, why would you?

m07sy7eLtOjVdZ8oN9JKag.review_text: If you think pizza and pasta are your only dining options in North Beach or the thought of seeing fries in your sandwich at Giordano's makes you reach for the Pepto, then get your ample butt over to Buster's or at least get mine there. There's a whirling dervish of a guy, short of stature, at the hot grill making what may be the most satisfying cheese steak sandwiches in the city. I'm no cheese steak connoisseur, but Jamie W. and I like them enough to have come back twice over the last month.   It's just a boomerang counter and a few outdoor tables on the busy Columbus Avenue sidewalk. Their menu is simple - six different cheese steaks, three burgers, two veggie options, and a hot dog. And for Pete's sake, don't forget the big basket of fries for $2.85 (see photo). My favorite is the $8.95 Whole Sub California Cheese Steak, which has the requisite grilled beef and onions but also lettuce, tomatoes, pickles, a heavy slathering of mayo and cheese (see photo).   Now I prefer the melted provolone since it really is more like a grilled sub anyway. Delicious. For a more traditional flavor, there is the $9.15 Mushroom Philly Cheese Steak, which just has the grilled beef and onions plus a pile of mushrooms (see photo). Now this is where the oozy, drippy Cheeze Wiz fits in nicely, damn the preservatives. The fries are more than enough for two. Trust me, the guy does magic with his spatula banging that grill with force and precision. And considering the heavily trafficked location, it surprisingly doesn't get too crowded, goombah!   FOOD - 4 stars...cheese steaks that satisfy  AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...just a no-frills spot  SERVICE - 3 stars...you get it fast and pass the buffalo sauce  TOTAL - 4 stars...beats most of the pasta joints in the 'hood

wxwUFeRenJ4HOPUymQ_xtA.review_text: Its 2:30 on a Saturday morning and as I am walking up Columbus, the most delicious sent hits my nose.  MMMM cheesesteak.  I always get the California cheesesteak with pepper-jack, a side of fries, and drench that puppy in the 5 different hot sauces they have.    I would like to applaud Buster's for making my noon time wake up after a night of heavy drinking a little bit easier.

Hx4dpQ_QkF5_md6NOtkN3Q.review_text: Cravable, easy, inexpensive, and close to where I reside. Need I say more?

KOWzHKlS0RlOb_ZRFmqEHg.review_text: You will not find a better "philly" cheese steak in this city. PERIOD. I work down the street from this joint and grab a quality sandwich from them at least once a week. I've never been dissatisfied with my experience. I'd highly recommend it if you're looking for some solid food in the neighborhood that's quick and relatively cheap. Plus, they're open late. So if you're getting hammered at one of the bars in the neighborhood and hunger strikes, you will not regret going here!

QssxvL783zOoKPrrkusiog.review_text: I was recently extremely surprised and pleased at how great Buster's burgers are. I've been a huge fan of the late night cheesesteak from Buster's for quite sometime but I have to admit their burger blows their cheesesteak out of the water.    For $5 you get a perfectly medium well prepared half pound burger on a sesame seed bun with lettuce, tomatoes, pickles, mayo and the cheese of your choice.   I mean I really can't say enough about this burger for the price and flavor this is easily the best street food I've experienced in San Francisco... I felt like I was back in Chicago for a minute finding tasty food for $5.

MU_bppwgP03jfpTo6vtZ5w.review_text: Just the best damn Kobe beef burger. I am literally stuck on the bacon, mushroom, avocado, and swiss cheese burger. They must be a full pound, i can never finish one.  Not really a sit down spot, although they have a counter for people who cant wait to get home. Orders are always ready within ten minutes.. Great french fries and i hear the Cheese Steaks aee amazing as well.  Best of all? They are open till 4am!!

rN6J7ivKUJ3SZXI0Uk3HKA.review_text: disproved my theory that our noses were evolved to let us breathe when our mouths are full of cheesesteak. As long as everything you eat is covered in Whiz and you're drunk, the food's worth a kidney or liver. Get two while you're at it, you only need one liver anyway.

QcPN-Dee_dU2IWno-f2oYA.review_text: I was there at the same time as Yan M. during the world cup, had a nice counter seat.  The cheesesteaks were good.  Being a native of Philly myself, where you know it's a real cheesesteak if it doesn't say Philly in front, I was skeptical.  Of course I have to try it though to see if it's good, and low and behold, they chopped the meat correctly, they did the cheese correctly and the cook has a powerful scoop into the bread.  I mean, i still can't give it a 5 based on principle.  But go enjoy!

ncFdZITxk88lekynsWqjoA.review_text: They know what they're doing at this small lunch counter. The guy in the back slaving over a grill of shredded steak and cheez whiz is the tip-off: this place is authentic. You can even order like you have to in South Philly!  I've been here on two occasions. On my first visit, the whiz-wit was a delicious assortment of cheese and meat overflowing from the right type of roll. Not sure it was an Amaroso's, but it was just right. Being able to enjoy the steak at the counter and watch the crowds of North Beach walk by is a fun, added benefit. A+  On my second visit, it was all the same, but the roll. Oh how the roll was different! People don't realize how important using a nice, soft sub roll is. French bread or an onion roll -- what I got the second time 'round -- is not correct. Everything else was still as it should be, so I'm giving them the benefit of doubt that perhaps they were late on a roll shipment.  All in all, I highly recommend for that Philly flavor out west.

PObh526RFgNL-IrRLQkw8g.review_text: I was contemplating giving this place a 4 because I've tried it before. But then upon entry to my mouth, the sandwich gained another star. Like I've said in my other cheesesteak reviews...if you got whiz, then you got it going on!!! the cheeze whiz at this particular spot is second to none. they lay that shit on thicker than a beezy. i prefer whiz that you haveta spread on cuz you know that shit is gonna be mad delicious. the bread is subpar, but the garlic fries made up for that. after a night of drunk rampaging, this place hits the spot at a really convenient location off broadway and columbus! thumbs up

lFpEKQtS6NjvJqy-7Rujug.review_text: Do you like to eat crap as much as I do? If so, this is the best spot in the city, bar none.   However, this isn't just ordinary crap. It's crap made with pride.  The cheesesteaks (which a healthier eater might refer to as "death on a bun") are made with fresh beef, not the frozen SteakUmm variety. (That would instantly turn this crap into shit. Although I love crap, I don't care for shit.)  Likewise, they just don't serve french fries--they serve seasoned curly fries with cheez (unlike the beef, I'm not sure how fresh or even real this stuff is, so I wouldn't go so far to actually call it "cheese") ladled from a big vat where it stews for hours (and presumably where it develops its unique character and viscosity. For notoriously bad eaters like me, this is the equivalent of a fine cabernet sauvigon aged in an old French Oak barrel. Sad, I know.)  Wash it all down with a Coke and then fart your brains out on your way to the hospital for an angioplasty. Good stuff.

OvteZk2gWKfIRAryq7T9KQ.review_text: garlic fries are the bomb here.. I love the philly steak, hamburgers and hotdogs here. Great greasy food after a night out walking down boardway st or a night of drinking.  But always double check if they are preparing your order it can get busy. But it is so worth the wait.

hlafUMPZ_7HrOzyMOUYE_g.review_text: First time ever Cheesesteak. It was served fast, hot and delicious! Had mushroom, onions and provolone, I am hooked. My husband had chili on his and he loved it. I "shared" his garlic fries, so good. Small space with a great cook, charming hostess and fun people watching location.

m3F0I2v_q0Auy3n66RSOiw.review_text: Real Philly cheesesteaks! My buddy from Philly got the steaks with "whiz" but get cheddar if you're not a snob.

Pp7YM7VrcD1l-2Noa-W_tg.review_text: I try to avoid North Beach because I can't really tolerate drunk guidos and an over abundance of tourists.  The first time I ever came to Buster's a short little sexually confused man picked a fight while we were eating out front, only ending with me pouring my soda onto his leather jacket....but I digress, the food at Buster's just makes visiting North Beach worth it (besides the $1 peep show @ the Lusty Lady..whattup) and especially if you're drunk.

cGrkHeGv1gd1XIBg7gOCmQ.review_text: Was super excited to hit this spot when I went to San Fran... I was sum what happy with the sandwich but not too thrilled... Felt that it lacked meat... Taste wasn't the best either... Maybe it was just me that day... It was good jus was hoping for something great...

0mmu5ME29Y8vLr9wyEvTKQ.review_text: I love a good cheesesteak sandwich. But northbeach changes it up a bit. Their northbeach cheesesteak is the bomb. And one of the main reasons I have to go to the gym on a regular basis. It's the california version of a philly cheese. Great cheese, shredded lettuce, tomatoes and that greasygreasy thinly sliced steak. Yummmmmmmm. Their fries aren't half bad either, but the it's the sandwiches I crave after a few beers and I've lost all will power if I'm in the area. They also do burgers and other fatty things you'd expect, but you gotta try the cali version of the philly, it's just great!

EGuLB7xaTYzzIVFeq3F-2g.review_text: Writing this review solely based on the food, because I did not get a catch to go inside the restaurant.  Parking was HORRENDOUS...that is why my friends just got them to go while I double parked somewhere and waited.  Anyways, the food is great! I got the Philly Cheesesteak, it was great. It wasn't like the other philly cheesesteaks where it can be either dry, too cheesy, not enough cheese, it was a perfect blend of cheese, steak, and some zucchini type of sauce thing mixed in it. The bread was good too. Usually for philly cheese steaks you wouldnt want the hard crunchy breads like some places would put, instead it was a very soft dough bread so everything just melts in your mouth.  Haven't had a chance to try any of the other items at Buster's, but I would definitely give it a try some other time.

Ma_gwnVShENgTuhHNpAvyQ.review_text: Cheesesteaks are cool.  Garlic cheese fries are even better.  Open late.  Attracts alot of drunk people.  Would I come here of my own accord during the daytime?  Probably not.  Regardless, props that its open late.

QTLL0xbcy7AyLUPJogk5kg.review_text: So I have to admit, I had always seen this place and was totally game to check it out. Then I walked in. Its not easy on the eyes. I threw a 2 minute mini-tantrum because I was slighty afraid I might not leave too happy. But man. I was wrong.  I got the chilli-delphia (i probably spelled that wrong). So basically. KbJp5kb-AMB7ixBPref8WA.review_text: the service really isn't that great and their garlic fries are just too garlicy. that said, i'm still willing to try a burger. next time...

E-Mq9XSHtu4n85SXlV-AAA.review_text: Came here for a quick lunch after a day of sight seeing. We ordered cheesesteaks and garlic fries to share. The fries were very flavorful and the cheesesteaks hit the spot. I highly suggest getting them with the cheese whiz and provolone. Their prices were really cheap considering the amount of food we got and their staff was super friendly and quick at getting our food to us.

qJoagI1BpBDVUwZgJQHnxQ.review_text: I have been coming to Busters as long as I have been hanging out in  North Beach. That's nearly a decade. It is one of my favorite late night dinner spots. I will argue that this spot offers up one of the best cheese steaks in the city, speaking as a person that works in the food industry where cheese steaks are on the menu. The ingredients are always fresh, made to order, and is fast, while maintaining quality. The offer a variety of cheeses for your cheese steak or burgers including cheese whiz. I have introduced this to my friends from out of state and epicurean hubs such as Chicago who described the food as "fire" (good).  I also love the fact that I can use my five star reward card every time I order a cheese steak here.   For My friends from Modesto this place is an absolute MUST every time they come to visit. I usually order the philly club, but they convinced me to try a provolone and pepperoni version which is incredible. :)  If you are looking to explore North beach musts Busters should go on your list. Don't forget the fries as well garlic or chili cheese both are incredible

ws8ep7Gpgpp7SeTAQzHYdw.review_text: Best Cheesesteak I ever had! I order the North Beach Philly cheesesteak with pepper jack cheese! Try their special garlic hot sauce! Yum.

DGlEpdOgkK8B4bJ3QUtd1A.review_text: In the search for the perfect cheesesteak, I made a quick detour from my plan to have another cappicola sandwich from Giordano's and instead went across the street to Buster's, self proclaimed home of the best cheesesteaks in town.  The small restaurant looks somewhere between a diner and a burger stand - with counter seating, some seats along the window, a register and a soda cooler... which is good - it means the focus is on the food!  The menu is pretty basic: Cheesesteak done two ways: Philly (incorrectly called "Phili") with meat, cheese and onions OR California Style (aka a Cheesesteak Hoagie) with lettuce, tomato, mayo and all the typical hoagie fixins. Burgers are also available - including the Buster burger - a burger with a cheesesteak on top.  Buster's gets extra points for offering a few different types of cheese, including the cheesesteak classic - melted Cheez Whiz! For my cheesesteak, I picked a large cheesesteak, Philly style with onions, white american cheese, cherry peppers and mushrooms - easily recognizable for any New Englander as a D'Angelo's Number 9.  How was the cheesesteak? In many ways, better than most in San Francisco. It was nice and moist with a great flavor, though it was a little salty... but I don't mind a little salt, considering every place in town seems to be afraid of a little sodium chloride.  As a cheesesteak purist, I do believe that the only cheesesteak is just that: cheese and steak. In my mind, there's no need to offer a chicken cheesesteak or a pastrami cheesesteak. Call them subs, hoagies or something else, but not a cheesesteak. No points have been deducted over it, but still... CHEESE... STEAK! CHEESESTEAK! Not Cheesy Chicken. Think about it!

WnxsINlCH3fv87_I0wVxPg.review_text: I honestly don't remember what the cheesesteaks taste like.  But damn it if they don't hit the spot when I'm hammered.

HqOW-Iqhkjv72uXIASVyhw.review_text: I have only ever gotten the cheesesteak here because if a place serves a cheesesteak why would you ever get anything else?  It is a good cheesesteak, not great but worhty of the price you pay. It's in a perfect location and they are consistent. Every cheesesteak has always been exactly the same. Go here when Molinari's is closed or if you cannot make it over to The Cheesestaek Shop on Divisadero

lmZii0clFiaYDXP19gQkew.review_text: This review is strictly for Buster's breakfast, which my girlfriend and I just had this morning on our first visit.  In a word:  Excellent!  Don't let the name or the obvious "Cheesesteak" focus sway you here, this place might not seem like a quality breakfast joint but my Juevos Rancheros were awesome (best I've ever had) and my girlfriend loved her Buster's Omelette. Everything was spot on, right down to the potatoes, toast, coffee and OJ, which certainly tasted fresh-squeezed.  The guy running the place was very efficient and personable enough without going out of his way to lay on a lot of phony "charm".  Obviously most people are thinking Italian when they head to North Beach but next time you're in the area and want a good solid breakfast give these guys a try.  We passed a couple of places along Columbus that offer similar stuff at twice the price, so unless you put a high value on a "quaint" ambiance you're better off at a no-nonsense restaurant like Buster's.   For that matter they've even got a couple of tables out on the sidewalk so we opted to sit out there and soak up as much North Beach ambiance as we could want!  Can't wait to go back for the Cheesesteak!

6_VkzelWeSHzjTVDlGl-Ug.review_text: FOOD: 1.) mushroom cheeseteak = with the nacho cheese. mehhh... maybe with another type of cheese would be better. but still. not much better i can't imagine.  2.) Veggie sandwich = tastes like asian stir fry haha. with tofu and peppers and stuff.. odd  I'd say most ppl come here for late night drunk grubbin, therefore it tastes a lot better to them without the attuned awareness of sobriety plus lack of the drunken munchies.  SERVICE: Nice russian lady hehe..   ATMOSPHERE: Small bar seating very casual, open kitchen.  6.29

WwB6wB0ad3s-WJc9p7gfVQ.review_text: this place is good! We've tried the different philly cheesesteaks here - I think the best one is still the "original" one. It's fresh, it has a lot of flavor, and it's a little nice neighborhood joint. You can also match it with various sauces. fyi - they put tons of jalapenos on the jalapeno sandwich (masking the flavors of the sandwich).

8cyQJHXTkKPAzwJh_C8TYg.review_text: If you've never been here before... GO!  Go right now!  This is probably the best Philly Cheesesteak place in San Francisco.  Forget that the place is small or the "dining" area is dirty (It's basically a hole in the wall place).  Everything on this menu screams flavor (and sometimes heartattack/heartburn).  It's almost like they sprinkle crack in their cheesewhiz.... If you love cheesesteak (or hot dogs, cheese fries or garlic fries) then this is a place you need to go to for your fix.

azCk2YXSFr-lKgBtA3CWIA.review_text: Bomb ass chili cheese fries which I saw that they make their own chili! Really good food to get when you are super drunk/high/not sober on a saturday night

EjQdVKrGOE7oUz7kpBGv4Q.review_text: All I really want to say is: YUM. but i'll elaborate. The philly cheesesteak with provolone cheese is literally all you'll need at the end of the night to go to bed happy and wake up sans headache. this is my favorite post-night out spot. If you're feeling extra gluttenous, share some chillicheese fries with a friend and dump on the hot sauce. you will not be disappointed!

XnbGrJNw0wglmqXekW138Q.review_text: i am tempted to give buster's only 3 stars because their fries are only so-so, but i do think that their cheesesteaks are worthy of 4 stars.  and since cheesesteaks are the main event here, 4 stars it is!  i usually go for the chicken cheesesteak vs true steak, but i have had both and definitely like them.  buster's is pretty small, so i recommend taking yours to go, but if you want to stay and eat, they have counter seating inside and a few outside tables.

J9IC8at26JSoY1S1JfAkvw.review_text: I arrived yesterday having spent most of my money at the Gay Pride Parade but hungry so I asked what can I get for $7. He said a hamburger. Then asked what kind of cheese I'd like. Well I swear it was the best hamburger I've ever had. Better even than the Ambrosia burger I had a Napenthe which until Byster's had been my favorite. You just never know from outside a place what the quality of their food might be.

7KnLMwVAi1DMrqHaod9jmg.review_text: Good greasy cheesesteaks with generous portions of meat and cheese. They also serve Mexican Coke (with real sugar) which perfectly complements the cheesesteaks and fries.   They're open til 3am and are very friendly. Highly recommended!

xDqGPRY2nTRGWvuDH85mgA.review_text: Cheap food at 3am. Cheesesteaks. Cheeseburgers. Hot dogs. Fries. It's an oasis of cheap/good in North Beach. This is one of those vaunted establishments that is open late, so it gets extra marks in my book for that. I still come here when it's not late night though, so that says something. I can't say the same about other late night venues such as sparky's, sam wo's, or the grubstake.

kjdC0Dzyh1ADUZ0_1Orr6Q.review_text: This place is tiny BUT...like they say, big things come in small packages.   We were 'restaurant hopping', Had our first 'not that satisfying' dinner at indian restaurant, we hit a bar and I was craving for garlic fries. Thanks to Yelp!, bingo! Buster was right across form where we were walking along.   I love the young lady manning the order and cashiering. Friendly and very sweet. We sat at the bar and was able to watch her put the fires in the fryer and watched the other guy making burger patties.   Garlic fries, water and beer, thats all we ordered. Happy, warm and satisfied...what we felt when we left this place. I heard that their burgers and philly cheesesteaks are to die for. Will definitely come back for burgers real soon!

CD-EFjih6dQWRHEHVbHKaQ.review_text: I've never been a fan of cheesesteaks but there were like four guys in our group...Nobody knew the name of this place but we wandered around until the person who recommended it recognized it. It's a small shop with a crowded counter, but I wasn't expecting some upscale atmosphere.   I ordered the California cheesesteak. I think it's called that because they added tomatoes and lettuce. 9DVpnoTOOMaDfLCKppI9pA.review_text: I have hesiatted writing this review because the place is small and I don't want to have to fight my way in for my Saturday afternoon burger, but if this isn't the best burger in SF it is certainly in the top 3.  Everyone from the counter guy/gal to the cook make sure that everything is the way you want it.  I can't get past the burgers but my girlfriend who is something of an affecando says it is the best cheese steak she has ever had.

yLnvKaxvEyiDudKLrcFnPw.review_text: Must have cheese steak, only down side some crazy customer.

omeHKomTFtw64hW74PDoDg.review_text: A great place if you're craving for a philly cheese steak. When you're out drinking at a club or bar, this is the perfect place to get some grub after. Everything is at a decent price. Only reason i deducted a star because it's a small place and can be hard to find seats.

GdJj1npaUyjSF_EZ4Nwu4A.review_text: GREEEEEEEASE STEAKS! and I mean this in a good way!  I've been coming here since I was about 16 and hittin the clubs...kit kat club, city nights, you name it! I love the grease steak, I mean cheese steak sandwich! This particular spot on the corner of Columbus Street is my favorite by far. They have a great selection of options and you can customize your sandwich just about any which way you please.  The last time I came here unbelievably was at 2am from Castro Valley because I was totally craving the grease steak after going out. crazy but true! The reason for one star off is dealing with city parking...that is always a bitch!

Rrj11KKFTDPpjhFlxU7Z6A.review_text: i am really a cheese steak junkie.  i have spelled cheesesteak like this but yelp has a hard time recognizing it from certain screens.   i went to buster's on a whim after buying a butt load of prosciutto at molinari's. anytime i see a sign that says "best ________ in the city" i am automatically reluctant to go there.  because if it was well... there would be no need for a sign.  the line to get food would say enough. on this occasion however i was impressed.   i have been searching for the best cheessteak for a while now because for me it is the perfect food.  now dont get me wrong there are things wrong with this cheesesteak.  for example they do not serve it on an amoroso roll.  that makes a big difference.  2nd the one and only time i have been there the guy making my cheesesteak was talking on the phone and not paying attention to what he was doing and oversalted my meat.  he really oversalted it.  i went through 2 iced teas by the time i was half way through.   however i can overlook those faults because the portions were generous, the price was right and they had cheese whiz as a topping choice.  i will defintitley be going back and i know this place can be a 5 star joint.  so i hope that the proprietors look at this and get into gear.  that would be awesome.  i would go there everyday.   in short this place has a lot going for it.  there are only a couple tweeks they need to make this a very very very solid choice for cheap eats in North Beach.  Especially if you want a cheesesteak whick i pretty much always do.

muGnvRudgXVu_w-skvjnPQ.review_text: The closest thing  you are ever going to find to a real Philly Cheese Steak on the west coast.  Wiz, and only wiz!
