ZGFiQnNQX57FuTTc8H9scg.review_text: OH MY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I love cheese steaks! And this place is damn good. Very fresh, juicy and the bread is awesome. I got the large mushroom Philly, and i cant wait to go back for another!

7Xm-gNSaVmb80u3a2nWJNQ.review_text: Oh Busters how I miss thee! This place is usually my main spot for my late night cravings after a night out in the city...  YUMMY IN MY TUMMY:   Philly Cheese Steak   Garlic Fries   Cheesy Fries   Cheesy Hot Dog   & plenty of sauuuce!  It helps to know that it's 3:10AM and I am writing my review on an empty stomach. I just really want some Busters to be delivered to me if possible!   Oh and I gotta give it to the cooks, they're awesome! They always have a smile on their face even when drunken customers are causing a ruckus.

6ATfXxQLQuRAQ30-nLI6Yg.review_text: Imagine yourself drunk, alone and scared on a Saturday night.  2:30 in the morning and you've never needed grease in your body more.  Friends? Gone.  Fast food? Closed.   Then with a shining light, the glory of Buster's comes from no where to save you.  If you want to pretend you're healthy, get the North Beach... an eclectic medley of vegetables goes great with the pound of meat and cheese wiz (or pepper jack if you're not feeling authentic).  Feeling ballsy? Go for the traditional, or better yet a california style (lettuce tomato onion and mayo).  Either way, I'd add sweet peppers and jalapenos (TAKE THE HEAT BABY!).   If you're sharing with a friend, I'd reccomend getting cheese fries (chili optional for you vegetarians) to douse the fiery goodness you just inhaled.    In the day time you can get abused in the great philly style, and don't have to wait in line.  The smart ones will call in and save themselves the wait.    All in all? Beauty, sheer Beauty.

vnexOqqNLvw-_QdNhIRSCg.review_text: When sober, a Buster's cheesesteak and fries is a delightful belly-bomb of a treat - not too greasy, very tasty and enjoyable.   When out-of-your-gourd, to-the-tits hammered, a Buster's cheesesteak dances into your mouth, sashays down your throat and greets your stomach with a high-five that can only be compared to the one Jesus gives you when you enter the pearly gates after a 4-alarm heart attack from eating too many of these. The line may be long and the staff may have become jaded from dealing with a nonstop parade of douchebag drunks, but after a night bar-hopping in North Beach they can call me a fat asshole all they want, so long as they fork over that white bag packed full of deliciousness wrapped in bread.

MzfZeBqL3TPYbOOT_VmU2g.review_text: this place can be easy to miss...or at least to me it is.  it's a small, weirdly shaped room that youll never catch me working here cause i'd probably die of claustrophobia! i kid, i kid...kind of.  but anyways! ordered a philly cheesesteak with i think provolone cheese and a large order of chili cheese fries. i wasn't a big fan of the cheesesteak only cause there were chunks of onions in them, bleh! other than that though, it was pretty damn good. the chili cheese fries were BOMB.  you seriously don't know how much i LOVE  cheese! i already knew that one night i'll be drunk on broadway...and find myself here. or sam's. but i'm glad i went here sober and hungry!

OGTLTtalwZACHQzzJbGL7w.review_text: A good steak sandwich. I don't care what others say; Whiz makes the sandwich. Not quite as good as the ones I've had in South Philly (minimally, the bread isn't quite right) but very respectable. Will definitely be back the next time nearby.

pCXxxvjnF70_OI1UqcnxMQ.review_text: Remember to order with cheese wiz. We had phili cheese steak and north beach cheese steak. They are excellent. Food was cooked quickly and tastefully. Highly recommended.

kuRZJ2Xa6JDPVVXdlt6DJA.review_text: I have never been to Philly so I don't have a true frame of reference, but their cheesesteaks are freakin good. I get mine with Cheese Wiz, onions and jalapenos. Make sure you have a reliable ambulance service on speed dial after sucking one of these down.

5jUlCtMCI9Z7poi1vHq6cQ.review_text: Dare I say it? Buster's is THEE joint to grab the BEST midnight BURGERS around. Yeah, I'm a fan of good ol' Sam's (on Broadway) but damn, they got NOTHIN' on Buster's. Located on the triangular corner of Columbus, rolling deep in the epicenter of the North Beach's nightlife, lies THEE BEST BURGERS pass midnight. Yes, I'm repeating myself, because I mean it. Mushroom Bacon Burger $7.80 - Half pound of 100% grounded steak, bacon strips, mushrooms, lettuce, tomatoes, onions, and pickles, topped with mayo, and your choice of provolone, wiz, pep jack, white american, swiss, or cheddar, all cooked and prepared right in front of your eyes. The end result.. BAM! - yelp.com/biz_photos/Iq01… The burger so juicy, the cheese so melty, the bacon so crisp, the mushrooms piled high, the fresh cut tomatoes, lettuce, onions, and pickles, and even the bun was perfectly toasted. THIS IS HOW A REAL BURGER SHOULD BE. I also got Avocado (+75 cents) but it was given on the side because the burger itself was already so perfectly compressed together, but no biggie. THEE BEST BURGERS. and I wasn't even drunk!

e6DzrhFWHPYrGIMu5Y_hNA.review_text: Oh My...these were the biggest burgers I've ever seen.  They were tasty and the service was friendly.  The price was right!

QGZlLoAG7b1keKcE4EUVJQ.review_text: Jose gets down on the grill, always fast and cooked to perfection. customer service gets 10 out of 10..!!.. a must when on Broadway.

b64-EHZQjs6dOjgB7uK3AA.review_text: Thier Philapeno Cheese Steak is bangin!!!!

Xf5KPJimu8cLFndTL8WPJQ.review_text: A friend that lives in North Beach recently introduced me to this late-night institution after our first choice (Golden Boy Pizza) conveniently ran out of food during the post-clubbing rush.  We ordered the chicken cheesesteak North Beach style. It was A-OK. Filled with fresh veggies that were cooked perfect and still retained their crunch, it was a very flavorful sandwich.  Buster's is definitely a good alternative to the usual Naan N Curry or Mel's Diner joints that people frequent after the clubs/bars shut down.

G94JclI-VV2I3nsTGJsT7g.review_text: Great customer service. Everyone enjoyed their sandwiches.

DHs8No90RxNP6EQHHNEZvg.review_text: For a hole in the wall...this place wasn't bad! I stopped by last week for a quick-extremely unheathy meal and it wasn't bad. I just got a plain philly with mushrooms and pepper-jack. A little greasy, but that why we eat those-right?!?!  Not too expensive. Looks like the served beer and soda. No real places to sit.   My recomendation: Eat here...but not very often.

gL88gycdByHEFDRhTAauNQ.review_text: The name sez it all. Buster's does indeed bust  it San Fran style!! F-Philly! This is how you do the ultimate of all late night peasant food. The Persian lady at the register also does a great keeping it flowing and making sure the order of tight and right.   Just go there and stuff your face. They have the pig out staples but not too much to cause bad judgment on mediocre items. It's all real good, fast, and crispy.  Bust that.

3_FKjtRXuVqGOPiEalOIsg.review_text: i had a hankerin for a good cheese steak, so off i went to Buster's. boy did they deliver. awesome. the onions, steak, pepper jack. wow. soo good. the chili cheese fries were excellent too. i just wish it wasnt so far away from my house. otherwise i'd go more often. The only thing i wish they had was Peroni.

9lyZDE5znfFXrcCfgA9Gww.review_text: A story, if you will:  In my San Francisco college infancy (2 years ago) I decided to bike around the city to see where everything was and be a good little San Franciscan. I biked from the Lake Merced area downtown via Portola and Market, saw everything, and said that it would be fun to see Telegraph hill too. I decided to get some food and have my lunch at the top.   I was in Little Italy, and saw this little hole in the wall sandwich place. My kind of place. The pretty girl behind the counter greeted me, and I looked up at the menu and saw the California Cheesesteak. The Philly hinted grilled steak, cheese and onions combined with the Subway-standard-faire crunch, zip and tang of lettuce, tomatoes, pickles and mayo. I got it in short time, spending it watching the tourists enjoy the city on a beautiful day from the large open front window in Buster's.   I then ascended to the top of the hill, navigating a long line of cars looking for the one of 8 or whatever parking spots at the top. I grabbed my sandwich, and saw it glistening in the sunshine. I'm sure someone who wanted to take a picture of Coit tower was dismayed because the reflection off of the melted cheese probably caused a little lens flare.  I took a bite, and wham, bam thank you ma'am, new San Francisco favorite. I can't explain it to you, the combination of deliciousness and awesomeness all contained on a toasted on the outside, slightly chewy inside roll, dripping with grilled onions and steak. All I can tell you is it was phenomenal.   Slight downside: Philly cheesesteaks don't have mayo, lettuce, tomatoes and pickles, where as the aformentioned "California" one does. So don't be surprised if, as you're barreling down telegraph hill, a piece of lettuce stuck only on the basis of the viscosity of mayonaise, dislodges from your beard and impales the nearest precariously-parked sedan. You've been warned.

RuJaIbbMlgswPVyWpvpaDQ.review_text: The cheesesteak samies a very delicious. Especially when your drunk.

GO0GU6sTOdgtUpAwzj1Tbg.review_text: Great late night spot after drinking or needing a quick  bite. One of the best cheese steaks in town, fresh rolls and plenty of other options.  My favorite is either the California with All the fixings or Bell pepper with Onions and provolone,  Extra meat please.  If you like it sauc  and spicy they have a plethora of sauces on top of the counter for your enjoyment.  The only reason why I don't give this place a 5 star is because is cash only and I don't like my meat too chopped up I rather bite into the sandwich.

NK-zIxHMuTnLRU0RhoZWqw.review_text: I like how they let you pick what type of meat and cheese you want for your Philly cheesesteak. Options are always nice. The sandwich is huge and very meaty too. I didn't find anything too special about their Philly cheesesteak though. The bread wasn't fresh, but then again, I was there at midnight. I like how they don't close until...3am? 4am? I don't know. But I doubt I'd be going back. There are just far more Philly cheesestake places out there to try.

fB0IXH_knLsp1PQX73KLlA.review_text: Busters is by far the best cheese steak!  They have perfected their bread and when I go out drinking in North Beach, I start craving Busters and have to have it!  The bread is the secret!  Soft and crunchy at the same time.  I have had the North Beach cheese steak about 30 times! :)  I always burn the roof of my mouth on them, because it is sooooo good, I can't wait for it to cool down!

ecnEanG361Jqi8hw8GPE1w.review_text: Anybody that gives Cheese Wiz as a cheese option deserves three stars alone!  I do not care how clogged my arteries feel after I eat here.  I know I will die happy, if I had just eaten a cheese steak and garlic cheese fries from Buster's.  I love the seating at the window, but I haaaaate the smokers who smoke outside, right next to the open window.  You might as well be sitting next to me... and you shouldn't even be mixing this deliciousness with cancer sticks in the first place!  That is double death!

Jtfz1WbIB_FtYDkO3MtRXg.review_text: Still open when you're heading home from the bar! So yes, this is a great place for drunk food. f_aEiBld-8UmMSeD-UZYIg.review_text: My boyfriend and his friends would rant about how good this place is, so they finally brought me and I can see why! Zcg8WQHGP8kLAIMfbvfgUA.review_text: This place I think is pretty nasty. I had a few drinks across the street and then came and ate here. THe cheesesteak to me wasn't very good at all. Maybe you have to be really wasted to enjoy this place. I even talked with people who have gone here sober and said it was weird and not the same.

1DP8r48ONQsDZOMgr0ZY-w.review_text: Grease is good and here at Buster's is the place to get it in a philly. 8VHDydi53hJcelSen3hP4Q.review_text: One of the best things to eat in SF.  Mushroom cheesesteak, wiz with, add bacon.  You will not be dissapointed!

Qt6t6i4RDbgXIOg6EXUbvQ.review_text: aw, that's so cute! you named your restaurant after my dog!  (p.s. i've never been here.)

f6iRA1UBcdPv1x3mDhvdyQ.review_text: i've spent a lot of time in filthadelphia therefore, as far as you know,  i must be an expert in authentic cheesesteaks.   buster's nailed that sandwich down - plus they've got good staff.  steak, wiz & ketchup. it's all you think it is & all you need sometimes.  *drools on foot*

QBXAIu1Vm-nKXUwBqZ5H7Q.review_text: Oh Buster. When will I ever learn...  I'll just say, instead of a DJ that night, a cheese steak saved my life.  The sturdy brown paper towels (comforting), the simple cheese steak (perfect) and the cheezy fries (risky) helped me end the night with a preemptive strike against a hang over. Plua, I only ate half, bonus points for me, and bonus points for being open at 1 am. Even the vegetarian of the group sings his praises.

Ixd5fdjQreCYpsIkaP_cgQ.review_text: Not that long ago - i found out that a real Philly Cheesesteak has only steak and cheese - thats it. My whole life, i thought that cheesesteaks had lettuce and tomatoes etc till i found out that was California style cheesesteaks - I live in California DUHH.   I tasted a real style Philly cheesesteak from somewhere else and i did not like it.   Luckily Busters serves a California style cheesesteaks and it was good!   Im used to lettuce and tomatoes on my cheesesteaks and I always top it off with ketchup. This is going to be the best as it gets for this style. This place and Jays cheesesteaks in the mission.  Quick tip: CASH ONLY - Prices are about $9 for the footlong size. and $7 for the 6-inch.

miOc5bKHCoZSY6zMAtJ0KQ.review_text: The first time I hung out with my now boyfriend, we ate here. I wasn't too hungry and just got fries...it was nothing spectacular. We never went back. Fast forward 10 months when one nice we thought it would be cute to visit the old place. All I can say is, DELICIOUS! While there are a few types of cheesesteaks on the menu, even hot dogs and hamburgers, there is no need to get fancy here. I always get the small chicken philly. Just deliciously marinated chicken, cheddar cheese and grilled onions on the softest roll ever. Sometimes when we are really hungry we'll share a small garlic fries (they are perhaps top 10 garlic fries in the city!) and the smalls are huge! More than enough for 2 people to share.   The people that come in can sometimes get a little shady....it's pretty close to the broadway and columbus intersection which, as you know, can be a little seedy, and the two people that normally are working aren't the friendliest people in the fast food business, but they serve a good product and their attitudes aren't generally aimed at people who behave so go in with a big appetite and good attitude and you should be fine!

aX1rmyl9xGY5iDyeV2ohQw.review_text: I crave for Buster's on a weekly basis and will drive from Union City just to get my hand on one if their yummy cheesesteaks. Driving to North Beach and parking is a pain in the ass but Busters is definitely worth the trek. I usually get their Philly cheesesteak with pepperjack and jalapenos with a side of chili cheese fries. Mmmm soooo f'n good! Anastasia that works there is a sweetheart, make sure you tip her fat!

FgieoG9rQfRTCArIKi5wdQ.review_text: I'm usually not a fan of Philly cheesesteaks, but these are good!  I got mine with provolone and it was so delicious.  Love the oniony flavor and the fact that the meat was nice and lean.  The fries are a pretty good deal as they give you a lot and they are pretty cheap.    Not many places to sit - there's just a counter.

BkZ10AaCXjOw1CGqtIzeAg.review_text: Mmmm, Delicious!  Buster's truly comes through with some of the best Philly Cheesesteak lovin' that you can get this side of the Rocky Mountains! Whats more, they have so many options, chicken, tofu and of course the most deliciously tender steak. They also have 6 or 7 different cheese options including cheese whiz, Swiss and provolone just to name a few.  Besides The Traditional Philly Cheesesteak they also have a California Cheesesteak and a fantastically original, not to mention delicious, North Beach Cheesesteak.  The Garlic Cheese Fries are also an amazing must try! Lots and lots of thick steak fries smothered in fresh herbs and garlic, then topped with piping hot nacho cheese! A Small Garlic Cheese Fry will feed 2-3 people.  Pizza, Hamburgers and Hot Dogs also grace the menu.  Just a tip: If you do happen to make any special requests, IE: no onions on your Cheesesteak, you may still end up with onions, as someone in my posse sadly discovered:  (

RaKPxD4Kt9-WwES7PmM1QA.review_text: Best Philly cheese steak I have had in all of California!  Being from Philly I should know a good cheesesteak! It's the real deal! Fries were good too!

xYB4vwPiFhxMHS0ctdpTig.review_text: Get the white american cheddar on the cheesesteak. It's not healthy but is AMAZING.

fKN1WhWWuqlIKPL2NjAJ0A.review_text: Best Philly I've had since... Well... Philly. :-)

m6p5knAyIS79s6WNbeIdGw.review_text: I LOVE Buster's. I LOVE Buster's when I am drunk and sober.... All those other reviews about only hitting up Buster's after a night of bar hopping make me sick. I actually prefer to be sober when eating my perfect Philly cheese steak sandwich. I crave this bad boys at least twice a week and if you don't finish your entire cheese steak no worries, they are amazing the next day too.

n-BdhhmjmgirvoC9_-XMHg.review_text: I was there with 8 of my friends and chubby homeboy with the blackish greyish hair told us to shut up. We were not overly loud we were just talking amongst each other. What the hell??? I felt that the food was just ok. It obviously helps when youre drunk. Its not any place that I would go to if I wasnt partying and the fact that they were so rude to us I will not be going back next time I'm in the area. I was disrespected but they were lucky that I was hungry.

gEUrtbRV0VLgwS3Da-CndQ.review_text: As far as there cheesesteaks go, only two stars.   If the rating was based solely on convenience, Buster's could be considered a mainstay. That being said there are definitely better cheesesteak shops in the city (but not at 1-2 am)  But stick with me: their menu beyond the cheesesteaks is actually quite good. I enjoy their Veggie Burger more than just about anything else.  If you find yourself here after the bewitching hour you're sure to join a lively, "rich" crowd.   The people are always awesome especially the girl behind the register, if you stick around at the bar seating you may find a messed up order in front of you on the house.  I couldnt say no to chili-cheese-fries once upon a time and I've somehow found my way back here ever since.

AEvn6o5KbSUgjbsgqmHeLA.review_text: I love places where I can get huge portions for cheap, so that it ends turning into a second meal for later in the day. This is definitely the perfect place for that. PLUS, it is oh-so-delicioso!  I got the California Cheesesteak, with the melted cheese whiz, of course, since everyone swears by it. I have never really been a fan of the artificial cheese sauce, but ended up getting it today. It was good, but next time I'll definitely try the pepperjack cheese; and in addition get more lettuce to add some fresh crispness. Garlic Cheese Fries were also good - the garlicky taste is really strong, so I stuff them in my sandwich to accentuate the greasy goodness. Speaking of greasy, I didn't find my sandwich to be extremely oily. A bit soggy, yes; but not to the point that I felt like I was drinking oil.   The girl who took our order was super-nice. She took our order ahead of time while we left to find an ATM because the one inside was out of order.   This place is a definite must in my list, and totally worth the Muni or bike ride to get there from my place.

hVbK6ik0kMfu40Cm0Ht1Bg.review_text: Failure 1: I came here with a lot of friends, (we were bringing them a lot of business) and the guy at the cashier told us to "SHUT UP". You could at least ask your customers to "tone it down", rather than be rude.   Failure 2: Then they ran out of large sandwiches, even tho 2 small equal 1 large, which the guy acknowledged but refused to reason. The taste would only appeal to the drunk folks of broadway, but is only good for that purpose,   Conclusion: if you want good food with good service, go elsewhere. I am in the restaurant business and this place was unforgivable.   Buster: Shame on your cashier. And if you were the cashier that night, you deserve a beat-down sandwich.

eP10t7Z8ftRGIz38NK0jxA.review_text: i love this place and everything it stands for: late night dining.  omg. philly cheese steaks. so delicious. a couple friends and i just parked randomly and walked into this place. boy am i glad we did. it was the most delicious philly cheese steak i've ever had at 2 am. we got garlic fries as well. everything was so reasonably priced and delicious.  plus the place is open til i think 3 am. awesome! i love it.  the only thing is, it IS a tad dirty, maybe it was trashed at the night. but then again, this is the city. this could be as clean as it gets.

DY0jNeu6KJtKNws4LZNzCw.review_text: Best mushroom cheeseburger and garlic fries I've had in a long time

JUfeYfJ6XtZAWxCpC1Zw0Q.review_text: Drunk food heaven. Cheese steaks. With garlic cheese fries. YES PLEASE.   To be honest, the euphoria I experienced whilst eating here is the most vivid memory I have of the place. I can't recall all the details, like exactly what philly cheese steak I ordered or how much anything costs, but I DO remember the amazing gooeyness of the cheese on my fries and how happy I was biting into my sandwich.   Obviously this place is open late, so swing by after a night of partying. It'll be worth your while!   Take my review with a grain of salt. If I come back here during the day I'll need to update. (Though after perusing the other reviews of Buster's, I'm pretty sure this place is actually legit, and it's not just my drunk taste buds doing the talking.)  CASH ONLY!

-NdqkuwjLh7QGQm3C_ZpDg.review_text: After a long movie at the Metreon, I was starving, so I demanded my friends accompany me to North Beach for a late-night dinner. Giordano Bros. was closed, so out of desperation I asked them to check out Buster's with me. I wasn't optimistic that they'd have anything I'd like but was pleasantly surprised to see TWO vegetarian options on the menu! I can't comment on the veggie patty because no one ordered it, but the tofu sandwich was awesome. They sprinkle it with ginger and serve it piping hot with cheese and vegetables. The sauce selection is mighty (Tapatio, Louisiana hot sauce, garlic sauce, A1 steak sauce, etc.), and the sandwiches were sizable (their Philly cheesesteaks looked pretty good too). I'd definitely come back, whether Giordano Bros. is open or not. Also, the ambiance leaves a little to be desired, but after a few drinks I'm sure you wouldn't even notice.

zpb17M4OG4Agjn3dK32CEw.review_text: Disclaimer: I don't spend that much time in North Beach so can't compare to other places in the area.   ....that said, this is definitely a place that I would come back to. This place is greal for hearty cheap food. I ordered the Small Hamburger w/ provelone cheese and a small chilli cheese french fries. I was stuffed by the end of the meal. By the way....if you get the fries, get the large size (for $1 more, you get twice the fries), so 2 people can share or just have that for the meal. The burger was a juicy medium well and very large for a small sized burger. The back wall tv features pop, r&b, hip hop videos which was nice background noise considering the quiet interior. Plenty of condoments on the counter which is a plus.  Red Devil Hot Sauce just might replace Crystal or Franks in my fridge. I will befinitely be back to try their Philly Cheese Steaks. --------------------------------------------------­------------------------------------------------- Update:  I went back for the Philly Cheese steak and it was great....but when I asked for a cup of good old tap, I was told they don't give water, I have to buy it. I said no. I would have deducted 2 stars from my original 4 star review but the Cheese Steak was that good....lucky.

W5spiZ9GhAJDtdiYbnBN4g.review_text: One of the best cheesesteaks I've ever had!  I don't know what exactly cheese wiz is and I don't want to know...but that made the sandwich all the more amazing.    Came in here with 5 people (and a friend visiting from Australia) and we ordered one large and one small to share (because we already had a full meal at a Thai restaurant just 15 minutes before) and somehow, three sandwiches were presented to us.  The cook had made us another one.  How sweet of him.  If I wasn't already extremely full from my dinner, I would have downed it.  I'll have to be sure to come back when I'm hungry next time!

FHD0yf0gSsQT9Or0FLi07w.review_text: So after I get a friendly buzz at the Rogue Ale's pub, which was one of the best moments in my beer hobby...  Me and my buddy walk down the street at like 1030 (not too late) to go food hunting cuz thats fun right?! We're not from SF, but this city is so cool that even on a Sunday you get random people walking down the street with a friend/date so it's all good.  ANYWAY.  So I see a sign for phillies and sandwiches and some obscure coca cola signs in front...  "DUDE WAT. LETS DO IT"  We go in and apparently this place is open til like ridiculous hours like we we quoted them til 2.30AM apparently on a Sunday. I guess they refuse to have anybody go without a decent cheesesteak in SF yeah?  Well thank you guys I got a mushroom philly with cheese wiz (the most boss configuration) and I burned myself from all the natural Au Jus dripping from it. Congrats on the juicyness of your meat actually causing me bodily injury. Theres an award in that somewhere...  Anyway it was delicious, I'm about 5lbs heavier, so for any of you chubby chasers, I'm totally out there for you guys LOLOL.  This place is full of win. Thats it.  Thanks guys!

i2pgXHOFiB99hufX835nVQ.review_text: Two words describe Buster's.....Deliciously Dirty. After an alcohol infused night we crashed this place at 2 am and I have never felt so satisfied. The mushroom cheesteak with bacon was amazing and the bacon burger was terrific as well. The lady at the register was really friendly and she also recommended cheesey garlic fries so why not! We left this spot unholy amounts of full, and I can't think of a better late night grubbery for cheesesteaks in the city. Wonderful experience.

43bejXLQ3vQOgreRCOH8sw.review_text: I go here almost every week. Busters has the best philly cheese in town. I had the small and large one and I have to say they look almost the same. Not a big difference in size. I mostly get the regular with american cheese, it's bomb.

S4MB2dpIaBJwDAw2pxkqKA.review_text: One of the best cheesesteaks I've ever had. The price and selection are fantastic, and it's in a great location. Be sure to get an order of fries, but share it with a friend or else you'll be sweating out entire potato strings.  The only downside is the size and seating arrangements. You're pretty much screwed if there's more than 10 people inside. Also CASH ONLY!

fKkF9NZHYaBVLW4tiXxC1w.review_text: When I'm craving a damn good burger, this is definitely one of the best places to go. And to add to the amazing, heavenly-ness.... the fries are fantastic as well.

EebIIcoDdqH6WF2COxFipg.review_text: Story: Staying at my friend's place in Chinatown I was craving some fries. Everything else closed down but this place and I believe Sam's. I heard Sam's fries weren't too great so I decided to check this place out. They are known for their cheesesteak, I refused an pursued on my mission to get my fries. The chili cheese garlic seemed appealing so I ordered it. I was kind of disappointed because I was expecting a crunch but I should have known better that it would be soggy.  Ambiance:  * Parking | Very hard to get parking around the area, especially in the evening. Chinatown is usually available in the evening so you can try that out and walking. * Seating | The place is fairly small and is all bar seating and some against the window. * Feels | Typical on the go feel. It definitely seems like they created a good community and reputation here as they were greeted with warm greetings by visitors. ESPN is usually plying along with some classic rock music.  Food: *Garlic Chili Cheese Fries | I ordered it to go and I was served in a chinese box and the top was smothered in cheese.  Overall:  3.5 stars. The price was good, service was decent, ambiance was ordinary, but the menu was quite basic. Perhaps I ordered the wrong thing and their specialty is about the philly cheesesteak. Ultimately it gets the job done.  Advice: * I would recommend this joint for a late night snack.

cPYPaGJ_Cx_oEpevhBXp1A.review_text: My boyfriend and I went to dinner here and got the garlic cheesy fries and a small and a large Philly cheesesteak. The garlic cheese fries were amazing!! The cheesesteaks were really good too. Soft bread and good flavor, but there could have been a bit more meat for our taste. Good and quick service and well priced.

kSw_IE3GarNCcoAS-rvWcg.review_text: I've been searching for a legit Philly for a long time and I'm pretty sure this is as close as I'll get.. With the perfectly toasted bread, succulently tasty meat and whiz melting through this sandwich is amazingly good!. Been here a dozen times and have never been disappointed. Make sure you get the garlic cheese fries too!

LU7ikPXZ5R8tv4oNQZQkKw.review_text: Not bad.  Not great.  The sandwich was dry and not greasy.  Its definitely worth eating if you intoxicated and on the verge of blacking out.

Tj-dZQNgz2pNpBGLvCkm6A.review_text: If such a thing existed, I would be proud to give Buster's my Yelp Gold Star, they certainly deserve it.  I only moved in to the North Beach area about a week ago, and since I, like Ron Swanson, pride myself on being a discerning carnivore, I knew that one of my first priorities would be to find a quality burger place nearby. I turned my trust over to Yelp and was rewarded like always.  I had walked by this place before and noticed that it was about half the price of other places on Columbus, which had me a little puzzled but I made a mental note to check it out later when I knew that eventual late evening burger craving would settle in. Upon studying the menu further I was very tempted to try out one of the many cheesesteak sandwiches, but as luck would have it, I had eaten cheesesteak for lunch and decided to pass (For now, there's a near guarantee I'll be back soon to try one of those)  I decided to go with the mushroom bacon cheeseburger (a brilliant decision that I now rank with deciding to move to San Francisco in the first place). I can't recommend this burger enough. As someone who loves burgers and likes to think he has an experienced and refined palette, it truly is an epicurean delight. It's basically a greasy disheveled pile of beef, mushrooms, cheese and bacon; only vegetarians and obsessive health nuts could resist a little mouth water there (Don't get me started on vegetarians and the errors of their ways)  You're gonna get messy, you're gonna feel slightly rotund afterwards, but dammit you'll enjoy yourself. Put this in your North Beach to-do list

5aMGeZ96w_IjZGcwVirURQ.review_text: The cheese steaks here are hella good along with their garlic fries with cheese. Better then any cheese steak place I've tasted in NY. Must try the cheese steak with cheese whiz. I wouldn't get their pizza's though.

HO35wso-psqx0GF--QSwGA.review_text: great place for late night food! was out at a nearby bar and needed to sober up so handy dandy yelp led us to Busters for a cheeseteak. my usual late night go-to food is greasy mexican food haha but i have to say that Busters hit the spot at 2am! me and justin b. shared the mushroom swiss philly cheeseteak and it was so good! the sandwiches are cooked fresh and it was pretty amazing to watch the 1 chef make multiple sandwiches at once and keep everything under control. also opted to get an order of garlic fries to share and omg they were awesome. freshly fried with lots of garlic flavor. plus they put the order conveniently in a chinese take out box so it perfect to walk and eat at the same time haha. def recommend checking out busters if you're in the north beach neighborhood barhopping and need a late night bite to eat.

1b4tahv5bz8bOprU75sfIA.review_text: Greasy, traditional, hole in the wall, delicious cheese steak. The fries are great too. The price is right. go, go, go!

nhRW0d6XPnxk_3i_BRbxkA.review_text: Solid cheese steaks, and the tofu sandwich is really good. The real reason I go back though is that the french fries are amazing when you dip them in Buster's buffalo/hot sauce. There is something about the oil they use that makes that salty spicy combo uncommonly addictive.   It is open late for post bar meals, but I also like getting it to go and sitting out in Washington Square down the street.

aeCpjSibhZRQ47mPxI6_5w.review_text: one of the best cheeseburgers in the city  take it two blocks up the hill and you have a bangin' view while you eat that masterpiece.

XFoYHzfc_Y8vg_TxU3gQLA.review_text: I got very familiar with Buster's after working in walking distance for almost a year.  Their cheesesteak is the best I've had in the Bay...and maybe anywhere!  I just went there today after a long absence since I don't work in the area anymore...and it was just as excellent as always.  The fries are great too!  I LOVE Buster's...ANYTIME of day.

HKmsxY1avQ-o1QwPm9tvEg.review_text: + open late, cheap - overly greasy, service can be a bit on the slow side

3lWC0riFiQmnchl1BYZYKg.review_text: Given, I was pretty drunk when I came here, but their chicken philapeno with wiz was amazing.  I like that it was actually spicy instead of just throwing in jarred pickled jalapenos.  There really aren't too many places to sit so I walked it over to Columbus Cafe and grabbed a beer to wash it down.  It was a little bit of a mess but what can you expect from a cheesesteak sandwich.

a5aAfojhrYjlTdwi3-cFAg.review_text: we just got into town and it was already almost midnight. golden boy was closed already so we walked around the block to Busters. its right on the corner of grant/columbus. right now theres some construction on the outside of the building so its kind of hard to see but underneath all the wood and beams, is busters! its a tiny place. when you walk in, theres the menu up on top and then the counter with maybe 4 or 5 seats and then maybe about 5 or 6 seats along the window. its an open kitchen with basically only a grill and the register. as soon as you order, your cheesesteak is on the grill. we ordered the original cheesesteak with provolone and made it a combo with fries and a drink. its a little bit pricey (cheesesteaks about $8 and then making it a combo adds another $2). its really good though. very tasty and savory. the bread is super soft and buttery. busters is open late (3AM on weekends) so its a great snack after a night out drinking, which seemed like the case for everyone else that came in after us.

FZo9lLC-R6ggwzpUkqLfQQ.review_text: "I'll have a cheesesteak with cheezwiz and jalapenos." Just say it.  It'll make all your problems go away.    North Beach is a hassle for me to get to, but I'll do it for Buster's.  I'd do anything for Busters.  It's the best cheesesteak I've had in this city.

3uLnxiRIhSBFhefhywauuQ.review_text: I had the cheesesteak with lettuce and tomato, provolone, no whiz--I think it was called the California. It was awesome. I have had those cheesesteaks at Pat's and Gino's in Philly. These are better. And I definitely like Buster's  more than the cheesesteaks at Jake's in the Marina--no contest.   My boyfriend says that if the male Mexican chef is there, the cheesesteaks are at their best.  So take note!  Everyone sits at the bar at Buster's, and the atmosphere is best described as a dive. But it's sooo good.

pILrj__DvsPCm7w3bsjIsQ.review_text: I can't believe I've never eaten a cheese steak sandwich before. That might be a stretch...I'm a meat eater, I can't believe I don't remember ever not eating a cheese steak sandwich.   Anyways, the boyfriend and I were in search for food after attending Yelp's Holiday Hangover party. He loves cheese steak sandwiches and knew of one off Broadway (hmmm...coincidence that it's next to the strip clubs, I think not).   After walking around the block a couple times finding a place that would let us use the bathroom without buying a drink (tacky, I know...but I HAD to go), we finally made it to the cheese steak place.   It's your typical hole in the wall kinda restaurant. Tourists probably wouldn't want to stop in and eat there, as there are many swanky Italian restaurants that surround it. But if you're intoxicated and are looking for something to eat after getting motorboated in a strip club, I could see this a very potential choice.  At first, I was going to order a burger. But then I remembered, I liked meat and I'd probably like the cheese steak sandwich. So I decided to order the one with mushrooms and swiss cheese. The boyfriend got the jalapeno one and also a side of garlic fries.  Holy eff, this was so delicious! I can't believe I didn't eat more of these before. This was a good meal to have right before starting my 30-day cleanse!

8sKG4eCHu50gVGxQNVrkFQ.review_text: I love that it's open late and being in the heart of North Beach there's great people watching and shit going on. The guy who took my order may have been Buster but if he wasn't he should change his name because he was a bit gruff and surly but not in a bad way. Wish they threw the hot and sweet peppers on the cheesesteaks free of charge but other than that loved it. Good size, plenty of cheese and meat. Good stuff.

GCuDiPUKYxhgFHP5LqJa2Q.review_text: Last night was a warm beautiful evening in SF.  We sat at the counter alongside the window facing Columbus, enjoying the slight breeze and people watching while waiting for our food.  Despite what I thought we will come back to try, we ended up getting the North Beach Philly with provolone (it's the regular philly adding chopped and sauteed spinach, zucchini and onion) - damn, it was good!  The guys were kind enough to cut it in two for us without asking.  We also had the hot link with lots of sauerkraut - tasty.  An order of large fries - perfectly crispy but too salty this time.  A perfect evening with a hearty meal - all under $20.  It's really great they have all the sauces (buffalo, bbq, ketchup...) available in bottles and pumps at the counter.

oVXPGieKF8V7jsqhcMnr_g.review_text: Whoever the tallish, gangly-looking fellow is who works the late shift on weekends, he needs to cool it or at least have a shot of whiskey before coming in to work to take the edge off. His hair-trigger temper and propensity to kick customers out of the store while making sweeping bans to never return is a little too theatrical and over-board for a cheese steak joint. However, the food tastes so damn good, especially at 2 am and living within 2 blocks, I can't create enemies here.  That said, I wanted to one-star his ass on yelp and spit in my cheese steak, before realizing it was my cheese steak and that (albeit deserved) I may have made some less-than-tactful comments after receiving my very own banning. I of course don't expect him to remember (since he does this so often), so I'll be back for more steaks.

eKUGKQRE-Ywi5dY55_zChg.review_text: One friend attempting to sit on top of an ATM, then KTFO on the counter while my other friend and I chant, "WE WANT WINGZZZZZZZ!" Not only did my friend's bf have to be our eyes for the night (designated beer goggle wipers), he had to "babysit" us drunkies. Sorry, B! WELCOME TO OUR WEEKENDS...  On Saturday, 3.19.11, after going to Press Club and 5A5, my friends and I had a ravenous drunken craving for wings specifically Salt & Pepper Wings. With not many nearby options past 2 AM, a simple look on my Yelp App lead us to Buster's (closes at 3 AM).   Located in the centralized Columbus Ave in North Beach's nightlife scene, a lot of drunktards congregate and linger at Buster's for some post partying/stripclub eats. It's a VERY small place with only counter seating for about 10-12 people, so you'll probably have to eat it outside. Fortunately, we lucked out and got seating for four.  FOOD: Sorry, I don't remember the prices but it's higher than what's stated on the online menu. What I do remember was us ordering 2 Philly Cheesesteaks, Wings and Fries which was ~$38 because we got a $1 and some change back.   In all honesty, I was starving and happily buzzed so the food probably tasted better to me than if I was sober.   *PHILLY CHEESE STEAK w/ Jalapeño, Cheese Whiz & Avocado: GOOD!  The bread was soft and chewy and filled with piping hot thin slices of beef. The beef was well-seasoned and slathered with ooooey goeey salty, creamy and sharp cheese whiz sauce. The plentiful jalapeno added a tangy spiciness while ripe avocado added a layer of creamy butteryness.    *BUFFALO WINGS (20 pieces): YUMMY!   Perfectly crisp, meaty and tender, the wings were showered in a buffalo sauce that had the right balance of tang and spice. The accompanying creamy ranch sauce helped to cool off some of the lingering spice.   *GARLIC CHILI CHEESE FRIES: ARTERY CLOGGING GOODNESS!  The skinny fries were fried to a crisp golden brown and lightly tossed in a pungent but not overwhelming garlicky mixture. It was generously topped with beef chili and cheese whiz. The chili was beefy, hearty, and savory and the cheese whiz added creamy richness and tang. The rich combo of crispy fries, garlic with olive oil, chili and cheese would wake up any drunktards taste buds however, not without shooting your blood pressure and cholesterol levels up.  Don't forget to utilize all the bottled sauces: Tapatio Hot Sauce, BBQ Sauce, Tangy BBQ Sauce, Ketchup, Mustard, and Vinegar!  SERVICE: Friendly and good considering there's one cashier and two people manning a grill in hits high traffic establishment. However, it took a while for the food to come out; 10 minutes for our wings, 15 minutes for our philly cheesesteaks and fries.   The two cooks were Rockstars and were really manning the grill, trying to get orders out as fast as they could. It's not an easy job, so I give them the utmost respect. One of them was kind enough to get me a glass of water while he was trying to oversee the grill, so many thanks!  As I look at my Foursqure check-in at Buster's, I can't help but notice I shouted, "Wings NOT Boobies!" What exactly was going on in my mind that night/morning is beyond me but I blame it on the "conspicuous" name. :X

IxKVvGmFIEz77YYL-5_YxA.review_text: Delicious.  Just delicious.  Am I feeling too lazy to cook something for lunch/dinner?  I go to Buster's.  Am I drunk and need some tasty munchies? I go to Buster's.    I can't really comment on the rest of the menu because I order the same thing time after time.  Large Philly cheesesteak with CHEEZ-WHIZ.  I know, it sounds nasty but it's heaven sandwiched between a lightly toasted roll.  That, and an order of cheese fries (also slathered with cheez-whiz!)  Try it, I guarantee you wont be disappointed.

peXWpBYKrFs0h7HzFgkUTA.review_text: A little on the pricey side for a cheesesteak, and sometimes the rolls are stale, but when it's 2:30 in the morning and I'm hammered in North Beach, you could sell me anything for $8.    I went there sober once and it wasn't nearly as good, so I'll be sure not to make that mistake again.

kj8Xa6uachZ4oGK6bM3vkQ.review_text: For what it is, it's the best I've ever had.  A classic cheesesteak done right in a small place that screams working-man's meal; with enough options and variations to keep you interested and coming back.  I'm a regular for lunch and the occasional drunk food. I always get a large north beach with swiss.  The North Beach style with peppers, zuchinni, and spinach sounded like a these-don't-mix situation, until I tried it. The veggies complement the fantastic and traditional swiss on steak taste very well; not too overpowering but fresh and tasty.  And the vast assortment of sauces on the counter always lets you finish it off with whatever you're in the mood for (buffalo sauce, ketchup, Tapatio, barbeque, mustard, etc.). Despite my persistence with swiss, the vast cheese selection (cheddar, swiss, provolone, cheese wiz, etc.) always helps satisfy the picky eater as well.  As for the traditional elements of the cheesesteak, Buster's hits the nail on the head. The cheese is always expertly melted over all of the meat, the bread is tasty, if not a bit wet with juices.  The steak is classic philly cheesesteak steak, nothing more, nothing less. The option to substitute chicken is nice to have, but I've never tried it.  Seating and service is what you expect at a hole-in-the-wall style place. Limited bar seating (about 10 stools) with the occasional two or three sidewalk tables outside is usually at least 50% occupied, so not ideal for large groups wanting to sit together, but perfect for a quick meal.  The cashier is usually friendly and willing to remake sandwiches if the order was wrong. Cash only is a bit of a nuisance, but they have an ATM in the store.  Sandwiches are made from scratch and usually take about 8 minutes to be served.  I've never felt any more sick after eating here than I generally expect after eating greasy, cheesy food.

E9m9adcWg9h8mRX9idm9Qw.review_text: While I'm writing this review, I'm noticing that "corkage" is one of the survey questions, which is awesome.   I think the next time I come here, I'm going to have to order my regular Chicken California Cheesesteak (chopped and grease-fire grilled chicken, cheese, mayo, lettuce & tomato) and then ask how much it is to cork my 2001Tuscan Red to enjoy at 2AM.  I'm going to go out on a limb and say provolone on my hoagie would be a better pairing than Cheese Whiz, although it's a close call.

gL55_puYRC9XetMGTVrY6A.review_text: There's not much to say really.  If you like 'traditional' cheese steaks with cheese whiz, I'd probably go to Jersey Joes.  If you love a fantastic west-coast style cheesesteak that you can get when everything else is shut in the city, then go here.  The cook who's on usually on is amazing at putting these together, and on top of that very friendly, and happy to have a chat.  The atmosphere there is great.  The California cheesesteak is my favourite by far -- the bread is awesome.  I also like the beer selection here and the nice cheap prices.  Highly recommended.

i2HoIEOQAjFpOXTZZi2hCg.review_text: Awesome late night dining spot open till 3am. Sandwiches weren't that cheap but you get a lot of food. They have cheese wiz too if that's your thing. Get the large basket of fries. $2.85 for a huge mountain of crispy goodness.  The store is tiny with a few seats at the counter and some tables outside. Service was fast and efficient.

3SAAn35I_-kj6a7nqqBAmw.review_text: if you're ever feeling the need for some cheesy meaty goodness, look no further than busters. right smack dab in the middle of north beach and not too far from broadway *wink* this place stays open way late to cure your cheesesteak cravings.  not gonna lie - the cheez wiz is good (but i can only do it once in a blue moon, for i fear my arteries are clogging) but the fries are yummy too. cheap beer, a flat screen, and a huge fresh cheesesteak... what more do i need?  also - cash only!

NzDWS9HzKhiEZddIepiS7Q.review_text: Friends and I were hungry after a night of moto riding through the city.  Hmm.. what's open at this time of night?  ..Of course, North Beach!  Not knowing what we wanted to eat, we decided to just have quick cheesesteaks.  Parking was convenient on our motos because there's moto parking right around the corner.  Good luck in a car.  So we ordered 3 small Philly Cheesesteaks.  It took a bit longer than I thought for cheesesteaks.  After 15-20 mins., we got our food.  Belly satisfaction!  Tastes great too!  I could have given this place 4 stars for slow service, but the cashier-lady gave us a free basket of fries.  Big smiles from all three of us!  THANK YOU!  BUT, that's not all!  When we finally finished our cheesesteak and fries, the cook came up to us and gave us 3 free California Cheesesteaks.  He said it was "extra".  Extra free, that is.  WHAT?!  Double THANK YOU!    I'm definitely coming back to this place when I have a cheesesteak craving.

3U4sIMyI9Iax2X8GRr4eog.review_text: This is the best cheesesteak in the city. I've been here about a dozen times that I can remember, and even the one time I went there sober it was delicious. I take away one star because one time they served my sandwich on a whole wheat hoagie, but they've since redeemed themselves.  Wit wiz + hot cherry peppers and mushrooms

rMsckQ35fAdzgYZQr7VPmw.review_text: Oh my lord, when I found this place in a drunken stupor I thought it was the best meal I've ever eaten. Obviously things get scewed in different ways when you pound down shots with a man the size of Big Foot and submerge your face into a collection of steak and cheese just like a losing contestant on the Biggest Loser would do. But I might add, I also went there sober and it was very similar to the hazy greatness that I remarkably remember that fabled black out night.   Stay away from the Pizza, it looks bad.... but, there are so many Pizza places out there that when you see a greasy cook flipping a pile of steaming steak and cheese you'd be an idiot not to get the Cheesesteak... or a vegetarian.

KkHllgi8moYDDuQFuhqctg.review_text: I don't know if this place been sold to a new owner but the philly cheesesteak isn't the same as before. The steak is dry and not tasty as before. Unfortunately, I'm not going there anymore.

8kgQupO4TS2bpCGSPhTTIg.review_text: Bump!   Best place to get late night drunchies... EVER!  Their burger is freaking amazing. Perfect amount of ingredients plus heft to fill my belly and satisfy my greasy food cravings late at night. Plus the french fries are beyond salty and go perfectly with the burger.  Servers are SO FRIENDLY and helpful (though food does take a while to come out.) However, plus points for dealing with intoxicated people at such a late hour.

iqOaVJRprVKcT50t9k5jnA.review_text: Yes, five stars- however, please note that I have never been sober while eating here. Take from that what you will...

ICM-ZogVtiDt2vKS2NyyaQ.review_text: Living only a few blocks from this place, it satisfies my heart attack on a hogie need. My favorite is the  mushroom with provy, sticks tongue out like Homer Simpson's and drools. This place is good, the price is a little bit over. Overall it will fill you up.

0Q9y_SusaOkFgaTWMVMFFQ.review_text: I was in Buster's the other day and ordered a philly cheese w/ bellpeppers and mushrooms. The COOK (wearing gloves) grilled my chicken. A guy came in and ordered a burger. The COOK flattened his raw burger and put it on the grill. Then he picked up my bellpepers and placed them on the grill. UGH! HEY COOK, YOU DON'T TOUCH RAW MEAT AND THEN HANDLE RAW VEGTABLES!!! I hope you change your gloves when you go to the potty.

1vOzqpVjNp5NPV_QS5sIBQ.review_text: Bomb cheese steaks. But Provolone or Cheese Whizz...that's the million dollar question.

Ya_jdCMfALaBZBLSWG1fXQ.review_text: Kylie Minogue's "Come In To My World" video was the best part of this establishment.  The pizza slice was no where near the quality I desired for the price they were asking. The fries that came with it were good, but nothing special. The soda was more syrup based than others, so that gets points.  Basically, don't come here for the pizza. Pray they don't have god awful mixes of club songs on their TV (Paris Hilton's songs remixed are actually decent club songs), and really, really try to find something better around open. I'm sure you can do it.

NTwV9f7ANg2oxqdsPIZV5Q.review_text: Was waiting for my car at the detail shop and decided to come here with my gf for lunch. The place is very small and honestly is more of a deli shop than a spot to eat at. We shared a large chilidelphia which was a cheese steak w/ chili on top. noms. I'm pretty sure their entire menu is good. Then there was the garlic cheese fries. You have to try these. The reason for 4 stars is because the lady at the counter isn't very friendly and the place is a little dirty. (no one wipes down the table when people leave) I would suggest getting the food to go.

RtHYj81II1WYyCWha7VfEA.review_text: Synopsis: Good, greasy cheesesteaks that are fairly inexpensive and taste great. During the day they blast eurotrash videos that are amazing.  The Scene: Buster's is a great place - no pretenses, just cheesesteaks. They use to serve really bad pizza, but I have noticed that those are gone now. Good move. Everytime I walk in there, they are always playing euro-discoteque music which is pretty awesome, reminds you that you are still in north beach. The place is cramped, but that just adds to the charm - definitely feels like an east coast shop. If you go, I would definitely recommend sitting at the counter - there you can watch a plasma TV and get refills for your drink without having to get up.  The Food: The cheesesteaks are great. Personally I order the California Cheesesteak with provolone, mushrooms and no pickles. Very balanced meal right there. The fries are just okay, but with the plethora of sauces available, they don't need to taste that great anyway. I have tried the burgers there - they are pretty good, however I am hands-down a cheesesteak man.  The Best Part: All the options. You can put whatever you want on whichever sandwich: meat, cheese, toppings, the works.

rf6razuvxQYqJTY-ziZWZg.review_text: I'm sitting here with a minor hangover from a night of liver punishing drinking and thinking to myself, I should feel much worse from all the booze I drank. Oh yeah, I ate a large Philly cheese steak last night, Thanks Busters.  I have been here several times (sober and inebriated) and always left happy.  The sandwiches are really greasy in a good way with tons of cheese and meat. The bread is also very soft which makes everything go down easy.  My only complaint is that they do not have sweet hot peppers. They do however have jalapenos. Its just not the same.

mP3xXCmtMp4Q_EaINH1kuQ.review_text: I'm was very happy that this place was open late. But other than that, I didn't really like anything else.   I recommend anyone who likes chewing gum to order the tofu sandwich.  The tofu sandwich I ordered here one night was extremely chewy. They cubed the tofu into tiny pieces and fried them before putting it onto the grill (which was all pre-made), and that made all 8 corners of the tofu hard. This made the chewing and swallowing process not only difficult, but painful.   My recommendation, don't get the tofu sandwich or go around the corner and get some Pho.   THEY DO NOT TAKE CREDIT OR DEBIT CARDS

CDZWiihsmtiP-cgBRSSljA.review_text: Someone in our party, after we drunkenly stumbled out of Tosca's, announced a fixation on cheezy fries.  That is, she announced it again after announcing it over and over earlier that night.  She is, she explained, a bit OCD, and tonight it was cheezy fries.  And that obsession led us to the incomparable Buster's.  I may have just been a little tipsy, but I was not expecting such an amazing veggie po' boy/sub style sandwich.  I mean, truly outstanding.  Besides spinach, cheese, oil, and little cubes of tofu in there, I couldn't tell you what else was in there, but that sandwich was like diving into pure joy.  Next time, I have to try it sober to see if I just hallucinated it.  Pure satisfaction only cost $5.50 last night.  Even the meat-eatin' GF loved it, but I didn't let her have more than one little bite.  Oh yeah, the cheezy fries weren't bad either.  (and I'm usually harsher on North Beach eateries and bars, but I could go to Tosca's and Buster's a few times a week and be a happy man . . . )

S6u7sIXsfJsncZhtMKsMDg.review_text: If your up late or jus got out the club and your stupid hugnry, then this is a great spot to hit up. For about $7 and some change you can get a small steak sandwich which is a pretty hefty serving for its size and choose from a few different ways for it to be made. - I ordered the Phillapeno. Which is your choice of meat and cheese, onions and jalapenos.  I didnt have to wait long for my food. Chef whipped it up like he cheesesteaks for a living. Very solid and meaty philly.  Get it with the pepperjack cheese and it'll give it the perfect amount of spice.

MK7YxsfORqCa9LusJ-ZJ8A.review_text: I brought all my family and relatives, and the cheese steaks sandwich are spot on good, it was just an excellent meal after a long walk, the place needs more space, a lot of sauces to add to your sandwich, we'll come back if theres a chance

gqdbkfEvglt_b0AjvyUfug.review_text: This is a spot that you can never go wrong with. And talk about consistent? Everytime that I have stepped foot in there I walked out with a better experience than the last. So I pretty much tried everything in there that they had on the menu from their cheesesteaks to their cheeseburgers back to their chicken cheesesteaks. AND (because you know I gotta throw this in), they got some really good garlic fries. This is the best cheesesteak joint in SF hands down. Their cheesesteaks are well seasoned, and they are NEVER skimpy on the meat; which is where the Cheesesteak Shop on Divisadero messed up at because I have mostly been served bread out there, and that's for the birds! Anyone wanting a cheesesteaks should go here. Cool folks working there as well...  -Saucy MB

uV8kG4yg7RPlrH56qzDoVw.review_text: YESSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSS!  After a night of bar hopping, this is the place to BE!   FRESH HOT PHILLY CHEESESTEAK AND HOT CHEESY GARLIC FRIES...all VERY amazing.   Except I'm lactose intolerant so I ran to the bathroom that night and also all day the next day.  Hey, it's worth it. That's how good it is.

SrSr-KYsO2_QxxQlTYQVig.review_text: Hands down one of my all time favorite places to hit up after a night of drinking and dancing!  there is something about the perfect bread that just hits the spot!  While I was in college, I used to go skateboard with the BF and we'd grab a cheesesteak with some garlic fries here and we were in heaven.  parking here is a biyatch but oh so worth the circling!!  I absolutely love everything here.

sIXnEpHQ4cF6Wz9aeftUDA.review_text: Take note, the small sandwich is enough to suffice two people. These babies are huge! The only problem I had with this place was the dirty tabletops. There were bits of garlic and shreds of meat everywhere. Eew.  But it's understandable because it's impossible to keep neat when eating a pcs. I even contributed to the mess myself.

-NQXpKDDwHIK3y3bNR70EQ.review_text: Hit this place up on a Friday night after hanging out at a local bar.  I hadn't been drinking so the ability to rely on my tastebuds was high.  First off, this place is pretty small.  Drink selection is good and I was unaware there were so many different ways to get a Philly Cheese Steak prepared.  This was my first time actually getting cheese wiz on the PCS making it a true Philly, I guess (never been to Philadelphia).  I'm glad I ordered the smaller sandwich because it was pretty filling.  For some reason, the sandwich was delivered a good 10 minutes before the fries were which made for an awkward eating experience.  Also, the place seemed a little dirty and I noticed they didn't have health inspection cards posted anywhere.  All in all though, the sandwich was good and I'll definitely stop by again.  Probably after a few beers though next time as it's rare I hang in North Beach without a couple of brewskies.

IAPISTqQAqYC6mw1rtOttg.review_text: This place is definitely onenof the best places in sf to eat. Might not look fancy but the food is good. If you getting a cheesesteak go large

Lwg-POercSsk2A9rMMeHuQ.review_text: This is the best cheesesteak I've had on the West Coast. No surprises the guy behind the counter is from the East Coast. If you want a cheesesteak and you're in the city you are making a bad call if you don't come here. Small inside with limited seating, but that is irrelevant when the food is this good.

zlxg7BQ6StisAAC0cpUsZQ.review_text: I am definitely a fan of this place.  I order the Whiz Wit' every time.  Seems like a pretty authentic Philly cheesesteak to me.

adw9k1ecCswZA28qhkdCIQ.review_text: This is the closest to Philly you'll find in SF.  An unbelievably delicious cheesesteak.  My buddy and I had this after a number of drinks at Grant & Green and drifted this way for one.  We went back today to make sure it wasn't just the booze fooling us, and it wasn't.  This is the real, original cheez wiz, not that nacho cheese garbage or the imitation stuff.  The meat is cooked like a real steak and then chopped up as it should be.  I'm still open to the possibility that there is a cheesesteak out there better than this, but the bar has been raised.  They put the cheese both under the meat and on top.  Although, I would have rather had just a little bit less on the top, this is the way cheese wiz should be.  The gal serving acts like  a cold-hearted, condescending, Philadelphian which I guess is what you should expect.  She completely intimidated me into buying a pepsi instead of her getting me a free cup of water.  Complete pushover.  As far as what cheesesteak could be better than what I had here, I think there's still a bit of improvement to be had on the meat, but that's it.  I love this place.  Way better than anything in San Francisco and as good as Philly's best.

PBkUgCtHyauuaOr5FSSyTg.review_text: I came here late one evening looking for cheap eats and found some good ones here.  Cheap, good and filling. It gets crowded and you may get attitude.  Maybe.

mFsgzbMr11tQvm58yfuE4w.review_text: Buster's is great for both their burgers and their cheese steaks. Thye build both to order and you can watch them cook it right on the grill.  The small burger is quite large really and a good value for around $5.  Domestic beers are $2 for a bottle, and it is great to drink one while your food is being made and watch a ball game, which they usually have on the big screen on the wall..  I also have to give high marks to their fries.  4 Stars value 4 Stars food 3 Stars service.

KUXfzl-Sc1wn2nkX-Slyww.review_text: Decent cheesesteak that fills my aching need for one ever since I left Philly.  Not as good as Jim's, but then again nobody is.

GacogKHwekFNMxRBuq1pQg.review_text: One of the top 3 best philly cheesesteaks I've ever had. Melty and delicious, and made fresh.

yGK88pDjctaW-hJd8P3CTA.review_text: The food wasn't that great, but I was hungry, so I went here.  1st time here.  I got a headache after I ate here, but maybe it was cause I drank a new MONSTER energy drink that I got free from a MONSTER energy drink truck, parked on Columbus Ave.   The meat tasted somewhat "cheap" too.

8GuhWTHrEvpQViSkvvvZpQ.review_text: Busters goes on my 5 star list, as any staple should. My dad lives on the top of Green street, and when I lived with him as a stoner teen, life would not have been livable without busters serving me hot, cheesy steaky realness on a moments notice. If they were open later or delivered, they would get even more stars *if possible. Choose busters over Cable Car any day. Why tackle 3 consecutive hills, when instead I  can post up on the Kearny street stairs with a forty and some fries??? Hahah. Those days are over, but if you are hanging out in North Beach and not hunting for a fine dining experience, Busters is the place to grab a really filling, greasy, satisfying meal.

5QvbWKbSyLXwKveWZBmDyA.review_text: I had a Cheesesteak with the Cheese Whiz.  And while I love the idea, the sandwich itself didn't have enough meat, or maybe just too much bread.  It was salty and when I was there I guess they ran out of fries?  So I was disappointed to say the least.  I give it a eh...

GjHvBJCTnX9rF6bcqMWQRQ.review_text: perfect! we were starving, it's easy access, and they have vegetarian options. two thumbs up! and register girl super friendly. Beware of random incoming bums though, I mean hey! It -is- San Francisco.

bWvELivVIa81tFEqiLxS4A.review_text: This is a great place to grab some food after a long night at the bars/club.  My friend from Philly says the place is authentic, so it shouldn't disappoint those of you that need a real Philly fix.  I also came here for lunch with my coworkers, and although the cheese steak with the whiz was delicious, I definitely got no work done the rest of the day.

uoxFg3N3Pequsoz5IQRt8Q.review_text: I love it. I've only tried the philly cheese steak sandwiches and it's good. Price is decent for its size.

Uh9tZhGS-i52HZKbQKjgkw.review_text: Man oh man... This place is amazing weather you're drunk or sober! anything and everything on the menu is bomb-dot-com!  BEWARE, this is not for the weak-hearted or the diet enthusiasts!   And don't forget to get the Garlic Cheese Fries !!!!!!!!!!!!!!

si_JzsBn0s98cKPf4T1qhw.review_text: I ordered the standard Philly Cheese steak with Provolone. Good flavor, love the bread. Their "small" sandwich isn't small at all, they should call it regular.  This really is a "no thrills" kind of place. You get what you order; nothing less and nothing more.   One downside is that they don't even have tap water. It's SF...are you telling me that you're faucet water is not drinkable??? Ehhhh. Isn't that a bad thing? Or are you just trying to get everyone to buy your drinks?

pcxNoqnwrrU9tfv0KITN4Q.review_text: Thanks to YELP we stumbled (literally) to this little spot after a night of drinking in the FiDi of SF.! It's small and cozy with 2 rows of high top bars to eat at. That's it. We ordered right away and everything was hot and delish! The bread was bomb! Real SF sourdough! The meat was tender and juicy! The fries we got were enough to share, so we did just that. They come in a Chinese food carton. Loved that! They get a full star for serving coke products too. A perfect remedy for a night of drinking at Docs Lab.

ckzzBbHPecpudAaAbX-_nA.review_text: really good food for what you pay, nightime- hungry- awesome place to be ! really liked the california one and something else forgot its name, and sometimes the cheese fries ()once a month if youre not scared of the calories:) good place to be after 2 , hungry, when everything its closing or for a quick snack

bhJ6ivAuSpgXP4JiKWjSZQ.review_text: Service was not friendly at all.  The cheese steak was delicious.  HATED the garlic fries.  They weren't flavored or seasoned they were swimming in garlic.  Pungent and spicy.  I love garlic and didn't care for them at all.

tMym5FBTh76TzlQCsY6VWA.review_text: Ah the famous Philly Cheesesteak. I'd never had one before and today was the day to try this "delicacy". I was there with an actual Phllly native and decided to try an original - steak & grilled onions with cheese whiz (omg) - since that is the real deal and this is supposed to be the place to get them.    Two bites, two words - Instant stomachache. Cheesesteak meet trash can. Trash can meet cheesesteak. May you enjoy a long, greasy, artificial, waxy, orange life together.   Good fries. Absolutely fantastic location across the street from the legendary Molinari's where I got a delicious meatball sandwich to go.

2XDS3CqfNwgNuKAZKag-sw.review_text: I have to give an update to this.  It has been a good run of 3 years since I found Buster's.  But it looks like they are under new management.  The chefs are the same I believe, but the ship is ran a bit differently.    The personnel manning the cash registers on weekend evenings are rather rude and abrasive.  I grabbed a bottle of mustard to put into my sandwich (which was across from where the condiments are) and the lady immediately said "bring that back, it belongs here on this table".  Also, if you don't know, this place is a member with FiveStars (frequent consumer reward program) but the new management hides this fact.  When I asked about it she hesitated, shot me a dirty look, and then mumbled a yes.  Now for the food....oh why oh why did they alter the food?!?! The sandwiches have the meat skimped now - significantly less cheesesteak in my cheesesteak sandwich.  The fries are extremely over-salted.  The garlic fries are now made with garlic from a jar that isn't as flavorful.  Pains me to say this, but I think they just lost a faithful customer.  It has been a great run though!

j3kNH60B2GDAyZTkqK6O2g.review_text: For a late night cheesesteak, Busters hits the spot! They pack their cheesesteak with tons of meat! I get mine with provolone and with garlic cheese fries! A great 2am snack!

Io39_XRF6vZuOwOpcXjfBg.review_text: HOT TASTY PHILLY CHEESESTEAK                               +   Open Late... (like when the bars close late)                                =  The PERFECTLY satisfying drunchies (drunk munchies) midnight bite!!

TAzGPFt9x99JCYWtDmZDWg.review_text: Late-night cravers: if you want to be lame and boring, go to Denny's.  If you want unique, Buster's is known for their garlic cheese fries in Chinese take-out boxes and North Beach Philly Cheesesteaks stuffed w/ spinach, zucchini and peppers.  The guys that work here are pretty cool though - place getting trashed w/ drunkards and they still are cheerful and accomodating.

lxOcZ1VZ58nSCFgcunecjw.review_text: I'm a big fan of Philly cheesesteaks and have been dying to try out Buster's for a while since it is just up the road from my work.  I was finally able to try it out and I must say I'm a fan.  I just got the normal small Philly cheesesteak and it was made to perfection.  I'm not sure if they used cheese whiz or not but it was really good and the bread was nice and soft.  Great lunch time spot or place to grab something after a few beers.

5gbkhlWANGVzQYi_0m3vOQ.review_text: I'd like to say Buster's is at least good when you're drunk.  But it's not.   Tastes like it was frozen and reheated. I can't imagine how it might taste when sober.

_vzUY8ZNMJW0cCLWeLqH8Q.review_text: The burger were fresh and was very good!!!!!!!!

qNOs5NgO9745zFqi7AOM4g.review_text: crazy good Philly Cheesesteaks! The garlic fries were soooo good too. Definitely coming back next time I'm in the city.

GABWrw5Et9jubriKwMUDbw.review_text: Cheesesteak! I really don't know why else you'd come here.... It's great anytime, not just after 2 am! I love watching them make it. Next time I'll try with cheeze whiz as others have recommended. I usually stick with the original cheesesteak.

Qp82B2pd70qpQTj3KrlHHQ.review_text: 2 consecutive orders 17 minutes apart with other orders done first. rude service serious attitude and their "system was down" so I couldn't get loyalty points.

kNT1CgO1Q2Go1BeBqktzRg.review_text: Great for a quick bite which is exactly what I was looking for on this particular Sunday.  Decided to split the Cheesesteak large with provolone with a friend.  The cashier was all smiles and super friendly as she took our order and when the food arrived, it was split into two trays for us.  The food itself was delicious, you get to watch the chef from the bar stools as he whips up the delicious sandwich you ordered up.  If you are craving cheesesteaks, Buster's does a good job at satisfying that crave.

CSvgpDZt8i_JvThh7E9Otw.review_text: This place is right next to where all the nightlife is, so it has a great location for a bite to eat before OR after a night of drinking.  Pros: + Open late + Good price + Great selection (I recommend the Chili Cheese Fries & Cali) + Quick + Fresh + Large portions  Cons: + Employees can be a bit rude (probably used to dealing with too many drunk people) + Lots of obnoxious loud drunk people constantly rolling through (hence #1) + Dirty seating area (just stools on parts of the bar-type area) + CASH ONLY  The place is still serving up great cheesesteaks so none of the cons will stop me from coming ... I might just try to come before heading out to drink, or take it to-go and eat it somewhere else.

Qz3qWko-7VEaWS2tKuc9Aw.review_text: Pretty good chessesteaks.. i actually tried a chickencheesesteak the last time, it was ok. not the best.

v10dHdqf42tUkxbYVnFW6w.review_text: Almost as good as Cheese Steak Shop in SF I think.  Their Philly Cheese Steak could use some bell peppers for some added spice, but the meat and cheese they use and cook together is superb!  Provolone fosho!  Buns they use are alright.  Got a bunch of random sauces to add some spice to it.  $8.08 (including tax) for a large Philly Cheese Steak.  Good stuff for being open after 2AM on a Tuesday night squander down Broadway after the Giants game.

VmlShd8k2tq7-O4TVx5R1Q.review_text: OMG. You haven't live until you try Buster's Philly cheesesteaks. you know how Rachel Ray always have that look after she takes a bite of something. yea, i had the same look when i took a bite of the North Beach Cheesesteak. SOO GOOD. SOOO GOOD. I didn't try their garlic fries but their original plain fries was just as good -- crispy & salty at the same time.   Great and quick customer service. I love how you just sit along the booth and eat your food.

NeXRy1C7PxS7bvIcQ3SymA.review_text: Well it might not be as good as a Philly Cheesesteak from Philly but it's definitely the best I've had on the West Coast.    I decided to get a large Philly Cheeseteak with provolone ($7.95) which took a little bit to come out.  The man behind the counter makes one order at a time, regardless of how little or many cheesesteaks there are in an order.  I saw him sprinkling some white powder (garlic powder) onto the meat while cooking it.  You can definitely taste this.  The meat was thinly sliced and very tender.  I enjoyed every single bite of this!!  There is ketchup, hot sauce, etc. on the counter for you to use.  On this standard sub, there are grilled onions which definitely add to the yummyness.  My bf and I actually split this for a pre-dinner snack and it ended up being more than we expected... I would say it's about 10".  Now -.5 stars for the spacey, frizzy, blonde-haired girl.  I asked her how big a large cheeseteak was only for her to reply with "bigger than a regular sub."  WTH?  There is no indication on the menu board of how big either of those were so how am I suppose to know?  Regardless, I would definitely come back and add more toppings!

yduR6Wzf-q8hWXDL0S5oRw.review_text: Probably the maddest I've ever been in a restaurant.   The man in the liquor store around the corner had just gotten me with the classic sign- turn-door-lock combo right in the face, so I was already grumpy when I walked into Buster's.  I was buzzin', cousin, but in need of one last beer to keep me in the zone during the taxi ride home. I stepped to the counter and ordered a beer.   "No." WHAT?! WHY NOT!? The dude tells me that it's too late to serve alcohol. Oh, god no. I furiously point to the clock on the wall behind him, which clearly reads 1:52 AM. He tells me that the clock is wrong.  Before I can dig my cell phone out of my pocket, he pulls his out and shows me that the exact time is 1:58 AM, and unconvincingly explains, "I cannot sell you a beer this late. I can't."   So I slapped my hands flat on the table, straightened my back into an efficient yelling position, and barked at him for the entire time it took to cook my sandwich about how messed up it was to not sell me a beer. Obscenities were included.  Time it took for my friends to go from shocked gigging to embarrassed head shaking: 2 minutes.  I must say, the taste of the california cheese steak with jack cheese and a few squirts of buffalo sauce calmed me down enough to say "thank you" as I walked out the door, but I'm still mad at this place.

4bQvs68b4E4SueCXnohDYg.review_text: The price was right, food was good, and hours were what I needed. What more can you ask for? Oh yeah, garlic fries. Get 'em.  Buster's was pretty darn good. That it wasn't a fully authentic Philadelphia Cheesesteak... who the hell cares? Yeah, it's not an Amoroso roll. What do you expect from a divey place in SF?  When I went last night though, there was a dude standing right outside the door puffing on a cig. The smoke was entering the place. I didn't care that much, but the folks working there didn't try to move him along either. So... that might be bothersome for some people. Just saying.  Also, no fountain drinks. Canned soda. And the girl seemed confused when I said "I'll have a can of pop." I thought Californians were supposed to be cosmopolitan... (end rant)

z-kyHYF6oUad7inUVG0Mzw.review_text: best cheesesteak in the city...hands down!!!

cie1b9elyL3Xd-aXLvi6DA.review_text: If you want something fast, hearty and the pure satisfaction that only unhealthy food can give you, this place is it. The chicken philly's are great and they offer you an assortment of sauces and sides to lob into the mix. Can you say cheez whiz!?! Add a basket of fries and I'm in grease heaven. If you're daring, the chicken parms are good too... although, sometimes the rotating staff doesn't always know that its part of the menu.   Drawbacks? Definitely not for the health conscious.

_lbgVbWTvxV9VTVWU0YnwA.review_text: WHAT WHAT WHAT? I HAVEN'T WRITTEN A REVIEW ON BUSTER'S YET?   Oh man... drunk, sober, starving, kinda hungry... whatever! I love the steak sand with CHEESE WHIZ!  MMM mmm MMMMMmmmmm....   Garlic fries are bomb too!   Keep it up, Buster's!

Uyua4cAx4aw22iuz5Dr6nQ.review_text: The boys's pick so I ended up driving to Chinatown for some Cheesesteak.. *YEP! Chinatown folks, on a Saturday night, parking wars and crazy busy with folks bar hopping and getting into all sorts of trouble.*  This spot is on the corner of Vallejo and Columbus and is a little cramped so big groups are not a good idea unless you don't mind eating your cheesesteak standing up and outside. *I surely didn't mind bc for once it was a BEAUTIFUL no wind kind if night in SF!!*  *CASH ONLY* I decided to try their Cheesesteak with jalapeños and this is just AMAZING!! Fresh off the grill meat on a warm toasted roll, gooey melted cheese and jalapeños for some spice. *Best part was you get to watch the cook make your sandwich!!* After inhaling my first sandwich, I was still craving another so I went for their Cheesesteak with mushrooms this time around. *Ooo so yummy with gooey melted cheese and fresh mushrooms makes this the best combo.*  Great cheesesteak!! Considering I never really cared for it til today but you never know when one restaurant can change your thoughts about certain foods :)

d4W56YMgPScqglVdNxvMaQ.review_text: Erm. Yum. That's all I have to say.

S0yLkzB9QHC3Q4BpfM_iCw.review_text: Late night drunk munchy food within walking distance of my apartment. That's all I really have to say. Everyone has to have a place like this as a go to with a rowdy group of friends after the bars close.. and this is mine. I also happen to think the cheesesteaks are pretty great even when I'm sober, but I've nowhere near an educated palate. Tip the friendly servers who put up with drunkards all the time!
