pUopzKhcjsOALWhE2nbKbA.review_text: I've only come here for the cheese steak, and can say that they are ok. Yesterday my meat was extremely salty, but other times it has been better. They offer an option "wit wiz" and then do a 180 swing to offer the "California cheese steak" - shouldn't that be an oxymoron? I think that the more drunk you are, the better the food tastes here, and when not drunk at all, it's mostly so-so. The place is also super small, so you can sit inside only sometimes and there's limited outdoor seating as well. There are lots of crazies in the area though and I've never sat outside without witnessing someone having a mental breakdown on the street.....Be prepared for a line, and if you stand inside to wait for your food, you'll smell like the place when you leave....

Ov_pfcfLHPBIAZK7Uy7qkw.review_text: Good burgers. Greasy, but not too greasy. Decent prices.

OqgYxqEHc9K7oq-8VHJgxw.review_text: Best cheesesteaks ever.  Certainly better than Pats or Ginos in Philly.  I'd really only rate it four stars, but I have to give it an extra star since the chances of getting murdered are significantly lower than any of the cheesesteak places in Philly...

-twSpty9KDGNmrhvUjQLYQ.review_text: So my incredibly hungry friends post day 2 of Wondercon come through my area headed toward a different spot for food and ask me to come along. After waiting about an hour at the other place in the cold, I tell them, cheesesteaks. But not just any cheesesteaks; a place that is open till 3 AM. And so we set off to the land of late night partying, drunkenness, and restaurants that are open late, to Buster's. And as I've mentioned before, it's worth it. This place is small so it's hard if you've got a group with you but it's worth the wait if you have the patience. If not, get it to go. But as others have said, regardless of what state you're in, the cheesesteaks are fantastic.

MYA7v-Ty-8e8osWlEw0fyA.review_text: I love Philly cheesesteak and I've been to several joints and I have to say, this is my least fave spot. Came here last night and thank goodness it wasn't busy. We ordered the phillapeno in large and my boyfriend didn't get his cheese at all. Also, the cashier didn't even know what a hoagie was. I had to tell this couple what it was. On a good note, I liked their garlic fries. They actually served us a lot of it.   This place has limited seating. Food is quickly prepared. Came here around 10ish at night and found street parking, which means free parking! CASH ONLY! They have an ATM machine inside though! Would probably give this place another chance since everyone talks highly about it.

_DOhkyC51qiIqhdlgMgGeg.review_text:
I usually end up here late at night or when I feel like eating something unhealthy.  It is so good that you might consider punching an old lady for one of their cheesesteaks.
  I originally had this as a five star but I went back the other day to find out that they stopped taking cards and installed an atm(with a large surcharge),  I am really sick of this trend.  I don't care if you get a coupon for a dollar off a cheesesteak, it is still shitty.

7ccuuvYz9PAUMZ-2VVBZZw.review_text: Open 'till 3:00am on weekends! I live in North Beach and when I'm in a cab on my way home, totally wasted at the end of the night, I tell him to stop here. I get my cheese-steak and garlic cheese fries and walk home. Great late-night spot and pretty great cheese-steaks too. Better than most I've had in SF. Great job to all of the employees who deal brilliantly with the unbelievable amount of douche-bags who wander in from their "big night out in the city", off of Broadway.

xyNdK7m0i1Y4pb4gJicA6g.review_text: Holy crap, the owner's fanatic about perfecting his food. This is a VERY good thing.  You'll find him walking around in this tiny diner/hot dog stand, asking people softly in his dulcet Italian accent if they're enjoying their food, if there's anything he can get them, getting into lengthy discussions about his latest experiment with spices... for a second my friend and I thought, this weird old guy with his studded leather jacket, he's a North Beach drunk who is aimlessly hitting on everyone. Then we flat out asked him if he worked there... nope, he'sa da friggin owner.  The cheesesteaks are truly his reason to be proud. They're hefty, heavy and ANGUS. The meat is soft, delectable... oops. Did I mention messy? There's a pulldown napkin dispenser there which the owner smartly bolted in the center of the counter for that. Remember to come back next week - he'll come out with another new and stellar food creation by then.  The burgers are amazing. Also Angus. A small at $3.50!! (And by small it's really about a 1/2 lb). Cheese is fitty cents more, and other toppings it starts to be priced more at what it's really worth. The lettuce is bland, pale, shredded iceberg... optimal for the cheesesteaks perhaps, but not on burgers. And the buns are the standard whitebread you find on sale during Super Bowl BBQ grocery season. But who cares, these burgers are friggin good. The owner says that the key is not to rely on fats, and put all faith in spices. If you want your patties well done you better mention that - by default it's scorched on both sides at a total of five minutes, but inside it's deep red, barely bloodless. An island of condiments waits on hand by the napkins... but they sit unneeded.  They have a beautiful large flatscreen overhead that they waste on playing cheaply done music videos of hack "artiste" wannabes. It made for irritating dinnertime entertainment. Remedy that and I'd say they're that much closer to five stars.

xxxO3WDVSVJEE1fdNv8bmg.review_text: if you buy to-go, CHECK YOUR ORDER when you pick it up!    this place is located right down the street from piggy's place, and the food is actually quite tasty (4.5 stars for food), but there have been *countless* incidents of piggies returning home only to discover that something's missing or the order was filled incorrectly . . . .   minus 1 star!    . . . suspiciously, the "errors" always appear to favour the restaurant, never the piggy . . . .   minus 0.5 star!  hmph!  having to tumble down the hill twice in the span of 15 minutes to sort out food errors makes piggies cranky, tired, and also somewhat bruised! (+(oo)+)

HSZyANaM7KSyV7W_d1aoIg.review_text: I had the beef cheese steak called the Northbeach with whiz.. I could not finish it because it was tasteless. Hardly any meat and lots of dry chewy pieces. Cost $9.75.  Also greasy and the vegi's on it seemed old and also chewy. Yuck. Even if your drunk  much better thing to eat in the area!

rGdW50y9qjzvx2Zboyl9Mw.review_text: Purists may keel over from this proclamation, but the best cheese steak in the Bay Area probably wouldn't cut it in Philadelphia, the home of the Cheese steak sandwich.   Traditionalist never, I say again...never ever would order cheese steak with Swiss cheese, but if Swiss cheese was a cause for concern for traditionalists, a cheese steak w/ Swiss and mushrooms or even jalapenos or even chili would probably be considered a death sentence.   At Buster's, you find all kinds of cheese steak combination plus the traditional Cheez Whiz on their sandwiches.   The meat stays crispy despite being juicy and tender it fills a toasted roll and gooey cheese that holds thick slices of mushroom like boats on an oozing sea.   The soft give and earthy flavors of the mushrooms are a nice contrast to the sharp onions, and without the bell peppers there's a balance between subtle and strong. Dive in and don't be afraid of getting messy, any droppings become perfect fodder for a side of fries or better yet garlic fries.   Watching the cook and the cashier is like watching poetry in motion.   The friendly and pretty European cashier works the front, serves $2 domestic and $3 imported beers, cooks the fries and the buffalo wings.   The Latino cook had an organized system cooking the cheese steaks, While cooking he would be chopping onions, separating cheese slices and constantly keeping the grill clean. What was really cool was during his down time he stopped by to check if we liked the food, enjoyed our beer and briefly chat with us about his daily routine.  Furthermore, If people watching is your thang , sit by the glass window and enjoy your view of all the pedestrians walking by  North Beach.   And FYI they only accept CASH. Credit cards are not accepted in this facility.

ud2AM-h-SwBp5Whwg17XAw.review_text: Wow! Amazeballs cheese steaks and the best fries I've *ever* had! This place was so delish!   Upside: Late hours and great food. Seriously...they set the bar really high for cheese steaks here.   Downside: You will scarf your food down if only out of consideration for the next guy waiting in line to get his cheese steak fix. ...and then press your body up against a line of complete strangers as you try to get out of there because the space is so small. Still...totally worth it!  Helpful tip: Come prepared...this place takes *cash only*.

S7yjKXwg_varLZVZ8TJ5Bg.review_text: I want to go back to San Francisco just to get this Philly.  I dream of the steaming hot chicken mixed with various random veggies such as zucchini, peppers, onions, spinach, corn and mounds and mounds of melting cheese!!!  Holy smokes I'm hungry now.

cVHGXQFo2roQGH0wvZeWHA.review_text: Not bad! I came here last night with a buddy of mine after doing some frantic fist pumping at Ambassador lounge, and I actually bookmarked this place the other day. Let's say I made a good choice coming here.   This is definitely a good alternate place to eat beside your regular late night craving of pizza, mexican food, donuts, or pho. I mean they're cheesesteaks dammit! The fact that they're open til 3am in Little Italy/North Beach is a plus. I ended up ordering a North Beach cheesesteak combo while my friend ordered a side of garlic fries. Yup, another plus for having garlic fries.  What I like is how you can see the cook grilling your food while you wait. A side of fries for an extra $2.75 is pretty reasonable to make your meal a combo. Also note that a small size sandwich is roughly like a 6-inch you'd find at Subway. Good enough for me. The sandwich itself was smoking off the grill, and it was quite tasty from start to finish, granted I still had some of that dranky drank in my system. I will say that having spinach and zucchini in my sandwich was rather interesting. Not necessarily in a bad way, but I guess I should have stuck with the OG cheesesteak.   Good alternate place to go for the late night grub. Cash only and no seating booths, just bar stools and counters since this place is rather small. I'd come back again if I'm in the mood for it.

dviPtjXu-AzbefzWExaxGA.review_text: Buster's is a late-night must and perfect if you need to take something to-go.  I never remember what I order here but all the cheesesteaks are pretty delicious.  The fries taste like McD's fries.  You can't ask for anything better at 2am.

mZokz37TaR5jFgMrx4WyFw.review_text:
I've only been here during the day, maybe a drunken night out in N. Beach would've added an extra star.  On my quest for the perfect Philly cheesesteak outside of Philly, I'd rank this as an in-betweener.  As in, better than Jay's (yuck), but not as good as the Cheesesteak shop on Divis (better, but not quite there).  I'm still confused as to why they'd spell Philly phunny...I hope they weren't trying to Californian-ize it!
  Service is nice, but for a cheesesteak it's a little pricey.  By the way, it's totally kosher eating a cheesesteak with provolone as long as your smother it with ketchup...'whiz isn't the only way!

53DLQLI66gCEWpKLxbAnXQ.review_text: the cook was wearing gloves touching raw burger meat cutting veggies with a knive he had just used to cut a cardboard box with then made the burger for a customer all with the same damn gloves! wen i seen him doing this i had to stop eating and get out of there! i have the worst stomach pains vomiting its disgusting! now the customer service sucked ass a old white man with a green sweater was rude and was on the phone talking to his gf or bf about laundry like really do that shit on ur break!  i only went to try this spot cus i seen it on tv saying it was the first philly spot in the city but when i asked all the man said was "thats what they say" like why cant you just say yes you work there dont make ur company look bad! you want a good quality philly go to burger meister or phat philly! !!!! keep an eye on the cooks!!

Ud6j2HN40qEhycq2PuwcBA.review_text: The cheesesteak sandwiches were decent, as were the fries...Came here to join the madness and watched the World Cup finals as the neighboring Steps of Rome was already a madhouse filled with people at 10am. The server and cooks behind the counters were friendly and proactively took orders during the game on TV.

Lyb_t0GWeb6M5mTZZWiIZQ.review_text: It wasn't terrible but it wasn't great either.  I was raised in the East coast so my standards for a Philly cheesesteak are pretty high.  This fine at 2 AM after you've had a couple of drinks and need to eat something.

UyhnjAlyMXtbR-qB5kkhlQ.review_text: Eating lunch here on a weekday will put you into a food coma when you return to work. My coworkers and I all know this, and yet we still keep coming here.  I like both the mushroom and North Beach cheese steaks. A coworker recommended getting provolone and cheese whiz on the sandwiches. I was initially skeptical, but now I'm sold.      If you are craving fries, I recommend sharing. In my experiences here, a basket has been enough for 3-5 people to share if each person has a sandwich too.   Buster's is open until 3am, and while late night chili cheese fries would be amazing, I have yet to beat the Saturday 2am North Beach crowds.  Note: Cash only.

HYj4FLnYKlIk9EvBBWlKyQ.review_text: I would have to say for convenience and great cheese steaks with good pricing...It did the job and satisfied my craving for the day.

5jfLHtba3HYnRAWM6z2QyQ.review_text: I'm probably going to get crucified for this but I would be doing a disservice to this place if I don't say it.  Buster's is on par with the big 3 Philly cheesesteak joints (Pat's, Geno's, Jim's) and might even be a tiny bit better on their good days.    The cheesesteaks are champion here. The meat is quality. The bread is soft and seem fresh even at 2am. The cheese is fine. The fries are fantastic too.   If I were to be picky, I only wish they gave a little more meat in their cheesesteaks and that their onions were better. Onions were pretty scarce and seemed like they were cooking on the grill for a little too long.   Overall, just a really solid cheesesteak and a fantastic late-night eating option. I would be happy to eat here once a week. Makes me sad and angry that NYC doesn't have a place like Buster's. The cheesesteak options here are overpriced and not that good.

U3smfjQu-YqLwgODMPVAtg.review_text: Ugh. This place is overly hyped and EXPENSIVE. I can get a better philly cheesesteak back in L.A for cheaper. I don't understand how this place has a one '$' for the price. I believe it was $7.50 or so for a 6" sub, NO fries or drink included!! And the sub only contained grilled onion, the meat, and the cheese. That's it! For three people, it cost $27 for three subs and drinks. I felt it was mostly bread than the rest. Horrible. The cashier was so unmotivated to work too. The area was so ghetto. I felt so embarrassed to have brought my wife and mother here. Will not come back.  My wife almost had food poisoning as well. Couldn't sleep all night feeling nausea with stomach cramps.   There's no way this place 4/5 stars! It should have at most, 3. I smell fake reviews on here.

ZI43zlKUCjOVdEgcccs2bw.review_text: Definitely a shit ton of beer-goggle-taste-buds going on at this place.  Everyone comes in drunk and numb to taste, apparently.    Automatically this pussy is placed on a pedestal because of two things: -they give you an option of whiz.   -this place is grimey  ...Now all the foodtv sheep and the kids from philly are creaming their pants on its "authenticity".     Here are the facts...  -The meat is dry and bland. -10 bucks gets you a large sandwich that's not that large.  -Meat, bread, cheese, toppings.  There's literally nothing they do that differentiates themselves.  They can't even keep from overcooking the meat for fuck's sake.

nr01g39LK6fPpydfvuy8sA.review_text: I can't eat bread so they created a burger-treat for me, sans bun. It was tasty and I didn't get food poisoning so two stars for that.  My caveman of a boyfriend thoroughly enjoyed the cheesesteak- one more star. He devoured it within moments with a "me like sandwich" confirming his sentiments.  Lastly, were alcoholism a becoming personality trait, I would thoroughly enjoy drinking a handle of gin and stumbling on down to Buster's for a nightcap of griddled meat smothered in cheese and such. So add another star for potential.  Overall thumbs up.

1B6_nsdtF7ogQtOTho4U5Q.review_text: Such friendly and laid back service. Makes me feel like I'm at a ball game-- I can't really explain it, but the sensation is there for sure!

ouYqU_kym2Zdsb_O0MmmPA.review_text: Love coming to this place!  It is very well priced. I usually get the chicken wings, which are absolutely amazing. And the cheese steaks are very yummy as well. I love to sit at the counter and watch the cook go nuts on the grill. Excellent!

nsawcqioX0NDmqsDsM8L4w.review_text: Artery Clogger - a heart attack one bite at a time  East Coast you have a ton of sub shops which are hard to come by.  They do a good job replicating it here.  They have signature subs and I've tried most of them.  You can't go wrong by coming here except your body will hate you the next day.  I like this better than steak escape.

34bU3gnSHUFHNPLNvwl8fA.review_text:
I've tried buster's a couple times. I tried their pizza a while ago, and was grossly disappointed, but i shouldn't have expected much. I was hoping it would be good though, because aside from goldenboy, it's hard to find a decent slice around north beach.
  Then I tried their cheesesteak. I was again disappointed, though not as severely as with their pizza. It has promise and perhaps it's better on other days. but the meat was on the overcooked side, the bread had an off taste to it, and it just seemed overpriced.
  Most recently, I tried their cheeseburger, after walking by dozens of times and seeing their sign about their hormone- and antibiotic-free hamburgers. today, i was craving a burger, so I figured I'd give them a shot. I can say that I was satisfied. The burger was pretty good. I didn't try their fries or anything, but the meat was pretty tasty.
  I doubt i'll go here on a regular basis for lunch, but it's good to know that it's a viable option when I'm feeling like a burger without taking the trip out to in-n-out during a workday. I might even venture to try another cheesesteak.

K7K7D-ZJls1tAqvKuF901A.review_text: The onions are always grilled to sweet perfection and the meat is preservative(and hormone?) free and flavorful.  Buster's has been our go-to place fro those nights that we need hot, savory comfort food "right now."  Jose is always smiling and at the grill, and owner Kieth does the fries.  Buster's Cheese Steak is a the warm and friendly neighborhood joint everyone needs.

kZJWAY828P8QZTqVYzhTCg.review_text: If you're in the mood to clog your arteries at 3 am, Buster's is open to help you out with that. Located on Broadway, surrounded by world class strip clubs, lounges & other fine dining establishments, Buster's really shines as the star of the late night/early morning comfort food world. Seating is limited: about six chairs facing the kitchen where "the magic happens" & about another six stools along the wall facing the street & passersby in various drunken states.  The bf & I had: - a cheesesteak with cheese wiz - a california cheesesteak w/ provolone- comes with onions, tomatoes, lettuce & pickle (freakin fantastic.) - cheese fries  - a root beer - a gatorade total: $19  Buster's cheesesteaks are messy & delicious & just what you need after a night of sinnin' (aka FUN!)  P.S. the order taker lady is a complete space case, but she gets the order right & she's nice enough. And cash only.

HRddkCn4Ax4UBo_DhTUSHA.review_text: If you're in San Fran, this is the place to go for a philly cheesesteak sandwich. Granted, I don't know if there are any other places since I don't live there... the experience I had was great. It's a nice hole in the wall, and seemingly packed with people. The food is what you expect, but definitely make sure to get yourself some garlic cheese fries.

05Ay9vztjTqzRI9nOp7jSQ.review_text: Recommended by nearby establishments, before I'd even tasted anything that is a good sign. Happened to be staying near here but will now seek it out for a late night sandwich. Philapeno is excellent.

zZPvkMp9_egrmqYNkOhxXg.review_text: Last week, I took the team out for lunch and we went to Buster's for some Philly Cheesesteak, cheese fries, & garlic fries.  It was mouth watering juicy and oozing with flavor, plain Yummy!    Buster's was known as "The Old Philly Cheesesteak", now it looked a lot different than I remember some 15 years ago, no more Philadelphia newspaper wallpaper.  The place is still pretty tiny - counter seating for 8 & outside seating for 6, service was ok with a little attitude.  :)'  Trust me - you've gotta order the large Philly for $7.45 & add cheese to your garlic fries $3.75!

kVwvb9vW0sPBGryY8slB-w.review_text: Your typical hole-in-the-wall, oil-dripping burger joint.  The burgers were really large, which was a plus, but I was pretty disappointed with their cheese fries.   Tip #1: Call me optimistic, but I was expecting their cheese fries to have, well, real cheese. The poor fries were drowning in nacho cheese sauce.   Tip #2: Burgers are huge!  Overall:  Good for burgers and your typical American food, but THE FRIES!  Extreme disappointment for the cheese fries.

n6GBeJVd1C2dszlSOBAfJw.review_text: I'd prefer Cheesesteak Shop on Divisadero but it's not bad here too. Good garlic fries and cheesesteaks.. They give you lots of meat!! Get a large and share. Plenty for two with an order of garlic fries, you're set. Workers there are really friendly too. Open late night so if you're hungry and in the neighborhood try it out.

j68Lgtr5BSs3PZYKSmizCQ.review_text: Not sure if it was the free flowing booze at Mr. Bing's or the fact that I was starving and it was way after midnight but this was one of the greatest cheesesteaks I've ever had. Great people watching also if you sit at the bar.

FwnqROgRqVz2aS-gjrxy4w.review_text: It was the first time visiting that place because that's what I found when I typed 'hot dog' in yelp. It seems pretty cool at first: as a Russian I really enjoy visiting places that feel truly American. The person who was working in there today was completely rude and unfriendly to me and my girlfriend. It seems like we were not customers to him but just random people walking in there to bother him. I finished my hot dog and fries and left that place with really negative feelings and was happy to walk in to a bakery close by where I got friendly treated like a customer. The hot dog and cheese dog were pretty average. I must admit the french fries were really awesome though.

AgSPAk3wLf6GES4GbL0nFQ.review_text: This one of my favorite places in SF.  The meat in the cheesesteaks is high quality, the food is always almost too hot to eat when you first get it  (something i love), portions are decent size, and this place is open til 3am!

epS_iB4nRr9ru8qkQHrU4Q.review_text: Came here for lunch for a cheese steak....really good and hit the spot!

2nE0zU6y_F7gkwHi3yL6cQ.review_text: Waiting for a cab around 2am in North Beach? Grab a Cheese Steak Sandwich!  Yes, I do think that you'll probably gain a pound after consuming so much Cheese Wiz, fat, and meat. But is it worth it? YES.  I usually come here after Kell's or Bubble Lounge. Its a great way to get some food in your system and prevent a hangover in the morning.   There aren't any real tables inside, but there are a few stools for you to sit on and eat.  Tip: Try to share the sandwich if you can, it's MASSIVE. & delicious! =)

_vJaZ3r634EYmbw79imwaQ.review_text: The best cheesesteak I've had to date. I went with the California cheesesteak with chicken and mixed it up with half cheddar and half provolone, wasn't sure if I made the right choice with the chicken but about five minutes later I was very satisfied. My boyfriend had your traditional philly, I had a bite, it was alright but mine was better. We split a side of garlic fries, they were also very tasty, this places doesn't skimp on the garlic so be prepared for some greasy garlicy goodness! I'm not sure how the philly cheesesteaks was made so popular in California (we noticed quite a few philly steak places in the area) but I must say that this place had a better cheesesteak than what I sampled in Philadelphia; if you're in the neighborhood stop by and give it a try.

miY7B32VgfHsdRoVP9Nl-A.review_text: This place really is fantastic for cheesesteaks! I've never been a fan of them until I tried the one here. The most fun part was trying all the bottles of sauce on their counter with them. They range from buffalo to tapatio to garlic chili sauce along with like 10 others. The meat can get a bit dry, but it was amazing with the buffalo sauce.  Also- get the garlic fries. It had my breath smelling like garlic for hours afterwards.

EEGTwmpcaug8-w0Tal76aQ.review_text: Basically: I was pretty damn drunk at the time, but my friends handed me half a Buster's Philly cheese steak and I, of course, took it without question. It was an awesome sandwich. Fries were great too. This drunk guy was in heaven.  Buster's was a godsend that night especially because they were open late. Definitely going back next time I'm in SF.

B4cJvWuf59j7XlTdexnVZw.review_text: Got the large Chicken Cheesesteak for the first time as I was in the mood for a non-beef item.  They put in a TON of chicken and it was very good quality.  It's far less greasy than the steak steak, which leaves you not feeling as stuffed, though some may think it was too dry, but I did not.  At $8.08 after tax, it's a good deal.  I don't think fries are necessary for most appetites.  Also, I like that they have stacks of papers, including The Onion, for reading while eating there.

oN2pUG6LItlPJMTC6QHc0g.review_text: I first tried this place awhile back and forgot how the food was so I decided to grab lunch here.  The weather wasn't so good so it was kind of dark inside.  One upside is that there was a TV inside and they had a football game on so instead of grabbing the meal to go and watching the game at home, I decided to eat there.   I ordered the mushroom cheesesteak and would say that this sandwich could easily be rated four stars for taste and the portion size.   The garlic fries on the other hand were pitiful due to the fact that they were soaked in oil which made them very soggy.

jnVqZ_bCzotRueQSNcnq-g.review_text: "Best cheesesteak EVER??" Not so much. "Really freakin' good after many pints of guiness?" Oh, hell yeah!  The product is not exactly consistant, it seems to be different every time, even though the grillman seems to be the same guy and the cashier is the one that apparently changes daily. Still, it's damn good stuff with perfect hogie rolls and a plethora of options. Personally I feel extra cheese is necessary, but that could just be me.  I've never bothered with the pizza or burgers (the sign over the door says "cheesesteaks", ya know), but the cheesesteaks were well worth the price. The "garlic fries" which are made with a lot of lemon pepper seasoning and no garlic were... interesting. I'd stick with the plain ones or skip them alltogether.  [edit] Recently I tried the chili-cheese fries and am sad to say that they are god-awful. Cold canned, gelatinous chili-like substance and luke-warm plastic cheese, exactly like the stuff they make nachos out of at 7-11. The (new, again) girl behind the counter was trying to be nice and gave me a large with extra chili and cheese drowning the poor little shoe-string fries. I say "trying" because after I tried it I realized it was really not a nice thing to do. I ate a little of it, became nauseous and threw the rest away. Stick with the cheesesteaks and you'll be fine.  [edit again] After spending my weekend working my ass off for the man, 10 hours a day (usually it's 12.5, so today I got off early!), no breaks, no meals, nothing but hot sweat and forced smiles (god I love the food service industry!), I found myself starving, walking home and really freakin' irritated. Adding insult to injury, everything in my area of town seems to be closed on Sunday night. Even Clown Alley. After hiking all the way up to Buster's (I can't go anywhere nicer - there are grease-stains on my shirt and I'm sticky and disgusting), I decide I'm not in the mood for a cheesesteak and decide to go with the burger. Holy crap! It's good! Really good. Greasy as hell, but man was it delicious! Clown Alley, but you just got your buns handed to you (sorry, my system is still in shock from the influx of protein, carbohydrates and sheer caloric mayhem). I hate to say it, but the meat actually tasted better than Mo's, who grind their meat fresh. Now if only they offered blue cheese like Mo's does... Mmmmm... blue cheese burgers...

YccvTneu0YMuPxlBw-Qylg.review_text: Came here with a good friend for some mouthwatering, reasonably-priced burgers ($6.5) at 2am on a Friday. Supposedly everything is fresh and not frozen.  Asking for anything more would be a sin.  I heard the fries are also good.

qHmLQQZF1GKrU6HFZqZqGA.review_text: Late night partying = late night snacking!! Buster's hit the spot!! I got the Jalapeno Cheeseteak with Provolone and it was yummy! My only gripe is that the bread was a bit hard and scraped the roof of my mouth. Other than that it tasted wonderful and the jalapenos gave it a nice kick!  FYI- CASH ONLY.

XvOY_bk_KWqnqGvjwZxOxQ.review_text: Gimme a greasy ass cheese steak and some buffalo sauce, please :) Yeah, this place rules. I'm down with a non-healthy option once in a while and this place is it. My friend had the huge bacon cheeseburger and it was just AMAZING to watch him try to eat this thing. I ordered the cheese steak. Plain and simple. Ya see, I'm a New England gal, and cheese steaks are how we roll. These bitches do it up right. Will be bringing friends here anytime they want a naughty food option. Only gripe is the floor, that shit is slippery......watch out!

G66J4Z0l0kXBKBhbgqm1IA.review_text: After watching 4th of July fireworks on Pier 39, we were walking home on Columbus, famished and dying for some grub.  We come across Buster's and decide to give it a shot - after all, they are the self declared #1 Philly Cheesesteak in the land (they even got a sign out front to prove it)!  Service - it was OK, food came out fast. Food - ordered a cheesesteak and fries...Bread was stale, meat was greasy, fries were half cold and had that bitter old grease flavor. Decor - you walk in and are surrounded by a giant aroma cloud of grease and onions.  So why is this dive so highly rated?  Gotta be the beer goggles...Everything tastes good when you got the drunk munchies.

3hFMGZg0CtNPeu0TvtXfBA.review_text: Very good cheese steak sandwich.   I don't eat cheese steak very often, but this was very good and served very hot.  Garlic fries were OK..  ,   Got seats at the counter and prompt friendly  service.  Saturday afternoon in North Beach, every other place was busy, but Busters was empty!   Got four more customers while we ate...   Buster's  seats about 12 people inside.   Parking is difficult in this area, but I would return to Busters.  My friend liked his burger -( half pound !)  Prices  seemed OK for the area..

UzxCvpCQDdoDwPomXHMUgw.review_text: I went here during the day, not drunk or anything.  See, I try to avoid the late-night walkup places in bar areas on account of they are full of choads and douches who want to fight.  And then I would be forced to kill them messily.  So it's just practical and more ethical for me to eat first then drink, see?    The steak was first class and half the fun is watching it made before your eyes with two spatulas blurring into one and smoke leaping from the grill as extra grilling sauce (my sources say "oil") is laid on.  Sweet peppers are a no-charge option and the large size is quite large.  Real cheese wiz (oxymoron?) places this sandwich slightly above that at Theo's, for now.  Still have not tried the actual honestagod real cheese at either joint so I will now proceed to do that.

nT2yukuWpgXFKmz7pgt8jA.review_text: Best Philly cheese steaks! Prob not the biggest fan of the garlic fries. To each their own hey? :)

gk5BjGoT--YRci9ZJ_WElQ.review_text: I got the mushroom philly cheese steak which tasted horrible. The garlic fries had no garlic flavor . The buffalo wings did not taste good either ... it lacked flavor . I feel like this place is a tourist trap !

-vTrhRbmEzB8Ax87bfL-qA.review_text: I would have never noticed this place if it weren't for my guy's recommendation.  Buster is a great place for Philly cheesesteaks!  I have their small mushroom Philly cheesesteak with provolone cheese. The meat was juicy, tender, and flavorful. Most places I've tried the meat was dry and wasn't marinated well.   I've also heard great things about their garlic fries, I must come back for me!  4 STARS

vPgbln2h0kqsCVvMMQytJQ.review_text: This is as legit a cheesesteak as I've had outside of Philly. I actually go for lunch, and it's not super crowded at that time.  I usually get a steak with whiz, but have ventured into the jalapeno one, which is a really good variation on a traditional sandwich.

2X_c1zE0OcdxkZq31kh7Dg.review_text: We decided to try this place after seeing the reviews on Yelp. But unfortunately, we we're let down.   My boyfriend ordered the bacon burger and I got the mushroom Philly cheesesteak with large fries to share. After my boyfriend took a few bites he realised they forgot the bacon so when he went back, the guy took his burger and set it aside whilst cooking some bacon. I thought the cheesesteak was ok but needed more flavor. We were still waiting for our fries but after finishing our meal we decided to get our money back for them.  There were no apologies given throughout our time there which we were a bit annoyed about.   Overall - the food was 'okay' but I wouldn't recommend this place.

kyG14FyCWmVW3Uefs_GE_Q.review_text: I stumbled across this place on the recommendation of a bouncer at a bar while looking for a quick bite before joining my friends at the Irish pub down the street on grant avenue knowing that if I showed up to meet them on an empty stomach and started throwing down shots of Irish whiskey I would be in deep doo doo later on.  I am always on the lookout for places with decent cheese steak sandwiches, a thing of beauty when done properly.    My first meal here was the regular cheese steak with cheese whiz in keeping with Philly tradition.  Let me tell you it was amazing.  The roll was soft and packed with cheesy meat, the perfect start to a raucous evening of revelry.    Since then I have been here many times.  Their cheese steak with provolone and sweet and spicy peppers is my favorite.  Sometimes I'll get that with bacon.  They chop up the bacon and cook it on the grill with the meat before melting the cheese into it and it's an artery clogging heap of love.  I also love their garlic chili cheese fries although they don't always love me back so I've taken to just getting the sandwiches.  One of the great things about this place is it's open very late.  It also happens to be at the bottom of grant right at Columbus so if you're coming out of the row of bars there and stumble down hill you will wind up here.  Talk about location!  I am a total fan of this place, so I'm giving it four stars.

LubyTiOyAZx00BIJPwlxIA.review_text: We used to get our hamburgers from Mo's, around the corner, but now we get them here! Juicy and cheaper, plus the bread is great! Cheesesteaks are a bit dry, but still yummy. They don't have a take-away menu, but if you call in, they'll make your order to pick up.

njXFegFZGrhLYxzZINem5Q.review_text: I'm a fan of cheesesteaks and this is probably the closest thing I've had to having an authentic philly cheesesteak. When in Philadelphia don't ask for a Philly Cheesesteak, if you do they'll know you're a tourist. You order it by it's normal name, which is a cheesesteak. Here the cheesesteak is a cheesesteak, nothing so special about it. What Buster's does have that I give it credit for is how they have Cheeze Wiz. That ol' american processed cheese is just the way to go when sinking your teeth into one of these sandwiches.   The downside about this place is the bread that they use (a good cheesesteak sandwich is all about having good bread). The rolls they use here are on the hard side. In Philly it's a little cripsy on the outside but chewy on the inside. Why do I keep referencing Philly? I do because Buster's claims on the banner outside that it has the Best Philly Cheesesteaks or they'll change their name, when in actuality it's just a regular cheesesteak. I think they should just change their name now to Buster's Cheesesteaks with no reference to origin.  Won't say that this place is bad, just not super. If you want a real Philly Cheesesteak you have to go to Philly. My choice in Philly is the original place of where cheesesteaks came from Pat's. There are tons of other big shops in Philly, but the mom and pop shops win out over those.

L_s3ksHCgkc97CR4Wr5WwQ.review_text: Came here after being out for happy hour.  Good phillys.  Parking is tough, so usually we have to have someone drive around while someone runs in and orders.  If you're out in the area and want a quick bite, this is a good spot.  Not enormous portions, which I prefer and it's not super messy.  Not much seating, so don't be afraid to sit next to a stranger.  It's open late, which we like as late night options are hard for us to find.  This is one of our favorite local spots.

4Ch_27GkNV5p7I7ewlX3DQ.review_text: So this is the second time we have been here for the philly steak sandwiches.  Last time we just kinda bumped into it and have dreamt about this place ever since.  It was one of the must go-to spots to eat while we were visiting again in SF.  You cant miss this place....its a bright yellow store front located on a corner in North Beach with the big letters displayed BUSTERS.  You cant miss it.  The place is small inside....very small but they do have a few two seater tables outside.  Inside would seat probably under 10 people.  It almost seems the kitchen is bigger than the seating area.  My favorite part is sitting at a bar that overlooks the street....the windows open when the weather is nice.  It is a moment that being on vacation you just want to savor and take it all in.  Sigh.  Ordered a hotdog and fries for the daughter and it was huge and devoured within 5 minutes.  Guess it was good.  The BF and I ordered the philly steak sandwiches with American cheese and onions- one with regular fries and one garlic fries.  Pretty close to the best philly I have ever had.  First bite in was just like I remembered.  Savory goodness.  I think little hearts or stars surrounded my head...its all a little fuzzy.  By the way disgustingly enough I ordered the large....it was either a 6 inch (small) or a 9 inch (large).  AND sadly enough I didn't have a problem eating the whole thing but it was so fantastic I literally could not stop myself.  The fries were great too...perfectly cooked-a little crispy but not too over done.  All washed down with a canned soda.  Take a look at the yelp pics...you will see what I am talking about....IT IS all as good as it looks!

v1MgXY1gKx1qwcIZ2QGAoQ.review_text: Did it satisfy the late-night post-bar-hopping craving? Yes indeed! It's in prime location for all the North Beach bars and ensures that you have something greasy to soak up all the beer and can wake up in the morning all fresh and dewy and hangover free.   Pretty crowded however and may be better to grab and go. Also, the cheesesteak was a bit dry, and it certainly doesn't measure up to Chicago's Hoagie Hut, hence the knocked off stars. The cheesy fries use nacho cheese or something along those lines, not my idea of cheese but my friends seemed to enjoy them. All in all, it was a satisfying end to a good night and seems worthy of trying on a night out in North Beach.

x-99FdFqFcvNAecfYr8i5A.review_text: This place serves Cheesesteaks AND Pizza. I'm not positive, but I'm pretty sure that if God owned a restaurant, he'd serve Cheesesteaks and Pizza. Probably burrito's too. Just sayin'...  It's a small restaurant, ney, joint. This place is definitely a joint. The cheesesteaks are served hot and fast. Mine was smothered in cheese whiz which burned my fingers as it streamed down them. It was a very messy meal, but completely awesome.

b1TLsiRhQdfbbXahqFkVtg.review_text: What do you want after drinking 12 pints of Harp, 2 shots of tequila and 4 shots of well whiskey?  If you are anything like me you want at least an 8-ball of cocaine..... Or a cheese steak.  This place delivers on the cheese steak tip for sure, they use Whiz.  That is really what makes it.  I think that the food here is so damn good that it brings me out of a blackout.  I mean it... I go from slamming booze and calling my friends horrible names to waking up half-way through a cheese steak here.  No doubt.  As far as the 8-ball... can't help you.

TmhFYYTHodJnrubq9IeFNA.review_text: I was excited to try this place after walking all over North Beach undecided on what to eat. I love cheesesteaks! And the sign said Philly on it, so had high hopes. Plus I didn't want to spend a lot of money.   I ordered the North Beach cheesesteak, large combo (lady at the counter talked us into getting the combo). Comes with a drink for $2.75 more. My partner had small regular cheesesteak combo as well. I forgot to order with Cheez Whiz dang! I was really looking forward to the Cheez Whiz man!  Maybe it would have made a difference because the cheesesteak was totally bland. Had zero taste to it. No salt or pepper. My large looked exactly like my partner's small! Not sure what the difference was except for the price. I'm from San Antonio and I've had better cheesesteaks than this. I guess I wll have to make that trip to Philly to get the real thing.  It did not turn out to be cheap either. Almost $25 for 2. Good thing I can say is the view was great from the counter. It's small place so we were lucky. And only takes cash. I would pass on this one is my advice.

R4b9uTzOI-9d0ussqSqR5g.review_text: Mmmmmmmmmmm maybe its because it was late and we'd just finished dancing/drinking around the area, but this place sure hit the spot.  Garlic fries were good, and North Beach cheesesteak was super yummy.... i liked the vegetables they toss in here.   not TOO greasy, and the smell just lures you right in.  My kinda place for a late night drunk grub.

LCS_WeePean41Vx_x6M2MA.review_text: my friend says Buster's is her "crack cocaine."  Something makes these sandwiches very hard to put down. They are delicious and they are open late. I usually decide on the spicy option with jalapenos. (Even better when buzzed :)  Delicious!

t9rdfVCOg_HnaH7RN_r7mQ.review_text: This place is open late and has awesome Philly Cheese-steak Sandwiches. The only problem is there's really not much room to eat, so we walk over to the park in North Beach eat there and finish it off with dessert at Steps of Rome. Love this place!

xMNS7Ryl1ptKLE9Ki5Zw1Q.review_text: Hard to beat for a late night snack. There aren't that many other choices in the area and the cheesesteaks are tasty.   I recommend the California. Both the chicken and steak are tasty. You can grab a beer too.

3hL4RHGVClTwXPUpv0DuGQ.review_text: Probably my favorite cheese steak places thus far. I am usually not big on the sandwich, but I am glad I tried this place out. If you get the chance, try out their Cheese Wiz. Best cheese topping of all time. For a further review, go to my food blog: foodcreatespoop.wordpres…

BiCxub0Oyyj3kfEZfUs20g.review_text: As expected, the place was kinda crazy on a Saturday night- sloshed boys & girls in hooker heels pushing & shoving, you know the drill. Boy got a cheesesteak + fries at 2AM and even though I was still bloated from dinner, I ended up eating at least half of everything...):  I'm not sure how it compares to authentic Philadelphia's cheesesteaks but I'm definitely a fan. And the late hours are an amazing perk, especially for a city with relatively few late-night muchies options.

bD9o2IdglGl_YZGZt-tWwA.review_text: The best Philly in SF. The place is Popular because of location, in and out ease, and DELICIOUS Philly cheese steaks. Their burgers and garlic fries are fantastic too. It is a lot of fun to stop in at anytime in the evening and either run in to grab a bite or chill at the bar and watch the creation of heaven before your eyes. Great late night times!!

y8lz_6KWGOQ9jcTyIdwTLQ.review_text: Has gone downhill slightly, I believe due to new ownership, but still good for late night North Beach cheese steak.

wVv8-yw8wlzDyYJMDEXFVw.review_text: Whole Sub California cheese steak w/ provolone and garlic cheese fries. Excellent drunk food. Actually, just plain excellent Philly cheese steak. The hoagie was so soft and fresh even at two in the morning.   Quick and personable service.

bQCHF5rn5lMI9c5kEwCaNA.review_text: Stopped by here late on a recent weekend afternoon. Given the North Beach location, this place was already a madhouse jammed full of drunken revelers.   Being 110% sober, I found the cheesesteaks to be pretty large, super meaty, somewhat filling, and perfectly decent, although I'm convinced the ratings here are inflated because people's views are bit "under the influence."  Indeed, part of the appeal of this place is that it's open super late every night. In any case, a perfect spot for refueling during/after a long night of rowdiness.

4hVHTZhy70Sw4gmQfk1pJg.review_text: Yesterday, the day after the Giants won the World Series, I ate here for a quick lunch. Since this eatery is at North Beach I decided to order the North Beach Cheese Steak. The meat I ordered was beef and the cheese I selected was provolone. I also ordered a side of fries, which were ok - nothing spectacular. The North Beach Cheese Steak was served to me piping hot. The aroma was addicting. I loved the crunchy, toasty bun - the ideal way of serving a hot sandwich. However I was slightly disappointed with the sandwich overall. I felt the grilled beef, along with the bell peppers and onions, was too soupy for me. There's a difference between a tender beef and a soupy beef. The juices from the grilled beef soaked the crunchy, toasty that resulted the bottom of the bun to be soggy. I've had better cheese steak sandwiches.

tfg1Nhwx94Y4GdQHLVawbw.review_text: Don't want to be a hater but I feel like some people have their beer goggles still when writing a review for this place. Yes Philly cheesesteaks are bomb and this is great when you're drunk. But if you take a sober taste and look, it is not that special. Philly cheesesteak is simple and this place gets it done but I don't see why they're better than the next one. Meat quality is average, preparation and combination is average and the seating and surroundings is pretty average as well. I thought the garlic fries had potential but fries get soggy quite fast since they were under-fried. The only thing that makes them stand out is their variety of sauces to douse your sandwich and obnoxious drunk people.

IIZ2N1-1TnkHNZZTKpYexw.review_text: One of the best, if not the best cheesesteaks I've ever had! Love this place! Garlic cheese fries were also delish!

DvcAC_nlKaTDsHcA8Slagw.review_text: There are nights when you just crave something greasy and cheesy. Busters never fails to hit the spot on nights like these.           *said nights do not always have to be drunk nights.*   The fries are forgettable but the star is really the cheese steak. It is best eaten after you've let it rest a while. You know, when the bun soaks up all the delicious juices and flavors. Yummy. I like mine original i.e. plain with just cheese and onions and I add horseradish mustard when I get home. The "North Beach" is also good though.   They are open late and it's always an interesting crowd the later it gets. Be a fly-on-the-wall and clue in to some really amusing drunk banter/TMI sweet-nothings.

kxRqfy-uHUDBUnAaNRl4fA.review_text: The best cheesesteak I will ever eat. Unless I make it out to Tony Luke's in Philly, then we'll have to see. I'm not sure if it's the juicy meat or the wonderfully diabetes filled cheese sauce, but their sandwiches never cease to make me a satisfied customer.   It's such a perfect little hole in the wall type place. Very small, counter seating and you watch them cook, but I love it. There's nothing fancy about it, order, sit down, people watch and wait for the magic.   I love the run down feel of this place and sitting in this rickety metal stools with the windows open so I'm staring right out into the city. And knowing I'm waiting for amazing food within the next five-ten minutes makes it an even better experience.

ZcSQVbrIjIxuWvSAMN9kfQ.review_text: Love this place best cheese stake I ever had!

p57RiwsO848tOLpPVA7iEg.review_text: I love to grab a cheesesteak and some garlic fries and head up to Washington Square Park. Yummy!

K0DjfNBSbmKVgHzDrn1pOg.review_text: loooove philly cheesesteaks! I just came here for the first time this past weekend, and it made for a nice lunch.  The place is decently priced, especially for SF, and if you share a large with someone, it's really reasonable, especially since the large portions are significant. I didn't get the fries here though, so I'll have to try it next time.  There is only some counter space and 2 outdoor tables, so I can imagine it could get crowded sometimes here.  Also, you should definitely try the original philly style cheesesteak with the cheese whiz! mmmm soo yummmmmy.

2gP8s5dOJmwVKVm0GNMU0w.review_text: The garlic cheese fries are out of this world. They are worth the smell that may linger on your breath for some hours after... yes, they really are that good

WCoCQQKN5jfu731pfOt1oQ.review_text: offff the Hook if someone makes a better one please bring it .... 4 stars just because i have been to philly .... the last star will always stay there

MwJB47qFKY2yN1DERwy9VQ.review_text: This place is overrated and super dirty inside. Cheesesteak lacks enough meat. Fries are above average. You're better off going across the street to Giorodono Bros or head to te marina and go to Jakes Steaks.

jwVgUfQ7Zf2JEPUsdaHbog.review_text: If your craving a quick, big, delicious greasy burger this is the place to go. Only thing that was a bit sketchy was how the grill cook touched raw meat and then handled the bread and vegetables with the same gloves. Kitchen was a bit messy. Since my friend and I didn't get food poisoning and it was a damn good burger and bread I seriously have no complaints. We both order busters burger and it was satisfying.

DaXQq8vDrtBV2rn-KjubeA.review_text: I give this place two stars because they lied to me. I was walking around smelling other people's food at those Italian restaurants on Columbus when I saw this sign: "BEST Phili Cheesesteaks!" And in small print below it, "...or we'll change our name."  So we went in expecting a mind-blowing cheesesteak but it was just an average SF cheesesteak, not a juicy, cheesy, flavorful Phily. We also came in after midnight so the bread wasn't fresh, but damnit change the sign to "mediocre wanna-be cheesesteaks," at least once the bread isn't soft anymore.  What I really love about the place is the flat screen TV playing funny music videos by flamey Europeans. Thanks to this place, I know who Georgie Porgie is.

jhPAC7UyPiRFNPlNQYMMXg.review_text: 4 stars for being open late! Nothing hits the spot after a night of binge drinking like a greasy cheesesteak sandwich and chili cheese fries!  I don't know what I can write in here, because this is your standard cheesesteak joint. It's definitely good, and I like the chili cheese fries here as well. 'Nuff said? (My shortest review ever lol)

OkhbONg04peRlwxiaEs-XQ.review_text: Every time I visit  SF I don't eat the day before. i get to the city and this is the first place i visit, every time. The cook is very cool and always asks me if my cheesecake was satisfying. I love this place. true definition of good food downtown.

1ffUgXjNMgPbxHO-SnQ55A.review_text: My favorite cheese steak place in north Beach. Very good price and delicious food. My #1 choice is cheese steak with mushrooms. The place is open until late (because all these girls from strip clubs eat there) so it's very convenient(not the girls but the time). I eat there at least once a week.

4R9CLQnsqrLzueFPDw2w-A.review_text: It sucks because all the times I've come here, I've had to wait a really long time b/c I came right after the club. The place is always PACKED. Haven't been here in a while actually, and I don't really remember any seating inside to eat... Just a couple tables outside if you could snag one. As far as ordering, I get the regular cheesesteak sandwich and/or hot dog. Got cheese fries before, and that's pretty much all it is obvously, cheese + fries.  Love the cheesesteak. It is def a MUST TRY!

L5rgOg0CI-VoVpW49jZX-g.review_text: The best philly cheesesteak I have ever had!  I usually order the mushroom cheesesteak with provolone and cheddar.  You have to get the garlic fries as well.  A few times they messed up my fries.  The person working must have been new because I didn't recognize him.  He undercooked them, and barely put any seasoning.  But when they do make it right... I can eat the whole basket myself.  YUM!

KSDFSFW7z4L9dsv_8LwQnA.review_text: Great California Cheesesteak with avocado!  Really Liked my sandwich and the garlic fries were pretty good too!  I'd definitely recommend checking out this little establishment.

3rfNrhFpyBEPFsNWPlYAYg.review_text: First off, the menu page with the prices are not up to date on here. It says a large philly cheesesteak is listed at $7.50. When walking into the restaurant, the board actually says $9.25  I felt that it tasted okay. No surprises.  The difference between a small and a large? I have no idea. I ordered a large, friend ordered a small. Portion size they both looked exactly the size. Next time I'm just going to get a small.

zgqDGEcJ2ZBVMm_HSBw7Wg.review_text: Their philly cheesteaks are SO GOOD. Tons of steak, the right amount of cheese, topped on a fresh soft-but-crisp-on-the-outside hoagie roll.   Just to make it easy for you, THIS is how you order:  "Can I Get a full/half Philly cheesesteak WITH CHEESE WHIZ + CHEDDAR CHEESE? And also a order of garlic cheese fries. And a damn beer."  You will love me forever. If your girlfriend is an uptight, high maintenanced biatch, don't take her here because there is hardly anywhere to sit down and the few chairs they have are all hazardous...how uncool would it be to say that you broke your hip cus you fell from a chair at Buster's? Just lie and say you got attacked by a shark.   The only way to eat your philly cheesesteak is to loiter and eat it outside on the sidewalk.

dWD5j7Dg7dZUb29QbJeo4Q.review_text: So it turns out that fresh, the sandwiches are just as good. Who would of thought? I got the cheese steak with mushrooms and it was just perfect. The meat wasn't chewy, or too fatty, or too lean. It was nice and juicy and the bread was perfect because it didn't get all soggy like you get at other cheese steak places. It held its own and I will definitely be back here!

Q_8qAEFkzrzTVAJhLsxmBg.review_text: Get a Philly Cheese Steak with cheese whiz. Just do it. It's amazing... I can't say I have ever been a cheese steak fan, or even remember the last time I had one before Buster's... but this makes me walk the 10 blocks or so from my apartment and right into the front door. Cash only though, which is a pain.

NHKJowBM-8mY2Iegfc87pQ.review_text: It was a cold day with rain I was basically drench and hungry. Needed to be back in fi-di but before so there was something about Buster's that brought me in. I can think of two reasons one is that it had yellow/blue exterior or second when I was growing up there was this show call buster&me...  Anyways walk in and order the philly cheesesteak. You get a choice of 6'in or footlong I just chose 6'in boy this thing felt longer than 6'in alright. I even ask for grill onions on it. By now I'm too hungry to eat in so I ask them to wrap one half in parchment paper sheets so I can eat while walking back to fi-di. Can't go wrong here but if you have the time sit in front of counter and watch cooks at work you will be more appreciative of their line of work. Walk by here everyday but never step foot in until today. Buster's will be my on my list on days press for time and yellow exterior to brighten up your day. Now since I mention about that TV show Buster&Me it gotten me to think I'm getting old...

4jMk8LGe8c0U4lN5z7rbdw.review_text: the workers are really nice and the food isnt too pricey. but i have got to say, BEST GARLIC FRIES EVERRRRRRRRRRRRRR!!!!!!!!!!!

RpOqTpmE5hQx-IlQ3toPFg.review_text: I have been here for lunch. It's a nice little spot (especially on a warm day where you can sit outside.) You can get a full lunch, cheesesteak sandwich, fries and soda for less than 10 bucks! Prepared to order and piping hot when it gets to you.  Nice staff and fast service.  The place is really small so if you're planning to go w/a group you should plan on walking to the park or something to eat.

27oNaOGSCR1lgb7d8BdUKQ.review_text: Cheesesteaks here are the closest you will find to the real thing in Philly.. They taste great and are consistent. I always call my order and in and it is ready and hot by the time I get there..

UuxiH2oLycDhMv7TKQ5EVw.review_text: ohhhhhh ho ho ho ho yes.  This is one of those places that is soooo good it will be the death of you. This place is one of the two places in the city I will go for cheesesteaks (also see The Cheesesteak Shop on Divisadero).   The great thing about Buster's is the location. I fondly recall stumbling out of Kell's one night around 1 in the morning and happening upon people eating cheesesteaks. I was sold almost instantly. I also ordered chili cheese fries but my bastard friend ate them all before I got to them. Bastard.   Tiny place, greasy food. All around fraking awesome-ness. I dare you to get one with the Whiz. Cheese in a can, DO IT!

EnvQ3MjSovPUIVI7SQnQPQ.review_text: Have been to Busters quite a few times in the past with mixed results. However, was looking for a good sandwich and Ike's Place was closed. Decided to go for a philly cheesestake instead.   Called Busters to place a takeout order and was berated over the phone by the staff because I did not specify large or regular off the bat for the size of the sandwich. Also had an old menu that listed a food item they no longer provided (chicken parm) and, when I attempted to order it, the person was rude and abrupt.  Got the same attitude in person -- definitely not a place that is known for their customer service. Ordered the standard philly with pepper jack, which was surprisingly dry, The garlic fries were extremely salty -- so much so that my girlfriend had to put them in a strainer and shake them to remove some of the extra seasoning.   Overall a very disappointing meal and one that has completely turned me off this restaurant. I won't be back.

nNlRYWO00FvLVQx9Hp6_dw.review_text: While I was waiting on my order here some dude came in and ordered a cheese steak with no onions and no cheese. Only in San Francisco. Well, maybe in Portland too.  Anyway, Busters cheese steaks really are pretty good, but the full-size has crept up to close to 10 bucks all by itself with no drink or sides. I always thought the burgers here were underlooked. I used to get a bigass double burger as comfort food once in a while when I used to live in the area. The double seems to be off the menu now, though, but the Buster Burger is a pretty hefty size with one patty, and decent price for the quality at 6.50  Save some money and skip the fries, they're just OreIda thins or something, nothing special and not very good.

WecuAsHBDZGj7Z6_sJcQAw.review_text: Serving fantastic cheesesteaks. I think. Then again, that's a statement I am not qualified to make considering mine didn't have cheese or steak. But that is the beauty of Buster's, menu alternatives and no awkward looks when I asked for no cheese (that could have happened after I left).  Perhaps they took my order as a challenge to cram as much chicken and veggies into the wheat roll (hurray!) as possible. And this "small" was no small, closer to a large, so I can only imagine how big a large would be.  Cheesesteak or Veggiechicken, you'll be pleased.

TS2j_gt5qugbmQ1R_fq6TA.review_text: This is the best Cheesesteak place I have been able to find in SF. The rolls are exactly like the ones you would find in South Philly.  The one complaint- the guy cooking up the food appears to be only able to cook up one cheesesteak at a time for some reason. This leads to a 20-30 minute wait, which sucks if it is at lunchtime

Ppm_nqivtMfP4eFIvOm19A.review_text: It's...okay.  Does the job in a pinch.    I've been here a few times now, and it's pretty damn convenient if you're in North Beach after the bars close.  Everyone else seems to agree as there's often a line out the door weekend nights.  The food itself is tasty with lots of options, though I generally just get the regular cheesesteak with provolone.  If you're not a big fan of hot peppers on your sandwich but don't mind sweet peppers, don't bother with the peppers at all - every single time I've asked for sweet peppers more than a large number of hot peppers make their way in, usually to the point where I can't tell if they bothered listening to me or not (normally I'd ask them to fix it, but it's generally been to-go every time and we're long gone by the time I start eating).  I actually love spicy food, but there's a time and a place and this isn't it for me.   The chili-cheese fries are pretty good too.  I'd be tempted to up the rating on this place were it not for one other reality, which is that you pretty much have to have an iron digestive tract to eat here unscathed, and unfortunately I don't.  There's nothing wrong with the food per se and it's never made me ill or anything like that, but I do spend an inordinate amount of time on the toilet after eating here.  Just saying.  I'm sure I'll be back for convenience's sake, but I can think of better places for cheesesteaks in general.

bzPAvndfmgUA4Q0rcwsecA.review_text: Not a big Philly Cheesesteak fan, but gosh darn these are delicious! I absolutely love the variety of sauces you can put on your sandwiches! I am a huge buffalo sauce lover and it was a dream come true when they had that sauce there.

MhXQCjMV2uio3rr2IvdYvQ.review_text: This is where I've had the worst pizza ever here. That includes frozen and pizza I found on the ground.

LksuiNKspbDOZYNOkDx1bA.review_text: I have serious cravings for this place. No joke, post 10pm on weekdays and weekends I contemplate walking the two blocks to Busters for their standard cheesesteak. I'm a creature of habit so I haven't ordered anything besides the cheesesteak here but in a nutshell my review of their sandwich is:   Provolone + beef  = heaven.   I take the sandwich home and savor each bite, often sharing the sandwich and fries with my neighbor. You can cut the guilt of late night eating in half if you share the calories with a friend :)

ps9NxwiSFJrZ1mhgsD6IZQ.review_text: If you like steak sandwiches and chili cheese fries to avoid a morning after hangover this is the place to check out they make right there in front of you on the grill smells and tastes awesome. And I know this may sound a bit out there but if you add cheese whiz you will not regret it!

e9d8GLTHjdSMTUc6M54USg.review_text: I have to start off by letting you all know that I have not been to Buster's before midnight....that being said, this place is AMAZING!  All my friends swear by the cheese whiz, but I am a provolone guy, I save the cheese whiz for the fries.  The meat is tender the bread is bomb and after a night of North Beach bar hopping a Busters Cheesestake is just the ticket.  Do yourself a favor, this weekend, set a reminder on your phone around 1AM to hit up Busters on your way home, you won't be dissapointed....unless you are an vegetarian.

8fiCmmmUGpIU0oNn8GOVcA.review_text: Cheese and steak, two of my favorite foods. The Philadelphians should get a damn nobel prize for this great 21st century invention. And Buster's is by far the epitome of phily cheesesteaks in the city by the bay.

9nwsUQDa2vqzP2dGWQI8gw.review_text: To be completely honest, I didnt know what this place was called until I looked it up on yelp. Its known to my friends and I as "the delicious cheese steak place".  Im not sure what this tastes like when you're sober, but as far as I know, this is the best damn burgers and garlic fries in the world.  the breathe post-meal leaves a lot to be desired however,

8JVbnGi-PM47Jy4EcDwliA.review_text: Today I had my first Buster's experience after seeing it featured on TV. OMG the North Beach Cheese Steak is to die for. The spinach, zucchini, and pepper jack cheese is the perfect compliment. I picked a perfect time early afternoon on a Monday to grab a quick parking spot and a perfect sandwich. I'll be back!

Fs86jVUsCc1JHIlHs1mUmA.review_text: Buster's is *THE* quintessential late night San Francisco cheesesteak shop complete with neon lights, verbal abuse and awesome people watching potential. Located in the heart of North Beach, it's surrounded by a ton of clubs and bars. If your not inebriated, it's nevertheless likely that everybody else in the place is. Great for fourth meal or a grab and go dinner to take along to one of the nearby bars/clubs that doesn't serve food. Very small, a few seats along the window, a few at the counter, think take out. Frizzled beef, grilled onions, and Cheez Whiz on a soft roll. A great compliment to your favorite libation.

Rpd-KbHU5PAbdWmdIM94Gw.review_text: Absolutely THE BEST Philly cheese steak that I have ever tasted.  My girlfriends and I normally travel from SJ to SF just to eat at this place.  I normally order the LARGE Philly cheese steak w/ pepper jack cheese, onions, jalapenos, mushrooms, and barbecue sauce sauteed in the meat.  They used to cook it in the meat, but now they just squirt the sauce on top.  If you want it cooked in the meat now, you have to specifically ask them to do it.    You can not eat it right away because it is SO freakin hot, but then if you wait too long it gets soggy.  I personally don't like eating it while its hot.  I normally take it home and bake it in the oven at 350 degrees so that it will be nice and crispy; it is no longer soggy once you bake it.  The best way to eat it is actually after you bake it (or pop it in a toaster oven), it tastes so much better, and you can refrigerate the other half for later :).  Trust me when I tell you that baking it is 10x better than eating it while at the restaraunt.   I also order their garlic cheese fries, which are to die for, but only if you love garlic.   They come with nacho cheese sauce on them, but if you don't like soggy food, have them give it to you on the side rather than on top.  Their customer service isn't always great, but I only go for their food, NOT to make friends.  The cook seems pretty nice, and just does what he is told.  So when I leave a fat tip, its primarily for the cook, but I don't know if he even gets any of it since the tips go in a big container :(.  If you are in SF and you love cheese steaks, YOU MUST STOP AT THIS PLACE!!  The parking is a pain because its in a popular area, but well worth circling around for.  It is a hole in the wall, in a bright yellow building, so keep your eyes peeled for it when your on Columbus.  #Lifetime customer

p-ZcMqLp2vuzH9-V3s_d-g.review_text: The cheese steaks make up for any hassle you may deal with.

MzXPOK2_T5O8GF-4qUVmGA.review_text: Chili cheese fries.  Period. The best in SF.  Period. Not just when you're tipsy or hungover, either.  Seriously.  Period.  Perfect french fries, piping hot, covered w chili & creamy, cheesy greatness. That's right.  Not goodness.  Greatness.    It's not a complicated thing.  Chili cheese fries.  I know that.  We're not building bridges here, after all.  But for years & years, Buster's has been feeding me these damn perfect chili cheese fries...& they're AMAZING.  Yes, they make a kick ass cheesesteak too.  Seriously.  But the CCF have me. If you order them to go, they give them to you in a Chinese takeout box. I love that. They're open super late on weekends.   Yes, it's perfect. It does get crazy packed late on the weekends though, so you will have a wait.  But it's never too long.  And it's always worth it. Bottom line; if you like philly cheese steak, & especially if you love chili cheese fries, you owe it to yourself to come here. Period.

Bwy-o52-uXLQvWXnbq0SyQ.review_text: The location is in an area where the night life is vibrant and buzzing with insomniacs. So where do people go for a quick fix of philly cheesesteak and garlic fries in North Beach? Buster's of course! This is probably my hubby's favorite place since his fave sandwich is a philly chessesteak. And we used to go here when it was called "Original Philly Cheesesteak" and when we wanted our garlic fries fix (this during a time when not a lot of places serve garlic fries  - was that 13 years ago?)...Anyhoo, we haven't been there for the longest time, but I'm just glad there is a philly cheesesteak joint still open late at night in SF. Three stars only coz it can clog your arteries, haha!

sbbcdP1toreDe5T23E3HiA.review_text: WARNING!!!! if you have high blood pressure or cholesterol issues DO NOT EAT HERE!!!  dude, the best philly cheesesteak i've ever had. just got the small with cheddar cheese. damn it's greasy.... if you ever get drunk in the area i recommend you eat here or got the munchies...mmmmmmmmmmmm drools......

5Xci9QWwpbZg4Ng05yKOvw.review_text: The rating doesn't lie; this place is amazing.  Busters get the cheesesteak right like no other restaurant in the city.  They have the perfect blend of cheese.  The meat is always tender, not chewy or dry like some cheesesteaks I have had.  More importantly, the hours cater to the late nighter and the prices are extremely reasonable.  It's worth the trip, no matter where you are in the city.

lfVoeeBiBj-PNdeNTupoTw.review_text: hella good but the chick there pretends to be English. That's weird.

PJGD7zKksRjePnAIppFoiQ.review_text: Came here on a Thursday night so it wasn't packed and service was quick but impersonal. Bf and I shared the large mushroom beef cheesesteak with cheese wiz and cheese fries for $14.10 total. While it was slightly pricier than other places, the portions were big enough to get both of us full.   The cheesesteak was hot, packed with dripping juicy meat and cheese. It was like eating an au jus cheesesteak. The bread was soft and fluffy inside but perfectly crispy on the outside. As my bf says, "this is the real shit!" He has been to Philly, and has had authentic cheesesteaks, but he couldn't stop raising about this cheesesteak.

s-C6Lrqwy1OiLt9uhEt8jQ.review_text: I only eat the burgers here.  Get the "small" burger or you will have a stomach ache.  Fries are among the best in SF.  Overall, great SF ambiance.  Completely random people go here, so overheard conversations are *very* entertaining.  Service is so-so but the preparation is consistent.

AgfwqflEQL1VTDF3IMw9Og.review_text: What better food can you get after a night at the bar?  Of course some garlic chili cheese fries!!! Wow it smelled so good my mouth was watery before I got the chance to enjoy the tasty fries.  It's hard trying to eat while driving late at night.  The cheesesteaks were good but I prefer the fries.  Great late night snack.

nu4NZLFnJ57TIIwSsXd33w.review_text: move over Amato's in San Jose; you have been replaced.   Points earned for:  1. Being open until 3 am on weekends 2. $2.71 Bud Lights to wash it all down 3. THE JUICIEST cheesesteak  i've had on the western seaboard. Variety of cheeses, fairly priced, fresh ingredients. You can't ask for more when coming off a glorious summer evening in north beach. FREAKING GO!

Io-aIRwp_ChzddNg9X3kNA.review_text: Bruh.  Buster's!  If Golden Boy Pizza is good for in between barhopping, then Buster's is the money shot for post bar food in North Beach.  A lot of food places in SF close at 2...which makes the next morning miserable....but not Busters!  It stays open until 3!  When I'm out with a group of friends and we're at Buster's, all I hear is mmm,  shit is good, unggg, awwww yeahhhh, right there...or something to that effect.  all of it is super fresh and made to order...which is a problem, because it takes 5 minutes for your sandwich to be ready.  But damn is it worth it!  although i now live in NY and am close to Philly...all I can think about is Busters.

ySnJRrXNpbHuGYsm5mEAVA.review_text: OH MY GOD! AMAZING! Now listen, usually I don't eat meat or cheese but I was having one of those exceptionally bad hangover mornings and just needed to fill my belly with saturated goodness. Happen upon this little place with a friend of mine and decided what the hell...let's eat here! It's small, with a good vibe, standing room only and perfect for people watching. One of the best Philly cheesesteaks I've ever had. Both my friend and I ordered smalls and they were MASSIVE! Be aware when ordering that there is no such thing as small at this place! Haha, which makes it even better. Can't wait for another rough day to enjoy this sweetness of beef, bread and cheese.

RxBmMXaOdkPbj5wUT5-AWQ.review_text: 3 stars for the cheesesteaks, minus 1000 for the AWFUL ROTTEN SERVICE! completely moronic imbecile at counter. totally screwed my order up after i repeated it 5 times. got home, all wrong, including the peppers i cant eat strewn on the samich. ill never go here again.

QuLh9_7mM1o7n2HRYkvXvg.review_text: Been coming here for years for their amazing cheesesteaks.  Decided to try the bacon burger today.  Even more amazing!!!  Decisions will definitely be tough on future visits!

MIzddC7X8LRmjKK6DHaX7Q.review_text: good cheesesteak, whether you're drunk and stumbling down grant or not.

iJmo518OEAG_b9OX01p7PA.review_text: It's not very often that my expectations are met, let alone surpassed, but Buster's is a place worthy of such a praise.  I've walked past this place countless times in the past year thinking I couldn't eat here because I'm a vegetarian. Boy, was I wrong. One night I stopped in for fries. I decided to try their garlic fries which were terribly saturated in oil and just under $4 for a small, but that's another story. It was that night, however, that I noticed they had a few vegetarian options on their menu... What a nice surprise!  So tonight I decided to go there to try their Tofu Sandwich. I wasn't quite sure what to expect but I was hopeful that it would be good. I wasn't disappointed. I got the Tofu Sandwich with provolone cheese, grilled onions and zucchini, guacamole, and a side of fries. I was blown away. This is the closest approximation to a real cheese steak that I have tasted since I have become vegetarian. It definitely hit the spot.  This place is open until about 2 PM every night and 3 PM on weekends, so it's definitely going to be my late-night go-to spot from now on. The guy who works there looks a bit surly but he's actually quite nice and willing to strike up a conversation. They've got a TV here, too. The only downside is that they're cash only, but that's just about every other place in this city, so I can't fault them on that.  5 stars

D9mgcl6MFE3vRKTVadFFdQ.review_text: NOW THEY MAKE A CHEESESTEAK THE WAY IT SHOULD BE DONE.   Well at least in California anyway. Never had a real Philly but I'm guessing that Buster's comes close!  Tons (and I mean fully loaded like a rapper's Escalade) of meat oozing with cheese. YUM. And the garlic fries. Double YUM.  Buster's puts all these cheesesteak chains to shame.

bF5-57qAJKIZJgWNoVspUg.review_text: I like philly cheese steaks..........if you like philly cheese steaks go here!  Simple, great value, good honest food! Nothing fancy but unbelievably great food.  Was visiting San Francisco from Ireland and this place was recommended to me. It is was it says on the tin, if you like a good philly cheese steak you owe it to yourself to go here!   Ask yourself if you like philly cheese steaks? If the answer is yes then go to Busters!

hpffQUMlFzNVFddmmx1RUQ.review_text: I'm currently not eating here because my doctor says I'm pushing obesity. So I guess I'll just reminisce about one of my ultimate guilty pleasures in the city, which is a large Buster's cheesesteak with cheez whiz. I've never been to Philly, so I know nothing about authenticity. I have two friends who have been that say this is pretty damn close. I met a dude from Philly who said this place is a travesty. Hell, even someone commented that my picture, which shows some tasty macro-focused jalapenos is "not good, not good at all!" But you know what? I don't care. Because the steak is juicy, the cheez whiz is thick and just absolutely spectacular at palpable artery clogging. I mean, when you can actually feel your arteries being clogged while you eat, it's a good thing.   They have some other variations with different combinations of vegetables and onions, and they have five or so cheeses to choose from. Add that to the number of hot sauces on the counter (buffalo, frank's red hot, tabasco, crystal, hot garlic, barbecue), and you can customize your cheese steak exactly how you want.   This place rules, but I'm guessing a large sandwich is an average of 1,700 calories. You've been warned.

kv5EUbqppPGq3le-uzD0Vg.review_text: I haven't been to Busters after a long night out. In fact, I came by Buster's  as a result of a long night out.   The ultimate hangover cure.  Sitting outside in the sun with steaming hot cheesecake sandwiches (original!) and a side of fries - absolute heaven. It was delicious, it was perfect and the fries were enough to make my annoying healthy food obsessed friend have hand fulls.   A victory on all accounts.

zy-rneUQdmqMAEAeqRTEeA.review_text: The best Philly cheese steak that I ever had in my life.  It's so good and they make it  fresh.  I am definitely coming back more for more.

wpazdZ37epyyUslec-ujcg.review_text: Open til 3 a.m, cheap, and delicious! I gotta admit that sometimes Jack in the Box every Friday & Saturday night, week after week, gets pretty damn old so thankfully Busters is here to feed everyone's drunk ass. Cheese fries, garlic cheese fries, and cheese steaks are yammmmy. I've ate here sober before so don't think  I'm just another drunkie who remembers the food being good because everything tastes good when your drunk. The fact that this place tastes good when sober and even better when drunk is a plus!
